Title: Tax Analyst Co-op
Description:
Overview

 ** 8-12 month co-op position**



 About Intuit, Inc.


   At Intuit, we get up every morning with our hearts beating fast, driven by the knowledge that we're transforming the world of consumer and small business finance. We're obsessed with our customers. Because of this, we're continually challenging and disrupting ourselves, to improve their financial lives. It's why our products - TurboTax, Mint and QuickBooks - continue to resonate with 50 million consumers around the globe. We are a Fortune 500 fintech company, ranked as the #1 Best Workplace in Canada in 2019.
 


 Why Intuit?


   When you make doing taxes easy for customers, you do more than help them get the refunds they deserve. You empower people so they can live better lives. We work with a wide variety of customers - from first-time taxpayers to owners of complex businesses - explaining technical terms and helping them complete their taxes using TurboTax, the nation's best-selling tax software.
 


 About the Team


   Come help build our tax engine with cutting edge technology built in house. As a co-op student, you will learn how government forms are translated into code to enable our users to calculate their tax returns, build/update and run test cases and much more! We are a fast paced, but friendly and relaxed team (work life balance is more than encouraged!) Leverage your tax and tech knowledge to make an impact on the lives of our customers!
 

 What you'll bring

 Qualifications


 You're currently enrolled in an undergraduate degree seeking program
 You're interested in tax, data, and software development - preferably pursuing a degree related to Accounting/Tax/CPA
 Have an overview understanding of the Canadian personal income tax system and standards
 Some coding & data analysis experience (great to have but not required, Python, SQL)
 You're passionate about learning and are ready to take on new challenges every day



 Additional Information


    Imagine a career where your creative inspiration can fuel BIG innovation. Year-over-year, Intuit has been recognized as a best employer and is consistently ranked on Fortune's "100 Best Companies To Work For" and Fortune World's "Most Admired Software Companies" lists. Immerse yourself in our award winning culture while creating breakthrough solutions that simplify the lives of consumers and small businesses and their customers worldwide.
  


 Intuit is expanding its social, mobile, and global footprint with a full suite of products and services that are revolutionizing the industry. Utilizing design for delight and lean startup methodologies, our entrepreneurial employees have brought more than 250 innovations to market - from QuickBooks®, Quicken®, and TurboTax®, Mint.com, big data, cloud (SaaS, PaaS) and mobile apps. The breadth and depth of these customer-driven innovations mean limitless opportunities for you to turn your ingenious ideas into reality at Intuit.
  


 Discover what it's like to be part of a team that rewards taking risks and trying new things. It's time to love what you do! Check out all of our career opportunities at: careers.intuit.com.
  


 Intuit will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with requirements of local law.
  


 How you will lead

Title: Transit Planning Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 3208
Department: Transit Services Department
Service: Transit Customer Systems & Planning Service
Branch: Service Planning Branch
Employment Type: 1 Full-time Temporary Position (up to 30 months)
Work Hours: 35.00 /hours per week
Affiliation: ATU 1760
Salary Information: $58,165.38 - $82,496.96 annually (2022 rates of pay)
Location: Transit Service, 1500 St.Laurent
City: Ottawa, ON
Job Category: Transportation; Administrative and Support Services
Application Close: 25/07/2022



 JOB SUMMARY


 Transit Service Planning is responsible for service and operations planning for bus, rail and Para Transpo services (including route planning, bus stop planning, service frequency, scheduling, and bus type assignment), capital and operating budgeting for the department, transit fare policy, performance reporting, development of policies and long-range plans, establishment of service standards and design standards, delivery of the City’s transit priority program, and continuous improvement for departmental operations.
You are responsible for performing a wide range of activities that support Transit Planning initiatives. You may be required to perform any or all of the following:

conducting assessments of existing scheduled transit services to determine if services achieve service design guidelines;
conducting the annual service performance review;
developing detailed service specifications;
coordinating and conducting surveys and data collection;
managing all data and ensuring data integrity;
coordinating information on construction or other work affecting the Transitway and the greater transit system;
participating in special projects/studies covering a wide variety of operational and corporate subject matters; and
responding to customer enquiries, representing the branch at external meetings and participating in special projects as assigned.





EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE


 Completion of 4 year university degree in geography, urban planning, engineering, operations research, economics or similar field.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in transit service planning that includes experience using data analysis software and programs.




 KNOWLEDGE



Understanding of issues and principles involved in the provision of public transit in Ottawa, such as accessibility issues, local government structure and land-use planning process
Knowledge of transit planning and scheduling principles
Knowledge of survey and analysis techniques
Knowledge of applicable health and safety legislation, including the rights and duties of workers 





COMPETENCIES, SKILLS AND ABILITIES



Able to work independently with minimum supervision and collaboratively with all staff as part of a team
Possess organizational skills and flexibility to plan, organize and prioritize own work and to deal effectively with multiple demands, conflicting priorities, pressures and deadlines
Possess strong analytical skills to investigate problems
Able to interpret/analyze/evaluate large volumes of data, to make decisions and formulate recommendations
Possess computer literacy in MS Office Suite in a Windows environment, including use of the intra/Internet
Possess excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Demonstrate ability to write clear and concise correspondence and reports
Possess strong presentation abilities
Able to learn or master the use of transit related software (i.e. Hastus, MAP, APC)
Thorough and attentive to detail
Able to demonstrate sound judgement
Flexible and adaptable to deal with shifting priorities
Possess a work record of good attendance and job performance




WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW

Language Requirement: English oral, reading, writing
Driver’s License Requirement: A valid Ontario unrestricted G class driver’s license (or provincial equivalent) with no more than 6 demerit points accumulated
Experience and formal training combined with demonstrated performance and ability may substitute for stipulated academic requirements.
Please save a copy of the job poster. Once the closing date has passed, it will no longer be available.


 
We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for this position. Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.


The City of Ottawa promotes the principles of diversity and inclusion and adheres to the tenets of the Canadian Human Rights Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. We encourage applications from women, people with disabilities, Aboriginal peoples and persons of all races, ethnic origins, religions, sexual orientations, and gender identities and expressions.


The City of Ottawa provides accommodation during all parts of the hiring process, upon request, to applicants with disabilities. If contacted to proceed to the selection process, please advise us if you require any accommodation.


 Accessible formats and communication supports are available upon request. Please contact the HR Service Centre at 613-580-2424, extension 47411.

Title: Research Analyst II
Description:
Job Posting #902622
 Position: Research Analyst II Site: Toronto General Hospital Research Institute (Currently Remote) Department: Education Technology and Innovation Reports to: Research Lead and Executive Director, Education Technology Innovation Salary range: $53,490 to $66,849 commensurate with experience and consistent with UHN Compensation Policy Hours: 35 hours per week Status: Temporary Full-time (1 year)
 University Health Network (UHN) is looking for an experienced professional to fill the key role of Research Analyst II in our Education Technology and Innovation department.
 Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning.
 The University Health Network, where “above all else the needs of patients come first”, encompasses Toronto Rehabilitation Institute, Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital, Princess Margaret Cancer Centre and the Michener Institute of Education at UHN. The breadth of research, the complexity of the cases treated, and the magnitude of its educational enterprise has made UHN a national and international resource for patient care, research and education. With a long tradition of groundbreaking firsts and a purpose of “Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning”, the University Health Network (UHN), Canada’s largest research teaching hospital, brings together over 16,000 employees, more than 1,600 physicians, 8,000+ students, and many volunteers. UHN is a caring, creative place where amazing people are amazing the world.
 University Health Network (UHN) is a research hospital affiliated with the University of Toronto and a member of the Toronto Academic Health Science Network. The scope of research and complexity of cases at UHN have made it a national and international source for discovery, education and patient care. Research across UHN's seven research institutes spans the full spectrum of diseases and disciplines, including cancer, cardiovascular sciences, transplantation, neural and sensory sciences, musculoskeletal health, rehabilitation sciences, and community and population health. Find out about our purpose, values and principles here.
 The Accelerating AI in Healthcare Project is a 2-year grant that focuses on transforming the skillset, mindset and toolset of front-line healthcare professionals and leaders to build a workforce with the knowledge, skills, and capabilities to power AI enabled health practices, organizations, and systems. The project that will address the knowledge gap in how to educate and train health professionals in the effective, appropriate, safe, and compassionate use of AI. In order to put the needs of patients first in creating a healthier world using AI, the project will also involve patients in the design and development of programs.
 For more information about the project, visit our website.

   As a member of the Accelerating AI in Healthcare Core Team, the Research Analyst will provide support and 
  

Plan and coordinate various aspects of project initiatives and data collection
Assist in the design, development and delivery of project initiatives
Coordinate certificate program activities and evaluation
Conduct literature searches using PubMed, MEDLINE, or other health sciences databases
Assist in qualitative and quantitative data analysis and the interpretation of results
Assist team members with preparing materials for research proposals, progress reports, conferences, and publications
Support the planning and development of the AI for Healthcare Incubator Program



 Qualifications:


At minimum, a Bachelor’s Degree in a health-related field (e.g., health sciences, biomedical sciences, health informatics, psychology, health policy, education, nursing, occupational therapy); Master’s Degree preferred
At minimum, (3) years of related experience in a research environment; preferably as an integral part of a research team in an analyst or coordinator capacity
Ability to work with minimal supervision while achieving specific goals within tight time frames
Attention to detail and willingness to adapt, learn and take initiative in a dynamic work environment
Ability to use qualitative data analysis software (qualitative and statistical) and interpret results is an asset
Ability to collaborate and engage with people from different disciplines and with varying levels of expertise
Proficient in the use of MS Office software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook), as well as the ability to work with computerized databases
Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills and ability to exercise discretion and good judgment


 Vaccines (COVID-19 and others) are a requirement of the job unless you have an exemption on a medical ground pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.
 If you are interested in making your contribution at UHN, please apply on-line. You will be asked to copy and paste as well as attach your resume and covering letter. You will also be required to complete some initial screening questions.
 Posted Date: July 14, 2022 Closing Date: July 21, 2022
 For current UHN employees, only those who have successfully completed their probationary period, have a good employee record along with satisfactory attendance in accordance with UHN's attendance management program, and possess all the required experience and qualifications should apply.
 UHN thanks all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
 UHN is a respectful, caring, and inclusive workplace. We are committed to championing accessibility, diversity and equal opportunity and welcomes all applicants including but not limited to: all religions and ethnicities, LGBTQ2s+, BIPOC, persons with disabilities and all others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process providing the applicant has met the Bona-fide requirements for the open position. Applicants need to make their requirements known when contacted.

Title: GIS Analyst
Description:
Experience it – Ajax!
 The Town of Ajax, situated on the northern shore of Lake Ontario, is an innovative municipal sector leader that provides a variety of services to one of the fastest growing communities in Ontario. With over 130,000 residents, Ajax's rich heritage and culturally diverse community make it a great place to work and live.
 GIS Analyst
 As part of the Technology and Innovation division, the GIS Analyst will assist in the creation, maintenance, and presentation of data through a comprehensive Geographic Information System (GIS) supporting the Corporation. This position will also assist in the creation, maintenance, and quality control of the Town's enterprise GIS database and applications.
 Job Duties Include:

Create, load, manipulate, analyze, and develop geographical and associated tabular data 
Compile, format, and distribute data to Town staff, customers, and other government agencies 
Assist with developing data quality control standards and policies 
Develop and produce GIS mapping products including the design and implementation of digital maps for both external and internal customers 
Provide technical support and expertise to internal staff and the general public on technical matters related to GIS applications and products 
Provide back-up support to Senior GIS Applications Analysts in the development and maintenance of both internal and external GIS applications 
Develop and maintain the GIS enterprise database, as well as ArcGIS Online solutions 
Provide GIS training and advocate the use of GIS to Town staff 

Qualifications/Skills:

Degree or Diploma in Geography, Computer Science, Planning or a related field 
Completed post-graduate education in GIS from a recognized college or university 
 2-3 years’ experience in developing and maintaining GIS data, software, data analysis, research, and project management and/or combination of training, education and experience deemed equivalent 
Knowledgeable in core Esri ArcGIS software products (ArcMap, ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Server, and/or ArcGIS Online) 
Development experience in the following languages is considered an asset: Javascript, Python, VB, ArcObjects, ArcGIS Arcade, ASP.NET, HTML, XML 
Practical experience implementing web services is considered an asset 
Superior customer service skills 
Strong organization, time management, interpersonal and communication skills 
Ability to provide a current criminal reference check satisfactory to the Town of Ajax 

This is a unionized position that works 35 hours per week. The hours of work are Monday to Friday from 8:30 a.m. - 4:30 p.m. and are in accordance with the CUPE Collective Agreement.
 Members of CUPE bargaining unit will be considered first in accordance with the collective agreement. If there are no qualified candidates from within the bargaining unit, consideration may be given to other applicants.
 As a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, public health recommendations and restrictions are in place and may change as the situation evolves. Therefore, most work is currently being done virtually with the expectation to come into the office on a rotating or intermittent schedule. The Town is currently reviewing the business needs and the opportunity to offer a hybrid work from home option post COVID-19. A flexible work arrangement, including the option to work from home some or a majority of the time, is currently a possibility with this position, and can be discussed during the interview process.
 Deadline to Apply:
 This position is being advertised concurrently to internal and external candidates and applications are accepted online.
 Internal closing date: 11:59 p.m. on July 20, 2022
 External closing date: 11:59 p.m. on July 26, 2022
 We would like to thank all applicants however, please note that only those selected to attend an interview will be contacted and all other applicants will be kept on file. Applicants are advised that written, oral and practical testing may form part of the selection process.
 Applicants must provide a valid email address for communication purposes (one that you check on a regular basis). If your email address changes, please update your profile with your new email address.
 All Town of Ajax employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19; proof of vaccination status will be requested as a condition of employment upon hire. Medical exemptions or any other kind of requested exemption based upon the Town’s obligations pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
 The Town of Ajax is an equal opportunity employer, committed to diversity and accessibility within the workplace where all employees feel valued, respected and supported. The Town embraces diversity and gender expression through policy, staff training and providing positive spaces. The Town encourages applications from all qualified candidates. If selected for an interview, please inform Human Resources staff of any accommodation you may require during the process.

Title: Resource Planner/Analyst
Description:
Do you have a passion for forest management, resource applications and integrated resource planning? Do you have an operational forest development background and the ability to think strategically about accessing timber while meeting stewardship requirements? Are you able to use GIS and technology to support forest management decision making or to gain approvals through the enhanced approval process?


 Forsite Consultants Ltd is looking for a Resource Planner/Analyst with strong communication, facilitation skills and analytical skills to support our clients in Ontario and across Canada. The successful applicant will become a technical leader working with Forsite’s senior planners & analysts as well as clients to deliver tactical and strategic planning projects. The position requires a minimum of 5 years of forest planning experience in Canada, a Post-secondary education with a natural resource management focus and professional forester/technician accreditation.


 WHO WE ARE
 Forsite is a dynamic forest management services company serving government and industry clients for 35 years. At Forsite, we excel at being a flexible, adaptable, people oriented team that offers its employees stability, promotion, and on the job development. We offer challenging and fulfilling careers with industry leading compensation. Forsite is committed to providing a diverse, inclusive, and safe work environment for all employees.


 Forsite’s culture is one of innovation and finding solutions for our clients. We are gender diverse and inclusive and know that our team is stronger for it. We nurture a positive work environment with career growth opportunities supported by a deep bench of experience with a wide range of resource management professionals across Canada.


 WHAT YOU WILL DO
 Operating within Forsite’s Resource Management and Technology business area you will work closely with senior planners and forest analysts to provide forestry business knowledge, planning expertise and analytical support that offers cost effective, innovative, and meaningful solutions. In addition, some projects will require you to work outside of the forest regulatory process and apply your broad skill sets to meet the needs of other resource based clients. You should have a demonstrated problem solving ability, strong written and oral communications skills and an ability to comprehend and manipulate resource data within complex and challenging planning situations.


 Potential types of projects the successful candidate will contribute to include forest operational planning, fibre analyses, growth & yield programs, forest management plans, forest health planning projects, forest inventory, wildfire hazard assessments, stakeholder engagement, and carbon accounting.


 ACCOUNTABILITY:
 Time management and project budgets. Assist with marketing and sales efforts. Supervision of multiple projects / subcontractors.


 MARKETING/SALES:
 Supporting role in the development of bids and proposals. Provide feed-back for future opportunities and potential for new products and services.


 CULTURE:
 Embrace a results-focused collaborative environment. Contribute to a positive work and social environment that supports Forsite's culture.


 FOREST MANAGEMENT:
 Have a background in forestry. Be knowledgeable and experienced in tenures and permitting, timber supply, land use planning, forest management planning, forest inventory and GIS, analytics, forest estate modelling.


 ENVIRONMENT:
 Awareness of environmental management systems and ability to help clients achieve their environmental goals through comprehensive planning.


 PROJECT MANAGEMENT:
 Act as project leader on planning projects as directed by the manager. Apply specialized knowledge in forest management and project management in the successful completion of projects under your direction. Ensure project accountability is assigned and monitored. Create environment within the project team that fosters open communication and continuous improvement.


 CLIENT LIAISON:
 Support the translation of client concerns/challenges into projects designed to provide a solution. Ensure client expectations are clear and met within projects. Manage client expectations, scope issues, and billings.


 SAFETY:
 You are committed to working safely and to maintain a safe work environment for others.


 TECHNOLOGY:
 Proven ability in GIS, tablets, data analysis & data management, and MS Office suite of tools.


 COMMUNICATION/FACILITATION:
 Provide exceptionally clear written and verbal communications to ensure project inputs are correct and project results lead to informed decision making. Facilitate planning processes and presentations in order to effectively deliver projects.


 WHAT WE PROVIDE
 In addition to a challenging and rewarding work environment, Forsite provides work/life flexibility, competitive wages, a solid benefits package, supported professional development and a company matched pension program.


 Forsite is looking for the most suitable individual for the position available with the skills and knowledge to effectively complete the duties required of the position. Applications are welcome from anyone. At Forsite, we foster and sustain an environment of diversity & inclusion where everyone can reach their full potential. The position may lead to full time employment and as such, would qualify for our benefits and pension program.


 We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Title: Business Analyst/Project Coordinator to the Manager, Residential Care
Description:
Job Description: 
 


Job Title: 


    Business Analyst/Project Coordinator to the Manager, Residential Care
   




 Work Site: 


    LGH Evergreen House
   




 Status:


 Start Date:


 Hours:





 Regular Full Time
    

      As soon as possible
    

      0800-1600
    

      Days off: Saturday, Sunday, Statutory Holidays
    




 Salary: 


    $27.82 - $39.99 per hour
   




 Reference#: 


    167943-ayc
   



 Come work as a Business Analyst/Project Coordinator to the Manager, Residential Care with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)!   Vancouver Coastal Health is looking for a Business Analyst/Project Coordinator to the Manager, Residential Care to join the Evergreen House Admin Team. Apply today to join our team!

 As a Business Analyst/Project Coordinator to the Manager, Residential Care with Vancouver Coastal Health you will:

 Provide project coordination and analytical support and the coordination of recruitment/hiring and staffing functions for the designated site on behalf of and in support of the Manager to assist in the achievement of effective client care.
 Assume responsibility for operational daily staffing activities of a non-clinical nature in the absence of the Manager.
 Act as a point of contact and liaises with Employee Engagement and other corporate/specialty areas to receive/convey information and represent the interests of team.
 Provide support to the Manager on human resources, staffing, financial and service related issues, policies and procedures; completes and ensures consistent application of directives from Employee Engagement, Finance or other corporate service areas.
 Provide thorough review and analysis of information, supports the budget planning and budget management process, and prepares related reports, and coordinates project documentation, project management tools and executive reports for specific Residential Care projects on behalf of the Manager, allowing for effective risk management.
 Provide guidance, supervision and work direction to support staff.


 QUALIFICATIONS:



 Education & Experience


 Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or in a field related, supplemented by a minimum of three (3) years’ recent, related financial, human resource and business/operational analysis and project planning experience in a large, complex service organization or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.


 Knowledge & Abilities


 Demonstrated ability to lead initiatives and projects and motivate others in meeting and achieving deliverables. Shares the vision of fostering a respectful and motivating work environment.
 Uses strong analytical, research and financial abilities to support decision making.
 Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of Lean principles and practices.
 Demonstrated knowledge of human resources principles and practices and relevant collective agreements.
 Employs advanced expertise in the use of current computer applications including advanced word processing, graphics presentation, and spreadsheet computer applications to create and maintain a variety of databases, documents and reports.
 Results-oriented within a high-pressure working environment with numerous critical timelines.
 Effectively and accurately responds to the needs of stakeholders and is acutely aware of the impact of decisions and actions on the organization and various stakeholders.
 Strong verbal and written communication as well as facilitation skills to work effectively in a team setting and with a variety of stakeholders.
 Ability to identify issues, and to develop and analyze solutions to resolve problems.
 Practices diligence and care when maintaining, monitoring, calculating and summarizing data, records and confidential information.
 Optimizes program effectiveness and contributes to organizational success by applying excellent time management skills to prioritize and complete assignments and schedule activities.
 Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.


 As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order), as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.


 WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?



 VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.
 

 Comprehensive health benefits package, including MSP, extended health and dental and municipal pension plan
 Grow your career with employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
 Wellness supports, including counselling, critical incident and innovative wellness services are available to employees and their immediate families
 Award-winning recognition programs to honour staff, medical staff and volunteers
 Access to exclusive discount offers and deals for VCH staff


   Diversity, equity, and inclusion are essential to our goals of creating a great place to work and delivering exceptional care. We acknowledge and accommodate unique differences and ensure special measures are in place so that all prospective and current employees are given an opportunity to succeed.
  
 We are committed to building a representative workforce and encourage applications reflecting diversity of sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization or ancestry, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.
  
 Vancouver Coastal Health is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers in 2022.
 


 Please note that a resume is required to apply to this posting.
  
 Hours of Work may vary due to project requirements.
  

Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.



 ***Employees of VCH must apply via the 
  Internal Application Process. Refer to the 
  https://my.vch.ca/working-here/job-postings site for 
  How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***
  
 Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.

Title: BI Developer
Sr Business Insights Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. 
We believe in the talent we grow to better serve our clients, and we know, many of the ground-breaking discoveries and products that represent the future at TD, can all be driven with data. 



Job Description

About this Role
 As an expert in data and analytics, you will provide in depth expertise, analytical interpretation, key insights and action items to your multi-functional business partners across the organization. Those insights will be brought to bear to enable informed and enabled business decisions enterprise wide or help to solve the increasingly complex business problems they face. 
In this role, TD will look to as a thought leadership as well as a leader in your space, coaching, mentoring, empowering and educating your peers to collaborate and bring TD into the future of banking.
 As a Senior Business Insights Analyst, you will: 

Apply understanding of respective business strategies to produce relevant and substantial data analysis to support business goals and objectives
 Develop analysis to illustrate business trends and identify areas of business opportunities
 Produce insights and recommend business actions to align with strategy and/or solve business problems
 Provide seasoned specialized knowledge, advice and/or mentorship to various business and working partners
 Execute on data requests accurately and within a timely manner
 Represent functional area as an analytics & insights professional and key resource; build positive and productive working partnerships
 Act as a bridge to translate business requirements to analytics and reporting needs for a given domain
 Provides day-to-day support and delivery of analytics
 Work independently as the senior analyst/subject matter expert and may coach and educate others
 Considered an authority within a given area
 Oversee and/or independently perform tasks from end to end




Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD? 
Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes: 
    
Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
 Five (5) or more years relevant experience




Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Hours

    37.5

Country

City (Primary)

Work Location

    TD Centre - North - 77 King Street West

    17-Aug-2022

Title: HR Analyst
Description:
About Us
 Bally's Interactive is the digital arm of one of the world's leading entertainment providers, Bally's Corporation, with tens of millions of players across the globe and big plans always in the works. Our brands and sites include market movers and shakers like SportsCaller, Monkey Knife Fight, Vera&John, Virgin Casino, Jackpotjoy and many more. We make our mark by embracing the diversity of our global team, challenging ourselves, and striving to make a difference for our players.


 About the Role

Collects and complies HR data, metrics, and statistics from a variety of sources including the HRIS, internal surveys, exit interviews, competitors' practices, and other sources.
Analyzes data and statistics for trends and patterns and prepares reports of results.
Designs and develops reports, dashboards, presentations, and other visual management tools to display trends and insights.
Runs weekly and monthly reports as required.
Provides support in the development of HR policies and procedures and ensures all HR policies and procedures are kept updated.
Point-of-contact for employee questions on policy and procedures.
Assists with HR projects and initiatives that support the HR Roadmap and key business objectives.
Provides project coordination including preparing project plans, overall tracking, and monitoring of project activities.
Processes changes of employment (such as salary, working hours, job title, team changes, etc.), ensures these are submitted accurately on the HRIS, approved, and paperwork is issued in a timely manner.
Processes leaver administration, including processing termination in HRIS, termination paperwork, calculating payments such as vacation or deductions, arranging exit interviews, ending employee benefits, and coordinating with Workplace Experience and Facilities staff on return of company property.
Facilitates the on-boarding and orientation process with new employees.
Prepares Offer of Employment letters, promotion letters, transfer letters, and other employee letter requests (e.g., Confirmation of Employment).
Enrolls employees in health & dental insurance and administers other benefits.
Organizes and maintains employee records.
Retrieves invoices and sends to AP team.
Establishes and manages the document management process for all documents and all other information resources and following relevant document retention schedules.



 About You

2+ years of experience in a reporting function—exporting data from reporting systems and manipulating data in Excel, creating charts, spreadsheets, and presentations.
Strong PowerPoint, Word, and Excel skills.
Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret and communicate data.
Proven ability to use and navigate HRIS for data entry, reporting, etc.
Understands common HR concepts, practices, procedures, and related employment legislation.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.
Teamwork orientation balanced with a sense of ownership and the ability to work independently.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Exceptional interpersonal and problem-solving skills.



 Desirable

Previous working experience with SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central.
Knowledge of project management procedures and processes.

What's in it for You:

Competitive salary with annual performance bonus
Employee Share Purchase Plan
Comprehensive health coverage plan that includes medical, dental and vision
Monthly wellness program
Paid Vacation and RRSP contribution matching
Access to exciting educational opportunities (internal, conferences, courses, certifications)
Need something for your home office? Whether it's a new mouse, desk or chair, we're here to support you with a productive and safe home working space

We also believe in providing an environment where employees can flourish – you'll be working in a very modern work environment – and we will make sure you will also have enough time to unwind with our monthly office events and team-building activities.
 This is Bally's Interactive and we're here to make gaming everything it should be. You'll have fun making fun every day, and that's a promise.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for a job in a dynamic, fast-paced environment that requires strong analytical and communication skills? Do you have experience with data visualization software? Are you someone with excellent time-management and organizational skills? If so, we have an outstanding opportunity for you!
  
 The Business Analyst will require these skillsets and will support the analytical needs of the organization. The individual will be reporting to the Director, Operations and Operational Excellence. The jobholder can work from head office or remotely.
  
 Key Objectives:
 


 Support internal stakeholders for ad-hoc requests by extracting, manipulating and analyzing the data for ongoing programs
 Support program managers in analyzing and preparing presentations for business reviews
 Perform analysis related to targets selection and territory design for sales representatives


 Support program managers during program launches by pulling and staging data from different data sources
 Help maintaining data accuracy for BD team activity and performance measurement
 Support Business Units in performing margin analysis and developing costing templates
 Performs analyses related to the database of physicians and e-consents
 Gather and provide insights about HCPs behavior by analyzing data captured through various interactions and services
 Supports Business Units in monthly billing reporting, budgeting and resource planning analysis
 Preferably able to perform forecasting and NPV analysis for ongoing programs and new business opportunities
 Create and present business dashboards to leadership team


 Proactively bring forward new ideas towards continuous improvement initiatives for the team



 Job Holder Specification:
 

 University Degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, Finance or other related fields
 Fluently bilingual English and French (oral and written)
 Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Office with a focus on Excel & Access is required
 3-4 years of relevant experience preferably in pharmaceutical industry
 1-2 years of experience working with data visualization software – Tableau or Power BI is required
 Experience with manipulating and interpreting large data sets, including IQVIA data
 Must possess strong analytical aptitude and attention to detail
 Strong writing and communication skills, ability to articulate complex technical requirements in a simple to understand manner
 Demonstrates advanced troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
 Able to adapt and quickly develop in-depth technical understanding of new/different applications
 Excellent time-management and organizational skills
 Customer focused and a team player
 Strong business acumen, emotional intelligence and results driven

Title: BI & Reporting Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

Department Overview  If you love data and have a good analytical mind this position represents an exciting challenge for you! You will thrive in a dynamic team whose mandate is to deploy and implement Business Intelligence projects for TD Insurance. You will be asked to produce the requirements related to reports and/or change requests, using company data. These elements will allow you to work with a team of dynamic professionals who understand and define different business needs in line with strategic initiatives within TD Insurance. Finally, this position offers excellent career opportunities within the TD Bank Group.



Job Description

What you will be doing in this role:  The incumbent is responsible for initiating and managing Large and Medium-sized business change requests and ensuring they are successfully conducted in line with the company's priorities.

 Document Business Intelligence requirements for our Business partners;
 Document business rules and validate data mappings;
 Perform impact analysis.
 Communicate business needs to the teams responsible to define the business rules and development, so that they can design and propose solutions.
 Support related teams in the investigation and design of business solutions;
 Collaborate in the selection of the best solutions;
 Present and validate with the business partners the alternative(s) of proposed solution(s).
 Must be able to understand different operational systems: systems functioning (engineering concept), what they contain (understanding available data, investigating data, etc ...).
 Must show strong adaptability to discuss with different stakeholders in terms of expertise, training and hierarchy.




Job Requirements

What you will bring to the team:

 Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant discipline.
 At least 2 years of relevant experience in Business Intelligence projects/Reporting.
 Knowledge in data extraction and manipulation (Impala/Hue/DBeaver/SAS/SQL)
 Excellent communication: Bilingual (English and French).
 Know how to manage time and multiple projects simultaneously.
 Demonstrate highly developed analytical skills.
 Be rigorous and quality conscious.
 Work efficiently in a team setting.

 Assets

 Knowledge of property and casualty insurance business in Canada
 Jira/Confluence, Agile methodology.




Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: QA Analyst - ETL and Database Testing
Description:
Dawn InfoTek Inc. is a professional IT consulting team that partners with major financial institutions, investment firms and government sectors. We have been dedicated in delivering cutting-edge consulting services and recruiting all levels of IT positions for our clients.
We are currently seeking competent individuals to fill the role of QA Analyst on our dynamic team for our client, one of the big five banks
Responsibilities: 

Develop, Execute test plans, scenarios, scripts or procedures
Test system modifications for areas such as database impacts, software scenarios, or usability
Document software defects, using a bug tracking system, and report defects to software developers
Identify, analyze and document problems with program function, output, online screen and database validations
Monitor bug resolution efforts and track successes
Plan test schedules or strategies in accordance with project scope or delivery dates
Develop, maintain and communicate (stakeholder presentation) delivery status, KPI and metric scorecards, quality checks and knowledge management solutions.
Perform test execution and present roadmap as needed.
Communicating with an average of three other QAs, Scrum master, developers, etc. from the same lab

Candidate Requirements: - 3+ years of ETL and database testing- 3+ years of SQL experience- 2-3 years for API testing experience preferably with Postman

Toronto, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

ETL and database testing: 1 year (required)
SQL: 1 year (required)
API testing experience preferably with Postman: 1 year (required)

Title: Business System Analyst - NFN
Description:
At Parkland, our purpose is to Power Journeys & Energize Communities. We are a prominent independent supplier and marketer of fuel and petroleum products and a leading convenience store operator. As One Parkland team, we proudly serve diverse retail, commercial and wholesale customers across Canada, the United States, the Caribbean region, and South America. We power a growing family of locally known brands including M&M Food Market, Fas Gas Plus, Pioneer, RaceTrac, Superpumper, Ultramar, Chevron, Esso, and ON the RUN.
 We recognize that diversity gives us an edge and inclusion propels us forward. We’re also a passionate team of down-to-earth achievers, committed to getting our customers, colleagues and communities further, faster. As such, we welcome talented individuals that have a variety of perspectives, backgrounds, and industry experience who will contribute to the success of our One Parkland team.
 Position Title: Business System Analyst - NFN
 Team and Location: IT – Calgary, AB or Montreal, QC
 Position Summary:
 NFN stands for National Fueling Network. It is a program offered by Parkland to consolidate multiple card offerings for our commercial cardlock and retail fleet customers across Canada. This will allow our customers to fuel using one card at different Parkland brand stations and receive one invoice.
 Using the WEX platform, customers will use an NFN branded card for their fueling needs at accepting locations. Transactions will be recorded by WEX and passed to Parkland for processing. The sales and invoicing will be managed on the Parkland JD Edwards ERP system and will be passed back to WEX for customers to view on their eManager portal.
 The Business System Analyst– NFN will:

 Leverage Business process and technical skills to close communication gaps between business, Development, and other teams.
 Analyze user needs, develop user stories and acceptance criteria to meet them.
 Work on the product backlog, ensuring that it is visible, transparent, and clear to all.
 Focus on Service Level metrics and Key Performance indicators to meet / exceed targets.
 Collaborate with teams to identify and mitigate risks and to fix technical problems.
 Manage feature inter-dependencies with other development and Business/Operations teams.
 Actively work with development stages, Sprints, and stories. Identify and organize the steps for the next iteration.
 Act as a single point of contact for assessing NFN related issues.

 Key Responsibilities:
 Support

 Assessing / Triaging NFN issues.

 Business Analysis

 Meeting with stake holders (i.e. End users, Operations, Vendors) for requirements.
 Creating user stories, work with stake holders on Sprint cycles.

 QA Test Design, Coordination and Planning

 Creating Test Cases, Scenarios, Updating Test Scripts.
 Coordinating testing for updates and enhancements.

 Documentation and Reporting:

 Updating workflows to ensure documentation is up to date.
 Creating support documentation.
 Report Design and analysis.
 Report on each sprint cycle.

 Qualifications and Skills:

 Degree in Information Systems or equivalent experience.
 IIBA (CBAP) certification an asset.
 Good understanding of SDLC and SaaS concept.
 Minimum of 5 years' experience in the following areas:
   
 Business Analysis.
 Project Management.
 QA test design.

 Knowledge of Process design tools (i.e.: MS Visio, Lucid chart, Draw.io).
 Proficiency in the use of Data analytic tools including Power BI, Tableau, SQL, and DAS.
 Data literacy.
 Solid understanding of ERP Systems and integrations (Finance, Supply, Pricing modules an asset).
 Knowledge of JD Edwards is an asset.
 Ability to prioritize effectively and manage multiple tasks.
 Excellent organization skills.
 Innovative skills including Curiosity, Agility, Strategic.
 Outcome-focused approach.
 Exceptional knowledge of user-centered design principles.
 Proficient in both oral and written communication, able to communicate to both IT and Business users.
 Ability to collaborate with large teams.
 Excellent technical, diagnostic, and troubleshooting skills.
 Understanding of design quality standards.
 Knowledge of POS systems and fueling process nice to have.
 Excellent customer service skills, ability to show empathy and professionalism.
 Proficiency in being able to see the bigger picture.

 We Offer:

 Our Performance-based Annual Incentive Plan, an annual bonus awarding your performance.
 A share in our success through the Employee Share Purchase Plan and 100% company matching.
 A flexible group benefit plan that offers health and dental coverage choices to meet the needs of each unique employee. Inclusive of life and disability insurances, Health Care and Lifestyle Spending options, and a supportive Employee and Family Assistance Program.
 Participation in Parkland Pledge, an employee-driven charitable giving program.
 An employee referral program – earn up to $2000 for your referral.
 In-house learning and development opportunities, leadership training, international opportunities.
 Discount Programs and Educational Scholarship Programs for family members.
 A safety focused work environment and ongoing safety training.

 Please note:

 Candidates must be legally able to work in Canada at this time. Parkland regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas.
 Parkland Corporation is committed to the principles of Employment Equity. We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview.
 Please note that final candidates for this position will be required to undergo a confidential pre-employment background check which may include but not be limited to educational, criminal, credit, drug and alcohol and/or Fitness for Duty testing.

 This position will close when a successful candidate is found.
 #LI-AL1

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
Join the team that is building a trusted internet for Canadians! CIRA is best known for managing the system that keeps more than 3 million .CA domains running as smooth as maple syrup, but we do so much more to help Canadians thrive on the internet.  Whether it’s our cybersecurity products that protect Canadians online, our advocacy work that fights for better internet access, or our Community Investment Program that supports dozens of community-based internet projects across Canada — we work every day to keep the internet strong and free! Join us!


 Who you are


 Reporting to the Director, Planning and Risk, you will be integral to enabling across CIRA initiatives. In this role, you will facilitate the elicitation and documentation of business requirements which will include in-depth analysis and process modeling, you will work directly with client groups to identify business needs, solution design, implementation and support. You are passionate about optimizing, innovating and enabling change!


 What you’ll do


With an understanding of the overall strategic objectives and priorities, work with stakeholders to support the gathering of requirements of the end state vision using a variety of techniques, including interviewing, facilitated sessions, surveys and documentation review.
Develop requirements and analysis documents utilizing a variety of conceptual and logical process/data modeling techniques including business process models, data flow models and workflow models.
Perform business process re-engineering and identify and utilize the appropriate business modelling tools (e.g. case modeling techniques, workflow modeling, business process modeling, user stories).
Identify opportunities to improve efficiency of business processes and increase adoption and integration of applications.


Develop test strategies and plans, including coordination of the User Acceptance Testing (UAT) phase of business process and internal application related projects.
Support internal business partners with system optimization including analysis, adoption, and operation of Microsoft Business Central and other corporate systems.



 What you bring


Minimum of 5 years demonstrated experience in business process requirements, analysis and process management methodologies and approaches.
Experience leading and facilitating workshops and discussions with stakeholders to gather information to inform the way forward.


You have experience leading the development of business cases, including environmental scans, risk assessments, performance measures and developing recommendations.
Level of education, training and experience equivalent to an undergraduate degree in Business Administration, Computer Science or equivalent.
Familiar with gathering information using workshops, one-on-one meetings, process charts and other proven techniques for the purpose of understanding the business needs and to effectively communicate requirements in the form of written documents
Experience working with different business units, including IT, and assisting with the gathering of business requirements, performing business and process modeling and making suggested improvement initiatives associated with custom development or packaged solutions.
Experience utilizing a variety of basic conceptual and logical process/data modeling techniques including business process models, data flow models and workflow models.


Experience in testing including knowledge of test strategies, plans and execution.


Experience in assisting in designing workshops and facilitating groups and work team sessions to gain input from key contributors.
Experience with Microsoft Business Central or other ERP systems.



 Who we are
 We are a not-for-profit, purpose-driven organization with a dynamic team that helps shape the internet in Canada. Our team is full of high performers and creative thinkers who come to work every day and ask, “What more can we do?” because they believe in the CIRA mission to build a trusted internet for Canadians. It is our team and our mission that has led CIRA to be named one of the National Capital Region’s Top Employer seven years in a row.
  At CIRA, we foster relationships and build communities - online and off. We strive to be a place where talented people come, stay and do their best work. We are committed to employment equity and encourage anyone who can contribute to the diversification of ideas and perspectives to apply.  If you require a reasonable accommodation during any part of the CIRA candidate experience process, please contact us at peopleandculture@cira.ca.


 COVID-19 Information: In accordance with our mandatory vaccination policy, we will only interview people who have been fully vaccinated, or who have a valid medical exemption.

Title: Commercial Analyst
Description:
Company Description
  Elvium Life Sciences focuses on our existing products in the areas of CNS (ADHD) and ophthalmic conditions while continuing to advance on research and enhance treatment options for Canadians. Elvium Life Sciences is a member of the Mundipharma network of associated companies.



 Job Description
  About this role
 We are looking for a Commercial Analyst to join our team at the Purdue Pharma (Canada)/Elvium Life Sciences Head Office in Markham, Ontario. This role reports directly to the Manager, Business Insight and Commercial Operations and acts as a strategic partner providing action-oriented insights and technology solutions to the Commercial Team. These insights will come through comprehensive understanding of CRM platforms (Veeva, Salesforce), analysis and interpretation of various primary and secondary data sources (IQVIA), and proficiency with Business Intelligence tools (Power BI, Tableau). . This analyst will also partner with local and global teams to implement our digital strategy, and evolve our omnichannel approach towards customer-centricity and valuable engagements.
 This is a permanent position that is pivotal in supporting the evolving needs of the organization. Hours of work are 37.5 weekly with the opportunity to work from home and in the office, when required. You will be joining an organization and a team that prioritizes our patients and customers, is dedicated to commercial excellence, and is focused on doing the right thing.
 Responsibilities

 Leads the data visualization and CRM activities as the subject matter expert for Commercial Operations, including managing projects to optimize functionality, driving alignment with end user requirements, and expanding utilization to support larger corporate strategy.
 Performs hands-on data extraction, manipulation, analysis, interpretation, insight generation, and presentation of internal corporate data for marketed products and data purchased from external vendors (IQVIA, Neilson, etc.) to monitor Commercial and Sales performance to objective, assist in building narratives for our brands, and to aid development / adjustment to our commercial strategies.
 Fosters strong working relationships with key internal and global stakeholders such as Sales, Marketing, Global IT, and Veeva to conduct ad-hoc analyses, align on issues and solutions, and meet Asset team and corporate objectives.
 Drives primary market research activities for current and pipeline products, including research design, vendor engagement, implementation, analysis and presentation of results.
 Transforms primary and secondary market research findings into actionable insights to positively impact sales and marketing activities.
 Monitors marketplace and product performance trends and uses this data to generate scheduled and ad hoc data reports to provide business analytics and strategic insights to Asset team and other internal stakeholders.
 Assists Marketing and the Asset team in the development of short and long-term sales forecasts by building a model and/or performing market analysis or research to source data that supports assumptions




 Qualifications
  Requirements

 Bachelor’s degree in Business and/or Science
 At least one (1) year of experience in a role conducting data analysis and insights generation
 Experience with the development and administration of a CRM platform (Veeva preferred) and/or business information reporting platform (Tableau / PowerBI preferred)
 Local and national travel up to 5%

 Knowledge and Skills

 Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, including strong Excel skills for data analysis and PowerPoint presentation preparation and presentation skills for communicating data insights to internal stakeholders
 Robust business acumen and analytical skills
 CRM administration (experience as Veeva administrator preferred)
 Business Information tool dashboard design and deployment
 Marketing / digital marketing experience preferred
 Collaborative, consultative approach to working with colleagues
 Ability to communicate and present data that tells a meaningful story to engage customers and colleagues
 Attention to detail, multi-tasking and organizational skills, essential in managing the requirements of a fast-paced and agile business

Title: Business Improvement Analyst (MOS™)
Description:
Magellan Aerospace is a global, integrated aerospace company that provides complex assemblies and systems solutions to aircraft and engine manufacturers, and defence and space agencies worldwide. At Magellan we have over 80 years of collective knowledge and experience in the aerospace industry, and believe one truth: People create value. 

 Employees are our greatest resource in working towards a successful future, and together we build professional relationships that thrive. We know that personal development is fundamental to the success of every individual and invest in our employees. 

 When you are part of Magellan, you are part of the team! 

 Position Summary 

 The Magellan Operating System™ (MOS™) is the Magellan way for success; it is incorporated into all functions of the business and drives our operational excellence. As a member of the Corporate MOS™ team, the Business Improvement Analyst will work to establish & monitor adherence to Magellan best practices, solve problems, and take action to improve business performance. This role provides diverse hands-on experience at both the corporate and divisional levels while developing management and leadership skills, and positions the individual for rapid growth within the organization. This position allows for the opportunity to transition towards a new career path within Magellan Aerospace post 2-3 years. This is a permanent full-time position based out of the corporate office in Mississauga, Ontario. 

 Essential Responsibilities 

 Travel to different divisions and perform hands-on operational audits (auditing to MOS™ standards for all business functions including S&OP, Production Control, Customer Service, etc.) 

 Develop detailed reports, present conclusions and recommendations to senior corporate and divisional staff; identify improvement opportunities and assist in implementing solutions 

 Create agendas and assign action items towards larger goals as directed by supervisors 

 Support the activities of MOS™ councils and provide council leadership as required. 

 Conduct in depth analysis to identify the root cause of problems and direct improvement efforts 

 Analyze corporate wide KPI data and reporting, manage divisional submissions and follow up as necessary. 

 Follow up on divisional MOS™ and initiative action items, assist in implementation. 

 Contribute to the creation of policies, procedures, presentations and training materials. 

 Participate in continuous improvement / business improvement events or projects to improve processes and business performance (eg. Master scheduling and production planning, Capacity Planning, Inventory Reduction, On-Time performance, etc.) 

 Provide consultation and support to divisions as necessary (eg. Planning & Scheduling, Inventory Management, analysis etc.) 

 Create best practice processes & tools to improve performance and compliance 

 Primary functions 

 Operational auditing 

 Business Improvement & Continual Improvement activities 

 Divisional support & consulting 

 Standardization of best practices 

 Project management 

 Analysis and reporting 

 Training 

 Desired Skills 

 Detail oriented with strong analytical skills and mastery of MS Excel 

 Able to communicate requirements effectively 

 Ability to translate ideas into action, taking a hands on approach where needed 

 Must work well as a member of a team and collaborate on a daily basis 

 Ability to facilitate groups and assert influence 

 Ability to present to senior managers and various sized groups; to summarize and express conclusions convincingly with confidence and assertiveness 

 Position Requirements 

 Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Engineering, Business Administration, or Management 

 Ideally have 1-2+ years’ experience as a hands on practitioner in one or more of the following areas: Production Planning, Master Scheduling, Operations, Supply Chain, Production Control, Continual Improvement 

 Experience using Continuous Improvement tools and Lean Six Sigma, as well as a LEAN Six Sigma certification is preferred 

 Manufacturing experience an asset 

 Willingness to travel 40% of the time is required 

 Experience using ERP systems is an asset 

 High proficiency with MS Office Suite (superior Excel and PowerPoint skills 

 Familiarity with business finance fundamentals 

 Ability to lead teams and assert influence 

 Ability to apply critical thinking skills during on-site visit based on corporate-defined principles 

 Why Magellan? 

 Competitive salary 

 Attractive benefits package (fully Company paid) 

 Generous Company pension plan 

 Positive work-life balance 

 Excellent career progression opportunities 

 Employee Assistance Program 

 On-site gym 

 Free parking 


COVID-19 Protocol:
 Magellan Aerospace is committed to providing a safe and healthy work environment for our employees. Magellan’s policy states that the use of face masks is mandatory, this is consistent with applicable legislation and guidance from occupational health and safety regulators. All employees and visitors who enter our premises are screened for COVID-19 symptoms and are required to practice social distancing at all times. We have ensured that hand-sanitize stations are easily accessible and enhanced cleaning schedules have been implemented on a daily basis. Magellan supports public health guidelines and encourages employees to get vaccinated. Although mandates are not a requirement at Magellan, this may be subject to change and offers of employment may be contingent on vaccination status with respect to changes in legislation. 

 Confidentiality 

 Magellan Aerospace respects the privacy and confidentiality of personal information provided by candidates and shall not disclose to any external parties unless legislated. 

 Magellan Aerospace is committed to an inclusive working environment and equal opportunities for all. We welcome all applications without regard to social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation, national origin or religious belief

Title: Business Process Analyst
Description:
Company Description
  Bantrel is proud to be a leading provider of Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC) services in Canada.  Since our inception in 1983, we have delivered end-to-end solutions for some of Canada’s most challenging and complex energy, mining and infrastructure projects, with an unrelenting focus on safety, while delivering to the highest degree of quality. Bantrel performs design and procurement services from our Calgary, Edmonton and Toronto offices and delivers construction management and self perform construction services at various Client sites across Canada.  Our global reach and local touch is demonstrated by our affiliation with our parent company, Bechtel Corporation, one of the largest EPC companies in the world, and with McCaig Investments, a Canadian owned private company with longstanding ties to the local business community.
 www.bantrel.com
 Bantrel Co.: My Company | LinkedIn



 Job Description
  Bechtel is among the most respected engineering, project management, and construction companies in the world. Bechtel operates through four global business units that specialize in infrastructure; mining and metals; nuclear, security and environmental; and oil, gas, and chemicals. Today, our colleagues team with customers, partners, and suppliers on diverse projects in nearly 40 countries.
 Bechtel Infrastructure, along with key sub-vendors Bantrel and Comtech, has been appointed the Delivery Partner role within an integrated team with the customer, Metrolinx, for the Ontario Line Subway (OLS) Project. The project scope includes the design build, operations and maintenance of all infrastructure and rail systems associated with 16km of new alignment, 15 new stations and related works being performed by three key P3 Contractors and multiple advanced early works (EAW) packages Contractors. Bechtel’s team forms the key component of the overall leadership team, having delivery partner responsibilities supported by two other components, Technical Advisor (TA) and Program Controls Services Consultant (PCSC).
 In this full-time permanent role, you will be a champion of diversity & inclusion.
 Job Responsibilities:

 Examine existing procedures, work instructions, reports, forms and dashboards content, capture suggestions from users, identify any gaps, propose amendments, update the documentation, obtain necessary approvals and launch the new procedure/work instruction/report/form/dashboard.
 Communicate with each area manager and discipline (Scheduling, Cost Control, Construction, Procurement, Contracting, Quality, Safety, Risk, document control, etc) for their needs of data display in report/form/dashboard.
 Prepare formats of reports, forms and dashboards using information from various source disciplines in the project for topics such as schedule, progress, quantities, direct and indirect labour, look ahead, Quality, Health, Safety and Environment, etc.
 Interact with experts in systems architecture, Power-BI, Power Apps, and Microsoft forms to connect the Reports/ Forms and Dashboards to the data sources of various applications or the Common Data environment. Help conceptualize creative graphic and artwork with the logic of drill-down principles to present the data.
 Prepare user guide write-ups addressing various issues such as access rights, forum for display, drill-down capabilities, record keeping, chronicling, timestamping for forensics, etc. for each of the new report and dashboard.
 Write procedures work instructions that support the user guides.
 Organize training sessions for the teams to familiarize the report/dashboard/procedures and user guides.
 Candidates that can create new reports/dashboard in power Apps, Microsoft Forms, and Workflow, where IS&T specialists may not have enough bandwidth, will be preferred.




 Qualifications
 

 Minimum 5 years' experience in supporting projects and contracting industry. Preference will be given to candidates with application integration experience of 2+ years.
 University Degree or a minimum 4-year diploma after completion of high school. Preference will be given for a degree in computer engineering or Computer science.
 Software: Working knowledge of Microsoft SQL, Data Lake/Data warehouse for integrating various independent applications (Arc GIS, Primavera, etc) and Microsoft Forms and Power App based tools in a web/SharePoint/Teams based interface, Advanced level knowledge of MS Word, EXCEL, and PowerPoint.
 Strong communication skills (written and verbal).
 Ability to work autonomously within the Project role and interface with a wide cross section of project personnel.
 Ability to explain the user guides concepts clearly and succinctly.
 Ability to perform under stress and meet tight deadlines.
 Works in a fast-paced project environment with ability to respond to changing priorities from different levels of the organization.

 Additional Information
  Please note there is a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy in place. Prospective employees will not be asked to disclose their vaccination status and only successful candidates will be asked to provide proof of vaccination and/or to seek accommodation pursuant to the mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy prior to starting work.
 We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for further review will be contacted. All other resumes will be retained for future consideration.

Title: Media Experts - Analyst, Audience & Analytics
Description:
General information 
        




Agency: Media Experts 
Job Function: Data & Analytics 
Location: Toronto, Canada 
Job Ref#: 11714 









         Description & Requirements 
        






Position Summary 



          As an analyst on the Audience and Analytics team, you will be positioned for rapid growth and gain hands-on experience working on advanced marketing analysis and measurement projects. This position offers the chance to work with engaged client teams, a variety of media and analytics platforms and data sources, all supported by a strong internal system.
         




Key Responsibilities 



Providing data and analytics services to our customers:

Leverage data feeds from various media data sources and our global harmonized Business Intelligence (BI) reporting tools to create holistic performance reports
Create, modify, run, automate and document "ETL" (SSIS) programs. 
Participate in the modelling, creation, modification of database structures for the data warehouse data. 
Create data visualizations to communicate your key findings to specific audiences

Developing optimal processes for performing analytics

Be the subject matter expert and educate the extended team on learnings across the various platforms
Assist in ongoing processes and decisions around data storage
Collaborate with other specialists in their sector to define the rules of governance and standards surrounding the practice of business intelligence. 

Draw on expertise of functional experts within internal teams to continually develop skills and capabilities





Desired Skills & Experience 



Fluency of R, Python, SQL, Access, and/or any other advanced analytics software package
Knowledge of PostgreSQL database management
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Advertising, Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or related field. OR equivalent professional work experience
Data Visualization experience (Tableau, DOMO, Datorama, Data Studio)
1-2 years’ experience including data extraction, manipulation, analysis, and reporting
Advanced knowledge and proficiency in use of Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint & Access
Proactive project management skills: able to manage multiple projects’ timelines simultaneously
Good interpersonal skills: able to maintain positive working relationships with a wide set of internal and external contacts
Technically-minded with a desire to learn about data, marketing and the future of adtech
Ability to make the complex simple when describing processes to audiences who might not be so expert in martech
Nice to have: Working knowledge of media metrics and digital media reporting platforms such as DCM, SA360, Facebook, DSPs and other digital reporting platforms


What do we prioritize at 
Mediabrands
 & 
Kinesso
 Canada? Putting People First.
          

Here’s a few of the ways we do this:




          Investing in Your Career Growth: 42% of staff across Canada were promoted last year. With a network of agencies in Canada and over 130 offices worldwide, we support your professional goals locally and globally. #likeaboss
          
 Promoting Flexible Working: A hybrid workweek that works for you! Prefer to work from another country? We have the opportunity to work from anywhere in the world for 6 weeks each year. #youdoyou
          
 ❤️ Prioritizing Your Wellbeing: We start with a minimum of 37 paid days off including vacation and monthly wellness days. We also have 4-day long weekends year-round, meeting-free Friday afternoons, half-day summer Fridays, competitive benefits, RRSP matching, and more. Mental health training is provided for everyone and we have certified Mental Health First Aiders on staff to offer support. #selfcarematters
          
 Building a Community Where Everyone Belongs: Leading the industry in our efforts to increase representation, celebrate uniqueness, and build community, we always look for new ways to foster a sense of belonging through our culture, our partnerships and our work. #youbelong
          
 Embracing Challenging Projects: We offer opportunities to be involved with memorable, collaborative and engaging media campaigns for internationally recognized brands. Our work is reflective of the passion, agility, curiosity and drive of individuals across Mediabrands and Kinesso. #winningtogether
         












         About Us 
        







          La meilleure façon d’attirer l’attention de quelqu'un est de sortir des sentiers battus. Dans cet esprit, Media Experts fait tourner les têtes de l'industrie depuis 40 ans en faisant une grande impression. Une agence médiatique canadienne axée sur les données et animée par l'esprit de découverte; nous construisons des marques emblématiques sur le marché canadien. Notre approche unique tourne autour de la conception de stratégies médiatiques efficaces et assidues qui stimulent l'engagement de la marque et fournissent des résultats commerciaux exceptionnels.
          
 The best way to get someone’s attention is to break a pattern. With that in mind, Media Experts has been turning industry heads for 40 years by Making a Big Impression. A data-driven Canadian media agency powered by the spirit of discovery; we build iconic brands within the Canadian market. Our unique approach revolves around designing effective, hard-working media strategies that drive brand engagement and deliver outstanding business results.
