Title: Standards Analyst
Description:
Who We Are:
 A neutral, not-for-profit organization, GS1 Canada is one of 116 GS1 Member Organizations around the world. We are a Trusted Strategic Partner who inspires, leads, and enables best in class supply chain by developing and maintaining global standards for efficient business communications. For more than 20 years, we have supported Canadian businesses of all types and sizes in several industries and sectors.
 GS1 has partnered with several industries globally for over 50 years – since we introduced the very first barcode on a pack of gum in 1974. Today, GS1 barcodes are scanned 6 billion times a day, and GS1 standards are the most widely used system of standards in the world.
 A team of friendly and passionate people, we are optimistic about our capabilities and draw strength from our uniqueness, and the drive and passion of our people to carry our values and vision forward.

Our Core Values:

Integrity
Collaboration
Innovation
Accountability
Super-Serve Subscribers



 About this opportunity:
 GS1 Canada’s primary role is the development of global standards and we are looking for an energetic go-getter to join us as a Standards Analyst. In this role, you'll support the Standards team in answering inquiries across our key stakeholder groups, assist on various projects, develop education content and/or deliver education sessions, attend community working groups, process internal and external industry requirements, and respond to GTIN Ombudsman inquiries. This role is technical and requires the interpretation of the GS1 Standards.


 What you’ll do:

Assist in creating education material and in delivering education sessions to support internal and external understanding of GS1 Standards
Assist with departmental projects ensuring timely completion of deliverables
Act as a subject matter expert on GS1 standards and processes for departments within GS1 Canada
Assist in reviews of Standards related content
Assist in the development of business use cases
Assist with website content maintenance
Support the GTIN Ombudsman function. This includes providing fact-based interpretation of the relevant GS1 standards
Perform various other duties as delegated or assigned



 What you’ll bring:

University degree or college diploma (essay-based course) in Technical Writing, Communications, Business or Computer Science
At least 2 years experience and knowledge of barcodes, EDI, data synchronization, or other GS1 Standards
Technical skills (business/data analysis, project management, technical writing)

What Will Make Us REALLY Love you (Preferred Qualifications):

Bi-lingual in French
Working knowledge of one or more of the following business processes: New item introduction, shelf management, order-to-cash, traceability
Experience working within one of the following industries: Retail (Grocery or Pharmacy), Foodservice, Healthcare



 What You'll Love About Us:

Our People First Culture – At GS1 Canada, we embody our values and live them every day. We know that family and health come first, and that’s a non-negotiable for us!
Work that Stays at Work – A work life balance that you can boast about!
Rest and Relaxation – Three weeks paid time off, Ten paid personal/sick days, and we make sure you book that time off!
Health Benefits – Health, dental, and vision coverage, lifestyle and wellness benefits, Employee Assistance Programs (EAPs)
Prepare for the Future – Benefit from RRSP matching that contribute towards your savings
A Culture of Learning and Growth – We want you to keep learning and growing. We provide access to many learning tools that you can take advantage of for personal and professional capabilities development!


GS1 Canada is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals. Please be advised that only candidates being considered for an interview will be contacted. We are committed to providing a barrier-free environment to all applicants, including those with disabilities. Throughout the hiring process, we will work with applicants to accommodate accessibility needs.

Title: Assurance Experience Management, Data Analyst
Description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 As an Experience Management (EM) Analyst, you will support the Assurance EM team by creating reports and analysis around deployment, utilization, development and capacity management; ensuring accuracy of data in our deployment systems/enablers and support projects and initiatives as required.

 Your key responsibilities will include:

 Reporting:

 Act as a subject matter resource on EM tools/enablers
 Create routine reports using existing templates that show utilization performance, availability forecasts, and variances between actual and forecasted utilization
 Assist with ad-hoc analytics requests by pulling reports from EY systems and tools
 Create/maintain accurate client-serving records in EM systems (i.e., roster updates, new hire records, etc.)
 Partner with Talent, Workforce Planning, and Finance on headcount reconciliation

 Teaming:

 Understand system and reporting escalation points to resolve problems accordingly
 Demonstrate effective teaming with Canadian EM team by proactively/creatively responding to analytics requests
 Participate in ad-hoc projects as required (i.e., creation of dashboards, etc)
 Identify ways to improve EM processes and contribute to team initiatives
 Actively support Americas Experience Management and EY enablers including Retain; EY Advance; MERA; Mercury; SuccessFactors, etc.
 Work with peers across the Americas Assurance EM by contributing to EM priorities; task forces; and/or projects

 Knowledge, Skills and Experience requirements:

 Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
 Proficient in other Microsoft applications
 Understanding of Data Visualization tools, Power BI, Tableau
 Strong analytical skills, with attention to detail
 English language skills - very strong written and verbal communication
 French language skills a plus
 Proven client service focus, with an ability to resolve issues quickly, with a sense of urgency
 Strong problem-solving skills
 Flexible in adapting to constantly changing priorities
 Outstanding teamwork and interpersonal skills
 Confident at working independently and a self-starter
 Adept at handling multiple tasks, with strong organizational skills
 Experience in a professional services firm desirable

 Education

 Bachelor's degree, or equivalent work experience

 What we offer

 We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:

 Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
 Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
 The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

 Diversity and Inclusion at EY
 Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We’re committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. From our actions to combat systemic racism and our advocacy for the LGBT+ community to our innovative Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, we welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.

 EY Way of Work and your health and safety

 EY Way of Work recognizes flexibility in the way we collaborate, innovate and deliver with the ability to work in-person and remotely. To support a healthy and safe in-person working environment, EY has implemented various layers of health and safety controls while working in the office or at client or other locations. A critical component of EY’s workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy which requires all personnel to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless an accommodation based on a reason protected by human rights legislation is provided.

 If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

 The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

 EY | Building a better working world

 EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

 Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

 Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Title: Lead Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Who We Are
 


 Meet Fresh Prep—Western Canada’s most convenient and sustainable meal kit delivery service.
 
 As a certified B Corporation, we make convenient eating healthy and sustainable for the communities we operate in. We source quality local ingredients whenever possible, and deliver in reusable, recyclable and compostable packaging. We offer 10 chef-created meal kit recipes each week, with options for many lifestyles and preferences including vegetarian and vegan.

 Fresh Prep has been selected as one of 2022 BC’s Top Employers and ranked #38 in the Globe and Mail’s 2021 Canada's Top Growing Companies List.
 Who You Are


 Curious and technical leader. You like to problem solve business questions with data answers. You like helping others find insights and make strategic and tactical decisions based on the analysis you provide.
 Self Starter. You are comfortable owning a task from start to finish and you take the initiative to make continuous process improvements. You observe strict deadlines and hold yourself accountable for your deliverables.
 Strong communicator: Your verbal and written communication skills allow you to get results across easily and quickly, in a friendly and professional manner.
 Open: You are open to constructive feedback, but aren’t afraid to let your opinions be known. You approach the problem at hand from a strategic and empathetic point of view.


 What You'll Be Doing




 Using your sophisticated, superior, and creative analytics problem solving, be able to translate data into meaningful business insights to answer business questions.
   


     Work closely with the Data Team and other stakeholders to provide analysis and insights that help inform decision making and drive program improvements.
   


     Craft insights into a narrative that can be shared and understood cross-organizationally.
   


     Develop company-wide and campaign-specific performance reports and dashboards.
   


     Writing SQL pipelines, data wrangling, modeling, and dashboarding.
   


     Create, manage, and maintain the tools, systems, dashboards, and data to make the team more efficient, effective, and data-driven.
   


     Support the performance and optimization of the Data Team. Work closely with more junior data analysts, mentoring them through the project lifecycle and provide guidance on industry best practices.
   


     Migrating and championing adoption in a new BI analytical tool or software within the Data Team as well as non-technical stakeholders.
   


 Responsibilities




 Fluently write expert SQL queries that pull, join, clean, filter and aggregate data (self joins and windows functions).
   


     Use these queries to develop and maintain actionable dashboards, analyses, and key insights to increase internal understanding of business drivers.
   


     Transform findings into compelling presentations, including graphs, charts, or dashboards, aimed at answering key business questions and present to executive stakeholders.
   


     Partner with multiple stakeholders to define KPIs and metrics within Fresh Prep such as Marketing, Operations, and Product.
   


     Build and maintain the integrity of reports with as much self-service access as possible.
   


     Responsible for data documentation of data assets, ensuring that data assets are created thoughtfully and reliably throughout its lifecycle so that learnings turn into repeatable actions and then into automation.
   


     Identify data needs to develop high-value, actionable reporting aimed at answering key business questions.
   


 What We Are Looking For




 3-5+ years of relevant experience in business intelligence, data analysis, data science, and/or business analysis in an eCommerce, SaaS, or retail
   


     Experience with working with agile methodologies
   


     Expert fluency with SQL (we use Big Query), and Python or R
   


     Experience with Business Intelligence software such as Google Data Studio, Looker, Power BI, Tableau or others
   


     Highly proficient in G Suite and/or Microsoft Office Tools
   


     Proficient in statistical modeling
   


     Experience in data consolidation, data migration, and creating data documentation
   


     Experience having mentored and trained more junior analysts and working in a team
   


     Experience with creating a robust data lake, and pulling in integrations with APIs or third party tools
   


     Experience with research tools like Qualtrics, Survey Monkey, SPSS, PSPP is a nice to have
   


     Experience managing one or more reports.
   



 What You Can Expect
 




 An inclusive, fun workplace filled with fantastic colleagues. We’re a certified B-Corporation and our team is passionate about making a positive difference (and also about food!)
   


     The ability to work from home or from one of our locations
   


     Competitive pay and bonuses
   


     Comprehensive health benefits (including medical, dental, vision and life-insurance) after 90 days of successful employment.
   


     Free food! A Fresh Prep meal plan and sample meals from our test kitchen at our HQ!
   


 Fresh Prep is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) and prohibit discrimination of any kind. We value diversity at our company and at all job levels our goal is to be diverse, inclusive and representative of the communities we operate in. We endeavour to recruit, develop and retain the best talent from a diverse candidate pool and truly believe that diversity, equity and inclusion among our team members is vital to our success as a company. We trust that in applying for a role with us you value this as well!


 Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you think you have what it takes, but don’t necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We’d love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst


 Location: This position can be located in Winnipeg or Toronto.


 Application Deadline: July 30, 2022


 Our organization:

 Founded in 2017, Wellington-Altus Financial Inc. (Wellington-Altus) is the parent company to Wellington-Altus Private Counsel and Wellington-Altus Private Wealth —the top-rated* wealth advisory company in Canada and one of Canada's Best Managed Companies. With more than $20 billion in assets under administration and offices across the country, Wellington-Altus identifies with successful, entrepreneurial advisors and portfolio managers, and their high-net-worth clients.

Investment Executive 2021 Brokerage Report Card



 The opportunity:


 Reporting to the Vice-President, Data Architecture, the Senior Data Analyst will be highly skilled in all aspects of data analytics, including mining, generation, and visualization. Additionally, the incumbent will be committed to transforming data into readable, goal-driven reports for continued innovation and growth.

 Key responsibilities include:



Overseeing the development and use of data systems by identifying and developing efficient ways to organize data store, and analyze data, while also paying attention to security and confidentiality. 
Planning, managing, and leading the delivery of detailed system requirements and technical / functional specifications in alignment with standards and frameworks. 
Providing technical leadership and working in close partnership with business partners / technology / project teams and stakeholders to plan, elicit, analyze, document, communicate and manage detailed functional specifications. 
Developing, implementing, and maintaining complicated problems and building simple frameworks. 
Identifying trends and opportunities for growth through analysis of complex data sets. 
Evaluating organizational methods and providing source-to-target mappings and information-model specification documents for data sets. 
Creating best-practice reports based on data mining, analysis, and visualization. 
Evaluating internal systems for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, developing and maintaining protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data. 
Working directly with management and users to gather requirements, provide status updates, and build relationships. 
Capturing and converting business requirements into consumable artifacts & information to be used by the data engineer and quality analysis team to support project & support requests. 
   
Working closely with project managers to understand and maintain focus on their analytical needs, including identifying critical metrics and KPIs, and deliver actionable insights to relevant decision-makers. 
Proactively analyzing data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity. 
Creating and maintaining rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources. 
Defining and implementing data acquisition and integration logic, selecting appropriate combination of methods and tools within defined technology stack to ensure optimal scalability and performance of the solution. 
Developing and maintaining databases by acquiring data from primary and secondary sources, and building scripts that will make our data evaluation process more flexible or scalable across data sets. 

Performing other duties as assigned.



 The ideal candidate will possess:



An undergraduate degree in computer science, economics, or statistics or equivalent combination of appropriate experience.
7 years' experience leading and managing a data analytical team.
7+ years' experience mining data as a data analyst. 
7+ years' demonstrating proven analytic skills, including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization. 
Technical writing experience in relevant areas, including queries, reports, and presentations. 
5-7 years' data analyst experience in teams following Waterfall and/or Agile methodology. 
Experience working with data model designs. 
Experience executing end user testing in UAT.
Experience with Azure, AWS. Hadoop, Confluence, and Jira. 
A foundational understanding of SDLC and Agile delivery methodologies. 
Experience in business process and data mapping. 
Experience and comfort level acting as a subject matter expert and consultant. 
Experience working with external vendors. 
Excellent communication skills, including group facilitation and presentation skills. 
Strong SQL skills, data mining experience, working on a cloud platform, MS Office expertise. 
An ability to work with a data cloud team and to converse requirements/use cases to each member. 
An understanding of data modelling and design, with the ability to translate requirements to existing and/or new data models.  
An ability to validate and test on behalf of the end user any data deliverable to ensure requirements were met.
Prior experience with database and model design and segmentation techniques is an asset. 
Experience working within the financial services industry; wealth management and/or Institutional services is an asset. 
Strong programming experience with frameworks including XML, Javascript, and ETL languages is an asset. 
Practical experience in statistical analysis using statistical packages including Excel, SAS, R in an asset. 
Proven success in a collaborative, team-oriented environment is an asset.



 Conditions of employment:



Must be legally eligible to work in Canada.
A background check, satisfactory to the employer, may be required of the successful applicant prior to commencing employment.



 Wellington-Altus is strongly committed to equity and diversity within its community and welcomes applications from women, racialized persons, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, and persons of all sexual orientations and genders. All qualified individuals who would contribute to the further diversification of our organization are encouraged to apply.


 If you require accommodation for the recruitment process, please let us know at the point of application.


 To apply:


 Click the Apply For This Job button to submit your resume, cover letter and salary expectations. You will be contacted if you are selected for an interview. More information about working at Wellington-Altus can be found on our website at www.wellington-altus.com.

Title: Accounts Receivable Analyst
Description:
Overview: 
  The AR Analyst position contributes to the success of WWL Vehicle Services Canada by providing direct support to the Management team and acting as a Company representative to customers and carriers, ensuring all billing and anything related to finance is accurate. The AR Analyst is responsible for collecting, compiling, and analyzing data to produce accurate and timely bills / credits to customer(s), to collect on past due amounts, to reconcile company ledger to customer’s(s’) ledger, and to support the Revenue team accounting processes and procedures are conforming to the applicable principles of accounting and regulatory requirements in a global public company for a(n) assigned book of customer(s). This position reports directly to the Controller. Job Description: 
 
 Responsibilities


 Ensure accurate and timely recording of revenue and accounts receivable transactions
 Perform various accounting functions, including but not limited to customer invoicing, accounts receivable and collections, revenue accruals, customer analysis and reporting, reconciling of data, investigating deviations, etc. 
Review accuracy & completeness of supporting documentation, necessary for billing & revenue recognition processes & procedures.
 Prepare various reconciliations and supporting schedules and investigate deviations for timely resolution.
 Ensure compliance with customer contracts and internal accounting policies and procedures.
 Perform monthly close processes and monthly customer reporting.
 Prepare various ad-hoc analysis and reports.
 Maintain pricing matrixes for all customers and ensure required billing setups are in place in various systems, including coordinating with other depts as necessary.
 Prepare analysis and resolution of cash receipts.
 Perform timely follow-up of collections and document accordingly.
 Maintain documentation of accounting processes and procedures.
 Participate in continual process improvement initiatives.


 Job Requirements: 
 
 Qualifications & Competencies


 Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting.
 Minimum 3-5 years of relevant accounting experience. 
Knowledgeable in GAAP / IFRS.
 Effective communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work well in a team-oriented environment.
 Ability to work effectively & efficiently within a Remote Office Environment employing Microsoft 365 Applications & Tools.
 Advanced user of Excel, experience with large volumes of data preferred. 
Detail oriented, accuracy driven, organized.
 Self-starter, pro-active problem solver.
 Ability to multitask responsibilities and effectively prioritize to meet all required deadlines.
 Aptitude to work in an Agile Environment where opportunities for change are continuously identified and acted upon.
 Ability to quickly grasp concepts of various software systems and apply advanced technology knowledge and skills.


 Pay Type : Salary

Title: Senior Business System Analyst
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Senior Business System Analyst
 





































 Job Description





































 WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY? 

The Regulatory Reporting technology team within RBC Capital Markets is looking for a Senior Business System Analyst with a proven and consistent track record of successful delivery. The role will coordinate, develop, lead, communicate and execute activities to ensure objectives are accomplished according on time.

 WHAT WILL YOU DO? 


Elicit and analyze business requirements and create documentation such as current and future state business process, user stories, data catalogues, and business rules.
 Contribute to requirements prioritization and leverage techniques to drive out priorities and meet quarterly and annual business objectives.
 Work collaboratively with our business partners and stakeholders (FO technology, Compliance, Operations etc.)
 Analyze and review different options for data integration and provide recommendations on the solution; such as assessing and defining materiality of data quality issues and possible impact to project objectives.
 Contribute to data model and system architecture decisions
 Incorporate enterprise standard requirements methodology in requirements planning, analysis and documentation.
 Communicate effectively, written and verbal, to various audiences (technical and non-technical)

 Must-Have


 Strong analytical skills for data analysis and problem solving
 Experience working Agile, using Jira and Confluence
 Ability to effectively communicate with stakeholder groups
 Excellent oral and written communication


 Nice-to-Have


 Working knowledge of OTC derivatives trade reporting requirements
 Working knowledge of financial product message standards (FpML, ISO20022)
 Working knowledge of Capital Markets front to back trade processing flows
 Working knowledge of Capital Markets instruments/derivatives


 What’s in it for you?

 We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
 Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
 Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

 Opportunities to do challenging work

Title: Salesforce Business (Systems) Analyst
Description:
Position Description:
Fulltime/ Permanent Location – Toronto, ON   Ready to join an outstanding culture that cares about diversity and inclusion, corporate social responsibility and gives the freedom to innovate, influence decisions, and chart an exciting career? CGI is seeking a Salesforce Business (Systems) Analyst to join our team!  In this role, you will work directly with both technical and business personnel across functional areas of the business. You will be responsible for the recommendation of automation solutions within Salesforce as well as third party tools. You will also work with a cross-functional team of IT and business resources to design solutions and work through the development and launch phases. Working with leaders across the business, you will collect requirements and present strategies for the implementation of new programs/initiatives, as well as the presentation of solutions. 


Your future duties and responsibilities:

   This is an exciting time for CGI, and we want you to be part of it.
    We are Canada's largest independent information technology services firm, and we're still growing! We're expanding in Toronto Canada and we need your skills, enthusiasm, and dedication as part of our team.
   
 What success looks like in this role:
   


Undergraduate Degree or Technical Certificate
5-7 years relevant experience.

Subject matter expert and consults with clients and/or project teams




Skills:

Business Analysis
 Business Process Analysis
 Financial Services
 Solution Analysis
 CRM Solutions
 MuleSoft
 Requirement Management
 Requirements Analysis
 Salesforce



What you can expect from us:

When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees "members" because they are CGI shareholders and owners and owners who enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. Title: Global HRIS Analyst
Description:
Job Description:



 The Global HRIS Analyst acts as the bridge between business needs and technical implementation – by helping Human Resources make informed choices and decisions before bringing requirements to the IT team. By providing superior customer service, acting as reliable subject matter expert and trusted business partner – the Global HRIS Analyst is responsible for managing global HR Technology projects from discovery, requirements gathering, implementation through to maintenance.

 Key Areas of Focus:
 1. HR Technology Business Analysis – The Global HRIS Analyst supports ATS Automation’s Human Resources Business Partners team globally by bridging business needs to technical implementation. The Global HRIS Analyst listens to ideas, supports discovery process, collaborates, builds current/future state process maps, documents and obtains approvals through internal HR & Corporate IT Governance steering committees.
 2. Human Resources Information System (HRIS) Administration – The HRIS at ATS is SuccessFactors (SF) Employee Central (EC). The Global HRIS Analyst must understand SF EC functionality and be able enter and maintain employee data and organizational structure – as well as troubleshoot and train users. ATS also uses SF Recruitment, Onboarding, Performance and Goal Management (PMGM), Succession & Development, Compensation Planning, Learning & Reporting modules – which the Global HRIS Analyst supports in various capacities such as layouts/tiles management, form template management, approvals workflows, language settings, as well as upgrades and enhancements.
 3. HR Technology Project Coordination – The Global HRIS Analyst understands and applies project management methodology to design, schedule, build, resource, test and implement requests (new or enhancements). Acting as a change agent, the Global HRIS Analyst makes project goals their own and inspires a sense of shared purpose. Working well under pressure and comfortable with change and complexity in dynamic environments, the Global HRIS Analyst can shift between ‘big picture’ and small (but critical) details.





 Qualifications:



 Education:
 Post-Secondary Degree / Diploma in Human Resources, Business, Data Analytics or similar field required Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) and/or Project Management Professional (PMP) designation or working towards considered an asset
 Requirements:

5 years of experience working with SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central
5 years of experience as an HRIS Analyst or related role – organizing and implementing enterprise wide HRIS modules (with at least 2 consecutive years within one organization)
2 years of experience coordinating projects and gathering business requirements using best-in-class tools
Exposure to global HR policies, process and best practices – organizing and maintaining employee data within existing (and potentially new) HR systems and technology.
Advanced MS Excel skills required; confident presentation and communication abilities
Experience and willingness to work in a large, complex and global environment where responsibilities and priorities may shift according to business needs
Highly resilient, comfortable in a fast-paced environment and can calmly navigate change
Exceptional collaboration and communication skills with a passion for providing exceptional customer service
Strong critical thinking, problem-solving, and storytelling skills with the ability to not only manipulate and summarize data, but also derive meaningful interpretations from data and ability to articulate in a simple and impactful way to a non-technical audience
Exposure to acquisitions and high-growth global organizations considered an asset
Demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality and discretion – and handle sensitive information




 Why Join ATS? 

Be a part of a global organization that is a leader in its industry
 Subsidized breakfast and lunch daily; free gourmet beverages - coffee, tea and hot chocolate. Plus, Treat Day is every other week!
 Monthly “In-Chair Massage” clinic on-site with a Registered Massage Therapist
 Ability to participate in a variety of charitable events
 Social Club that offers BBQs and other social events throughout the year
 Work with other bright, talented people and discover opportunities for professional growth
 And much more!

 ATS is in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disability Act (AODA), 2005 and will, upon request, assist those who may require specific accommodations due to a personal disability. We would ask that those who require assistance to notify our offices as soon as possible if accommodation is necessary.

Title: Systems Analyst, Database and Security
Description:
About MHC
Systems Analyst, Database and Security 








        Competition Number: 123005
        


        Type: Management/Excluded
        





        Closing Date: August 03, 2022
        


        Category: Regular, Full-Time
        









Medicine Hat College’s Information Technology Services invites applications for a regular, full-time Systems Analyst, Database and Security. 
A little about the role:
 This position works as part of MHC’s Information Technology Services and is primarily responsible for design, implementation, support and maintenance of college databases. This position will lead the planning, designing, implementing, analyzing and technical support for college databases as well as conduct research and evaluation of database technology.
 This position is also primarily responsible for researching, analyzing, recommending and implementing database related security practices (policy and processes) and systems to help ensure the security of MHC IT information assets.
 MHC currently offers a flexible working environment enabling this role to work remotely full time or part time.
 As a successful candidate you will have:

4 year Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
Excellent and effective listening, written and oral communication skills, with the ability to consult with and advise various administrative levels and departments of the college.
Client service focus and builds productive working relationships, cooperates and collaborates with colleagues, treats others with respect, has good conflict resolution skills. 
Thorough and accurate quality and effectiveness attention to detail ensuring the improvement of processes and practices by identifying inefficiencies and redundancies. 
Personally responsible and reliable; has initiative and self-motivation; completes work in a timely, consistent manner, and is committed to doing the best job possible; keeps commitments.
A minimum of three years of experience with a majority of the following: 
   
Experience in implementing, operating, and securing database environments used by MHC 
Experience in system integrations
Database administration and security 
Proficiency in the operation of current Windows Servers
The use of scripts in a Windows Active Directory (AD) environment
Database certifications (such as SQL Server, Oracle) 


Growing a vibrant future with learners and our region
 This is an exciting time to become part of MHC's future. Our people, our communities, and our region are at the heart of who we are. We are guided by the principles of authenticity, collaboration, and action. Through teamwork and diversity in our perspectives, we lift each other up and build on each other's strength so that we can bring our best to the people we serve. Together, we prepare learners for success in college, in the workforce, and in life, while enhancing regional vitality and opening doors to the world. Bring your passion to our purpose, and join us. To learn more visit https://www.mhc.ab.ca/AboutMHC 
Submission Details
 Please submit your cover letter quoting Competition #123005 with your resume, saved as a single document. Deadline for receipt of applications is August 3, 2022.
 This position will require the successful candidate to present a valid Police Information/Criminal Record Check, including a Vulnerable Sector Search.
 Please indicate in your cover letter where you first saw the ad for this position.
 Submit your application by one of the following methods: 

Email (You can select the "Apply Now" button below.) Please send your application as an attachment in either .doc,.docx,.pdf or .rtf formats (only). 
Canada Post. 

Applications will not be accepted via fax
Medicine Hat College Human Resources 299 College Drive S.E. Medicine Hat, AB T1A 3Y6 E-mail: hr@mhc.ab.ca
Medicine Hat College is committed to employment equity, welcomes diversity in the workplace, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. In accordance with Canadian immigration requirements, priority will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents. 
Only applicants being granted an interview will be contacted. All others are thanked for their interest.

Title: Business Intelligence Manager
Description:
Mandatory Skills: Retail Background, Oracle, T-SQL, MySQL, PowerBI, Tableau, Snowflake, leadership experience, development experience
Job Description: 
What is the role?
A hands-on Manager, Business Intelligence who thrives in a dynamic work environment. This role involves working across the entire BI lifecycle, from source data analysis, Extract Transform Load (ETL) development, through to Analysis and Reporting implementation.
This role is accountable for the build out of Data Lakes and the implementation of tools needed to enable data discovery, predictive analytics and other features. This role will design, develop, implement and support solutions that empowers the business with timely, actionable information. The BI Manager needs to be a self-starter, thorough in their work, and able to build a high competency team. Additionally, the BI Manager acts as mentor on best practices both for the development team and for the business in their acceptance of the new BI solution, helping them become more mature in terms of the understanding and correct utilization of their own data assets.
What will you do?
· Provide Business Intelligence solutions including analytics, dashboards and reports to support PRB in making informed decisions that increase the bottom line through improved quality and services
· Design, develop, deploy and tune deploy Tableau Extracts, Workbooks SQL Server, Oracle and Snowflake based ETL processes as required. Create appropriate processes and procedures to ensure proactive data quality monitoring
· Perform system design and specification development, program logic and flow-charting, application security, testing and debugging with full awareness of cost/benefit, risk and performance.
· Participates in client interactions, possibly with more senior team members, to develop BI solutions to business needs 24/7 Application support
· Mentoring and pairing with other development team members
What will you need to succeed?
Education and Experience
· At least 10 years of professional software development experience
· 6 years in team leading
· Bachelors or masters in computer science or equivalent preferred
· Ability to lead, direct and manage team members
· Experience building and maintaining continuous delivery environments
· Experience with Agile software development methodologies, source control, and automated testing and deployment
· Experience deploying and managing in-house/cloud-hosted application services
· Experience with large scale systems involving reporting, transactional systems and integration with other enterprise systems (i.e. Mainframe).
· Experience with multiple Source/Version control systems and understanding of code merging concepts.
· Have in-depth knowledge of management goals and visions and work in line with team members to achieve them
· Working with high performing technology teams
· Experience with retail point-of-sale applications is a plus
· Collaborate with the Business Analysts in requirements gathering, prototyping and requirements validation. Analyze and verify technical requirements for completeness, consistency, feasibility, and testability.
· Experience with ITIL framework and application of best industry practices
· Experience with industry development standards and their implementation
· Proficiency in system analysis and design
Knowledge and Skills
· IT Strategy Development
· Strong Analytical Thinking and Problem-Solving Skills
· Attention to Detail
· Flexibility
· Fosters Teamwork
· Process Oriented
· Impact Awareness
· Strong Influential Skills
· Interpersonal Awareness
· Motivated, Self-Starter
· Results Oriented
· Apply software engineering concepts and best practices to design solutions that meets operational requirements, such as scalability, maintainability, extensibility, and flexibility.
· Communication –ability to understand requirements documentation, functional specifications, high level design documentation and system documentation. Able to solidly incorporate this information, along with project business objectives, into appropriate development strategies and plans.
· Diagnostic Information Gathering – ability to seek information from a variety of sources and in a variety of ways, to clarify situations and to facilitate effective planning, decision making, and problem solving.
· Writes code and unit tests, works on API specs, automation, and conducting code reviews and testing. Identifies exciting opportunities for adopting new security technologies to solve existing needs and future challenges.
· Technical Acumen - strong understanding of software Java development concepts, procedures, and technologies utilizing Agile Scrum Methodology.
· Collaborate with the Business Analysts in requirements gathering, prototyping and requirements validation.
· Analyze and verify technical requirements for completeness, consistency, feasibility, and testability.
· Resolving technical issues through debugging & investigation
· Design and develop appropriate processes and procedures to ensure proactive data quality monitoring
· Evangelize self-service Business Intelligence and help foster an environment of information-based decisions
· Experience with Retail systems including point-of-sales, warehousing / distribution, and merchandising systems
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Additional pay:

Bonus pay

Benefits:

Work from home

Flexible language requirement:

French not required

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Day shift

Experience:

Business intelligence: 10 years (required)
Retail Domain: 3 years (required)

Title: Technical Business Analyst
Description:
Req Id: 383330

 At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.
 If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
 The Bell IT team uses emerging technologies, Agile and DevOps to design and build innovative solutions that enable Bell’s communications services for businesses and consumers. We’re looking for creative problem-solvers who are curious, collaborative and ready to be on the leading edge of technological transformation.

3-5 years of experience as a Technical Business Analyst

Experience with Agile and experience with tools such as: Jira

Understanding current business process and Experience in documenting future state business process
Experience with working with understanding Salesforce terminology and documenting solutions while working closely with Architects and Developers.

Ability to build relationships and work effectively with internal players and vendors
Be flexible, resilient, and willingness to do what it takes to get the job done

Bachelor's degree or equivalent.

Previous telecommunications background
Salesforce Administrator Certification

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Business Insight Analyst
Description:
Description 

Being part of Air Canada is to become part of an iconic Canadian symbol, recently ranked the best Airline in North America. Let your career take flight by joining our diverse and vibrant team at the leading edge of passenger aviation.


Position Objectives:

 The mission of the Business Insights Analyst is to obtain data from multiple sources to analyse customer behavior as well as providing performance analysis and reporting on all departments under the Customer Contact Centres branch (Revenue, Loyalty, International, Customer Relations and Baggage Claims) and derive insights to drive continuous improvement. 
 
 In this role, you will be expected to deliver highly detailed data analyses, verifying quality, ensuring all activities supported across the Customer Contact Centre branch meet product specifications and policies, and confirming that processes complement the delivery channels while remaining customer focused. 
 
 The position of Business Insights Analyst is a contributor to the success of the Workforce Team and requires an individual capable of delivering projects that touch on all facets of the Customer Experience (i.e., new product development, policy/process refinement, business operations support). 
 
 This position is open for Montreal/ Toronto/ Vancouver/ Calgary. 
 

Roles & Responsibilities:

Responsible for recurring reporting, analysis and insight generation. Recurring reporting activities include: weekly, monthly, quarterly and yearly reports. Recurring reporting activities also includes financial quarterly and yearly reports that is required by the corporate reporting process.
Synthesize data, identify trends, and produce analysis of profitability, relevance, customer friendliness & compliance as the business changes.
Provide supporting data and analysis for business case development of various improvement initiatives through ad hoc analysis, support, and insights into the created analytics with recommendations for business opportunities. 
Design, program, automate, maintain/improve dashboards, KPIs, scorecards and reports; and communicate analytics results of the various departments of the Customer Contact Centres teams. 
Implement continuous monitoring to gauge impact of initiatives deployed, providing analysis on results and trends to affect change in business decisions.
Work with internal stakeholders (IT, Operations Managers, etc) to maintain and enhance existing data warehouse environment (integrating new systems as required)
Troubleshoot data issues, validate result sets, recommend and implement process improvements 
Participate and provide subject matter expertise to internal projects as required. 
Build relationships with cross-functional teams to provide input on Business Requirements.
Be proactive in identifying areas where insight would be of value.
Work with branch operational teams to review, create new, or remove broken service delivery processes as required.

LEADERSHIP ATTITUDES:


Thought Leadership 

Analysis & Decision Making - Analyzes problems and situations, and their impacts on the business and its global network. Delivers commercial, fact-based, forward thinking decisions. 
Strategic Thinking - Brings to life our vision of becoming "A Top 10 Airline in Everything We Do". Aligns personal and workgroup activities to the organization's strategic goals and leverages our global network and strength to provide value to our customers. 


Results Leadership 

Customer Centricity - Builds and delivers solutions for internal and external customers that meet and exceed their needs, identifying innovative opportunities that will benefit them, creating value added services, and working in partnership with customers to drive the business forward. 
Results Orientation - Manages performance, holding self and others accountable to effectively and efficiently complete work responsibilities. Demonstrates initiative, a strong commitment to achieving meaningful results, and acts on opportunities to create value. 


People/Personal Leadership

Building Collaborative Partnerships - Encourages personal achievement and excellence. Plays a part in attracting, developing, and retaining top talent. Ensures that all talent receives mentoring, training, feedback, and development opportunities. 
Building Talent - Establishes authentic, genuine and open relationships inside and outside of the organization to build a foundation of influence. Fosters an inclusive culture that makes people feel valued and respected. Works effectively with others across the organization to achieve goals. Ensures that all functions (assigning work, performance management, training and development, succession planning, determining developmental needs, rewarding and disciplining) are conducted in a fair and equitable way. 
Adaptability - Responds resourcefully and shows nimbleness when faced with new challenges and demands. Effectively manages the pressures and complexities of various situations. Moves forward positively and productively under conditions of change or uncertainty.

Qualifications 

Ability to multi-task, prioritize work, manage expectations, and meet deadlines while paying attention to details and quality of work time in a fast-paced environment. 
Ability to work both independently and in a team setting. 
Ability to work with minimal supervision while maintaining focus and productivity; seeks help when needed 
Ability to quickly adapt to new situations, changing business needs and ambiguity. 
Proven analytical ability at a high-level able to add valuable insights. 
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) Power BI, MS Dynamics Microsoft Visio are required.
Working knowledge/understanding of relational database technology and database management practices: SQL, R, Python, SAS, JSON, DAX and other data mining programming tools. 
Post Secondary diploma in a related field and asset (i.e. Administration) 
Willing to undertake limited business travel


Assets:

3+ years of professional experience in Contact Centre environment. 
Excellent knowledge of Air Canada product/services and the operations process associated with delivering/recovering these products.
Knowledge of Workforce Management tools (preferably IEX) and Quality Assurance tools
Bilingual with fluency in written and spoken English and French is an asset


Conditions of Employment:

 Candidates must be eligible to work in the country of interest, at the time any offer of employment is made and seeking any required work permits/visas or other authorizations which may be required is the sole responsibility of the candidates applying for this position. 


Linguistic Requirements

 Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates. 
 

Diversity and Inclusion

 Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees' unique contributions to our company's success. 
 
 As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.
 

Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest; however only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.

Title: Business Systems Analyst, Credit Card Core Systems (Rogers Bank)
Description:
At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.  Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuels us, and moments define us.
 Business Systems Analyst – Credit Card Core Systems - Rogers Bank

 As a member of the Project Delivery Office, the Business Systems Analyst will engage Information Technology and business stakeholders to plan, elicit, analyze and validate system requirements that meet business needs within Rogers Bank. The role will work on new development and maintenance projects.

 The role works in partnership with internal resources and outsourced service providers for service delivery, ensuring program design is optimized to deliver the needs of the business with processing accuracy, meeting compliance and regulatory requirements, while providing the services on budget, and providing an excellent customer experience for Rogers’ customers.

 Responsibilities:

 Interpret business needs to understand, recommend, and document new business requirements.
 Conduct business analysis.
 Undertake Quality Assurance testing and help streamline existing processes to improve efficiency.
 Prepare data mapping and perform testing of applications.
 Develop in depth knowledge of applications and their interdependences and downstream impacts.
 Demonstrate leadership and partnership skills by interacting with other technology teams within organization to solve problems and deliver solutions.
 Take a leadership role in working with and liaising with business partners, other Technology Solutions organizations and external vendors to define business and technical requirements.
 Review, analyze and evaluate detailed business and functional requirements, documentation, process flows and data models to contribute to the development of project plans including project charter, project deliverables, dependencies, cost/benefits analysis, and timeline estimates.
 Develop use cases, defining and documenting user procedures and workflows, and how each class of user interacts with east system function.
 Ensure Business Recovery Plans are in place. Integrate technical solutions with the business environment, recognizing systems design and data interdependencies and reusability.
 Establish appropriate security levels for processes, information exchange and system implementation.
 Define, review and influence standards and quality measures/metrics.
 Assist in the development of conversion and implementation strategies and defining go/no go criteria.
 Conduct pre and post implementation reviews, ensuring all technical solutions have met business requirements.
 Supports system implementation and production readiness by liaising with change management, IT architecture and standards, and the business.
 Provide user documentation, user training, and post implementation support.
 Collaborate with business leaders, IT professionals, and vendors ensuring that management is kept informed of project status and that problems and issues are escalated appropriately and clearly communicated.
 Generate reporting and dashboards with regards to project status, critical priorities, etc.
 May be required from time to time after hours (24/7/365 days) for production issue identification and resolution.
 Other duties as assigned.


 Qualifications:

 College diploma or university degree in the field of computer science and/or 10 years equivalent work experience in application development.
 Minimum 5 years of experience as Business System Analyst in financial services industry with a preference in consumer credit card management.
 Small business credit card experience is an asset.
 Detailed knowledge of TSYS TS2 and related credit card systems including Issuer and Network systems, IVR, Mobile development, Web applications and TS2 family card set up.
 Strong knowledge and insights with regards to TSYS options across various modules including:
   
 Terms
 Products and features
 Family card (Preferred)
 Statements
 Rewards
 Card management
 Authorizations
 TRIAD
 Collections
 AACE or ADM

 Have strong aptitude to solution complex business scenarios using TSYS options and vendor partners.
 Strong analytical, communication, organizational and project management skills.
 Knowledge and proficiency of deliverables in each phase of SDLC and Product Life cycle.
 Demonstrate leadership, interpersonal and stakeholder management skills.
 Adept in Microsoft office products – Excel, PowerPoint, including MS Project.



 Schedule: Full time
 

 Shift: Day
 

 Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
 

 Work Location: 1 Mount Pleasant (083), Toronto, ON
 

 Travel Requirements: None
 

 Posting Category/Function: Banking & Operations
 

 Requisition ID: 272593
 



 Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:




 Our people are at the heart of our success
 Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
 We do what’s right, each and every day
 We believe in the power of new ideas
 We work as one team, with one vision
 We give back to our communities and protect our environment



 What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.  Posting Notes: Corporate || Canada (CA) || ON || Toronto || [[mfield2]] ||

Title: Human Resources Analyst (Temporary for 8 months)
Company: Yee Hong Centre For Geriatric Care
Description:
Yee Hong Centre for Geriatric Care (“Yee Hong”) is one of the largest not-for-profit, culturally-appropriate seniors care organizations in Canada. At several campuses of care and other service locations across the Greater Toronto Area, Yee Hong offers a full continuum of services including active seniors programs, adult day programs, caregiver support services, transportation, meals on wheels, congregate dining, home care, long-term care, and hospice/palliative care.
Yee Hong’s vision is “Seniors living their lives to the fullest – with health, independence and dignity”. In their living setting of choice, seniors and their families are supported to optimize their physical, mental, social and spiritual well-being. Yee Hong also supports other organizations with innovating seniors care through its advisory services, training and learning centre, and research. Yee Hong has been successfully accredited by Accreditation Canada seven consecutive times since it was established in 1994.
As a recipient of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture Award in 2020, Yee Hong is committed to innovation, diversity, teamwork, integrity, collaboration and accountability. Our people are the reason our residents and clients receive excellent care and enjoy a high quality of life. Yee Hong’s progressive organizational culture and work environment attract, retain and develop the best staff, volunteers and students. Yee Hong is inviting applicants to apply for this exciting opportunity. We commit to a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace, and offer a rewarding career as a member of our stellar team.
Job: Human Resources Analyst
Job Ref. No.: 22/CO/007_IN
Status: Full Time – Temporary for 8 months, with possibility of extension
Core Function: 

The Human Resources Analyst will be responsible for gathering, researching, and analyzing data to inform Human Resources strategies and initiatives. Other responsibilities will include compiling HR reporting and analytics deliverables, including the maintenance of scheduled reporting, ad hoc reporting requests and HR dashboards, in addition to providing day-to-day operational support.

Qualifications: 

Bachelor's degree in Business or Human Resources Management, Statistics or Data Analytics or equivalent.
Previous experience working with data. Experience with HR metrics, evidence-based performance measures and benchmarking preferred
Strong administrative, organizational and time management skills
Demonstrated initiative and resourcefulness in collecting, organizing, analyzing data and present complex information and recommendations to different audiences
Strong communication (written and verbal) and presentation skills
Professional human resources designation such as CHRP, or equivalent is an asset.
Computer literacy in MS office. Intermediate skills in Excel, Access and PowerPoint.
Excellent oral and written communication skills in English; Knowledge of Chinese will be an asset
Satisfactory Police Reference Check (with vulnerable sector screen) result

Working Condition: 

Light
Occasional travel within the Yee Hong Centres

Note:

Yee Hong is an equal opportunity employer committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection process. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process providing the applicant has met the bona-fide requirements for the open position. If contacted for this employment opportunity, please advise if you require any accommodation

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. 
Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract
Schedule:

8 hour shift
