Title: Inventory Analyst (FT)
Description:
Inventory Analyst



 General Description:


   We are looking for an Inventory Analyst who is highly analytical, comfortable dealing with large sets of data and thinks outside the box. The perfect fit would be someone that knows the fundamentals of planning, inventory management and inventory allocation. The role of the Inventory Analyst is to manage inventory items and control day-to-day inventory operations. Attention to detail, and exceptional organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills are necessary for this role.
 


 Responsibilities:


 Process Stock Returns analysis and coordinate returns to core vendors as per the established schedule.
 Analyze and maintain stock levels as per the organization's criteria with respect of stock requirements.
 Work with the Supply Chain group.
 Following any discrepancies between physical and system recorded inventory.
 Maintain system pricing up to date and perform sales pricing analysis.
 Valid items creation and update information in the company’s operating systems.
 Work with warehouse and logistics departments to determine and set up inventory transfers.
 Perform other related duties as assigned.



 Work experience Requirements:


 Intermediate Excel skills including experience with macro, Vlookup, pivot tables and advanced formulas.
 Bilingual (French and English)
 Excellent organization skills
 Must have strong communication and interpersonal skills to communicate with all levels of employees, suppliers, and customers (internal and external)
 Keen attention to detail and self-motivated



 Education Requirements:


 College degree with a speciality in supply chain/inventory management, or equivalent
 Minimum of 3 years’ experience in Inventory and/or pricing Management & ERP systems

Title: Analyste de recherche / Research Analyst
Description:
Overview: 
  Résumé de l’emploi

 En collaboration avec les collègues de l’équipe régionale, ce poste mettra en valeur vos compétences techniques et relationnelles ainsi que votre expertise en analyse immobilière dans tous les types de produits afin d’aider à assembler les fichiers de données pertinents et à les utiliser pour élaborer et communiquer l’intelligence du marché axée sur les données. Votre adoption des technologies exclusives d’Avison Young vous permettra de naviguer harmonieusement les conditions sans précédent du marché et celles contigües à celui-ci, en partageant l’intelligence provenant de la combinaison de données, d’analyses, la visualisation et l’automatisation. Cette approche permettra aux clients externes d’Avison Young de devenir plus productifs et rendra nos intervenants internes plus efficaces. Ces deux groupes auront donc plus de succès dans leurs projets communs.

 _________________________


 Working with colleagues in the Regional Team, this position will leverage your interpersonal and technical skillsets along with your real estate analytical expertise across product types to help assemble relevant statistics and use them to develop and communicate relevant market insights. Your adoption of proprietary Avison Young technologies will allow you to seamlessly navigate unprecedented real estate and real estate-adjacent market conditions by sharing insights leveraging the powerful intersection of a wealth of data sources, proprietary analytics and visualization. This approach has proven to allow Avison Young’s external clients to make better decisions and improve our internal stakeholder’s effectiveness and success rates in their common ventures. 
 Qualifications: 
  Compétences requises

 Excellentes aptitudes de rédaction en français ou en anglais, idéalement les deux. Bilinguisme à l’oral essentiel.
 Baccalauréat ou expérience équivalente requise. Une maîtrise dans un domaine relié à l’immobilier, les finances, l’économie ou les affaires serait un atout.
 2 années et plus d’expérience en immobilier d’entreprise un atout, mais d’autres expériences professionnelles pertinentes peuvent être considérées.
 Aptitude éprouvée pour présenter à l’aide de divers outils électroniques à des publics externes, y compris des clients.
 Excellentes aptitudes de communication orale et écrite. Communication aisée avec les clients et aptitude à produire des livrables complexes dans des délais serrés, en collaboration avec une équipe multidisciplinaire.
 Être une personne motivée et énergique pouvant travailler de façon autonome, avec peu de supervision.
 Capacité d’adaptation et de performer dans un environnement de travail dynamique qui peut changer rapidement, avec des priorités variées et évolutives quant aux clients et aux tâches.


   _________________________
 

 Exceptional written communication skills in English and/or French, ideally both. Conversation skills in both French and English required 
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required; Master’s degree preferred in a real estate, finance, economics, business or related field
 2+ years of commercial real estate or consulting experience preferred, but other relevant professional experience considered
 Proven ability to present using different digital mediums to external audiences including clients
 Ability to engage and communicate with clients and produce complex deliverables under tight deadlines in partnership with an interdisciplinary team
 Highly motivated and energetic individual with the ability to be self-directed and work with minimal supervision
 Adaptable to thrive in a fast-paced and quickly changing workplace and market environment, with various and evolving client and work priorities.


 Responsibilities: 
  Tâches et responsabilités principales


 Collaborer avec l’équipe régionale pour assurer qu’Avison Young a une vision claire, analytique et axée sur les données des tendances actuelles, et un aperçu de celles à venir pour tous les marchés et secteurs d’intérêt dans la région. Cet aperçu doit être informé par les tendances à échelle nationale et internationale, être mis à jour régulièrement et communiqué clairement et efficacement aux principaux intervenants.
 Développer une expertise précise sur des secteurs géographiques particuliers et/ou des secteurs du marché immobilier régional, communiquer efficacement avec les collègues et les clients sur l’immobilier et les tendances reliées ainsi que l’activité du marché dans la région.
 Soutenir et parfois mener la préparation de documents réguliers ou ponctuels qui aident à comprendre les tendances immobilières locales et régionales ainsi que leurs implications pour les clients. Ces documents peuvent inclure des produits concernant les données, des commentaires écrits ou du matériel de présentation tel que demandé par les lecteurs cibles.
 Travailler au sein d’une équipe pour impliquer nos clients occupants et investisseurs afin de les guider au fil des conditions du marché en utilisant nos outils analytiques numériques exclusifs, qui aident à façonner et élaborer leurs stratégies immobilières de façon plus dynamique et harmonieuse.
 Contribuer activement à identifier de nouveaux clients pour Avison Young, en proposant le meilleur moyen d’aborder, engager et poursuivre de telles opportunités.
 En partenariat avec notre équipe de données et d’autres collègues, tel que requis, pour aider à la cueillette et l’analyse et données immobilières économiques et démographiques ainsi que sur les occupants et l’investissement.
 Participer, selon votre niveau d’ancienneté et votre expertise, dans des engagements choisis de la presse, de relations publiques et de l’industrie immobilière, y compris des entrevues, des panels de discussion, des communiqués de presse et des présentations.
 Soutenir les analystes de données avec la saisie de données lorsque requis.
 Collaborer avec l’équipe d’innovation et intelligence de marché pour discussions et pour construire et aider à faire évoluer nos plateformes.
 Identifier et communiquer de possibles améliorations dans le processus de travail pour les clients et les collègues.
 Poursuivre un programme de développement professionnel continu à l’aide de lectures choisies, de séminaires et de formation continue.
 Exécuter d’autres tâches ponctuelles qui peuvent être attribuées par le supérieur immédiat ou la direction.


   _______________________
 


 Working closely with our Ottawa and Montréal teams to ensure Avison Young has a clear, data-based, analytically informed view of current trends and future outlook for all relevant real estate markets and sectors within the region; this view must be informed by wider trends at national and global levels, be updated on a timely basis, and communicated clearly and effectively to key stakeholders
 Develop “subject matter expertise” on the Greater Montreal and National Capital Area real estate markets, communicating effectively with colleagues and clients on real estate and related trends and market activity within the region
 Supporting and in some cases leading the preparation of regular or ad hoc analytical outputs that promote understanding of local and regional real estate trends and their implications for clients. These outputs may include data products, written commentaries or presentation material as appropriate for the audience concerned.
 Working as part of a team to engage our occupier and investor clients to guide them through market conditions by leveraging our proprietary digital data analytics tools that help to shape and solve their real estate strategies more dynamically and seamlessly
 Proactively contributing to identifying new clients for Avison Young, suggesting how best to approach, engage and pursue those opportunities
 Partnering with our Data Team and other colleagues as necessary to support collection and analysis of economic, demographic and occupier and investment real estate data
 Participating as appropriate to your level of seniority and knowledge in select press, public relations and real estate industry engagements, including interviews, panel discussions, press releases and presentations;
 Support Data Analysts with data input as needed
 Partner with and provide input to the Innovation & Insight teams to build and evolve our platform
 Identifying and communicating possible improvements in the work process for customers and peers
 Pursuing a program of continued self-development through the use of selected reading, seminars and participation in continuing education
 Performing other ad hoc duties as assigned by immediate supervisor or upper management.

Title: Business Analyst - Workplace Safety and Health
Description:
Under the general direction of Manager of Organizational Safety Services, the Business Analyst – Workplace Safety and Health (‘the analyst’) is responsible for using a deep understanding of workplace safety and health legislation and best practice as well as business process and technology, to help business partners prevent workplace injury/illness and enhance related programming. The analyst identifies trends, threats and opportunities and recommends standards, protocols, systems and changes required to achieve organizational goals. This includes analysis and design of processes, functional specifications, innovative solutions, project documentation and training to support organizational change. It also includes development and execution of pilots and test plans to ensure the solutions deliver the expected business value.
 As the Business Analyst – Workplace Safety and Health, you will:

Research, analyze and document emerging workplace safety and health issues, trends and requirements through review of legislation and guidance documents, stakeholder consultation, process mapping, and data analysis in order to identify potential solutions (standards, processes and systems).
Engage with business partners through dialogue and analysis to identify workplace safety and health needs and solutions.
Partner with technical team to design workplace safety and health solutions and systems to meet business needs.
Lead, coordinates and/or facilitate organizational changes to workplace safety and health standards, systems or processes.
Enhance awareness and knowledge of workplace safety and health standards, initiatives, systems and changes through training, documentation and support.
Report key performance indicators and make recommendations for improvement.

 Your education and qualifications include:


A University degree in Business Administration or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.


Certificate in Occupational Health and Safety an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.


The following Designations, Licenses, Certificates, etc. would be considered an asset: Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP), Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA), Canadian Registered Safety Professional (CRSP).


Three to five years’ experience leading workplace safety and health initiatives and working with senior stakeholders.


Three to five years progressive business systems analysis experience, including leading the analysis effort on major initiatives and data modelling and analysis. 


Ability to analyze and asses the organizational impacts of change with the ability to lead/ facilitate meetings to elicit requirements, design solutions, and achieve alignment.


Problem solving skills with the ability to make sound decisions identifying high leverage intervention points and strategies to achieve target outcomes. 


Verbal communication skills with ability to create proposals, make recommendations supported by strong logic and engage and influence partners. 


Organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and meet deadlines in a high stress environment.


Interpersonal skills with the ability to establish and maintain positive working relationships with employees at all levels of the organization, external contacts, and the public.


Written communication and documentation skills with ability to produce clear and concise business cases and process requirements and functional specifications.


Knowledge of workplace safety and health legislation, guidelines and best practices.



 Conditions of employment:

The successful applicant must maintain legal eligibility to work in Canada. If the successful applicant possesses a work permit, it is their responsibility to ensure the permit remains valid.
A Police Information Check satisfactory to the employer will be required from the applicant(s) or successful candidate(s), at their expense.

 CORE COMPETENCIES FOR ALL EMPLOYEES OF THE CITY OF WINNIPEG:

Citizen & Customer Focus
Respecting Diversity
Ethics and Values
Integrity and Trust
Results Oriented

Title: Logistics Analyst
Description:
POSITION: Logistics Analyst
 
REPORTS TO: Transportation Manager - Bimbo Bakehouse
 
LOCATION: Concord (Vaughan), Ontario
 
TYPE: Remote
 
 We are looking for an experienced Logistics Analyst who will oversee Supply Chain processes and product delivery by tracking and reviewing invoices, shipment status, and delivery route activity. You will be responsible for overseeing the entire life cycle of a product, including purchase, distribution, internal allotment, release and final clearance of resources.
 
 A successful Logistics Analyst should have deep knowledge of logistics and production planning concepts along with excellent communication skills and an analytical mind with business acumen.
 

WHAT YOU’LL DO:

Collects, interprets, and analyzes various types of logistics data including availability of product, reliability of transport and delivery, and other data related to product supply chain management, sourcing, and distribution.
Maintains database(s) of logistics information. OTM report building, financial, operational metrics, forecasting.
Tracks product flow from origin to delivery via web-based logistics systems and other appropriate methods of monitoring inventory and shipment vehicles. Route building, and lane analysis.
Reviews logistics processes and procedures; identifies, recommends, and implements improvements to maximize delivery efficiency while minimizing costs. Pricing request from Sales.
Reviews and analyzes transportation costs, parts procurement and delivery processes, inventory issues such as back orders, and other fulfillment metrics.
Uses analytic methods and tools to understand, predict, and/or control logistics operations and processes. Support continuous improvement initiatives.
Monitors warehouse facilities to evaluate inventory transactions such as receiving, storage, shipping, and inventory integrity.
Performs other related duties, as assigned.


WHAT YOU’LL BRING

Bachelor’s degree in finance, Supply Chain Management, Industrial Engineering, or related field required.
2-4 years of experience in an Analyst role.
Previous experience in logistics field required.
Possess and utilize excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers, and subject matter experts.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot issues and find solutions in a timely manner.
Highly organized with the ability to multitask and prioritize tasks.
Extensive knowledge of shipping and distribution channels.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or similar software.


Must be knowledgeable and be able to follow GMPs, Food Safety and Health and Safety requirements

Title: Microsoft BI Developer (SQL Server/SSIS/SSAS/ASP.NET/C#)
Description:
Adresse : 100 King Street West 
 
Groupe de famille d'emploi : Technologie 
 
OVERVIEW: 
Working within BMO's Risk division the Microsoft Business Intelligence (BI) Developer will work with the team to design, develop, implement, support and administer BI applications. Utilizing their knowledge of databases, ETL (Extract / Transform / Load) and application development they will create apps using SQL Server BI tools (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS) and ASP.NET/C#. For this entry level position we are looking for someone with a few years of experience and/or a good educational background in IT development with a focus on development, ETL and DBs.  
MANDATE: 

The Risk Reporting department is part of the Enterprise Risk and Portfolio Management (ERPM) division of BMO - Bank of Montreal. ERPM is BMO’s risk group and is responsible for monitoring and helping to define policies and procedures that address areas of significant risk. Risk Reporting monitors and reports on Credit Risk within BMO and therefore is accountable for the design, implementation and execution of consistent, effective risk reporting for the key stakeholders including the Board, senior management, rating agencies and our regulators. 

Within Risk Reporting the Data Services Development and Operations team is responsible for designing holistic solutions that encompass department and enterprise wide needs. This will include assisting the team in various capacities with the development and support of staged data for reports, data cubes, data adjustments, data quality monitoring, operational reports, and an automated production environment. The team will also work closely with BMO’s technology team to help guide the efficient provisioning and operation of the systems, databases and applications that support Risk Reporting. 

The Technical Specialist position will require the individual to participate in the detailed design and development of projects for Risk Reporting. On these projects he/she will assist in designing efficient, effective and timely applications. This position will require the incumbent will use his/her experience and knowledge of the software development life cycle (SDLC), development tools, problem resolution and application support. He/She will continually look for ways to improve the efficiency and delivery of developed processes. The incumbent will ensure that the development standards and processes will result in an efficient, stable and reliable environment for Risk Reporting. 

For this entry level position we are looking for someone with a few years of experience and a good educational background in IT development with a focus on development, ETL and DBs. 

ACCOUNTABILITIES: 

1. Development: She/he will ensure that the following key criteria are met: 

Developing robust, scalable applications and processes 


Building data quality checks into developed applications and processes 


An appropriate level of documented unit testing is performed prior to implementation 


Metadata is captured for all transformations and processes, and an impact analysis is carried out prior to any enhancements. 


User acceptance testing is performed when appropriate to ensure that the client agrees to the final deliverable. 


2. Support of Production Processes / Applications / Systems: The incumbent will help implement and support production processes / applications / systems within the Risk Reporting environment. She/he will provide support by analyzing and resolving production problems with Risk Reporting developed applications and processes. In particular, the position must ensure that 

Problems / errors are thoroughly investigated and resolved in a timely manner by involving the appropriate IT and business specialists. 


Processes and system enhancements are implemented to prevent reoccurrences of issues. 


Timely off-hours support is provided on evenings, weekends and holidays 


Preparation or implementation of processes / applications into and automated production environment 


Administration of applications / systems to ensure functionality, availability, performance and security are maintained 


SKILLED KNOWLEDGE: 

Qualifications: 

2+ years of development experience. 


2+ years’ experience with Microsoft SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, T-SQL Stored Procedures 


Experience designing and developing ETL processes would be beneficial 


MSBI administration experience (SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS and SharePoint) would be beneficial 


Experience with MS Visual Studio, VB.NET, ASP.NET would be beneficial 


Experience with Power BI development would be beneficial 


General Knowledge/Skills 


Is driven and can work on their own with minimal supervision. 


Will “own” the tasks given to them. Must be able to drive tasks to completion by seeking out help when needed and understanding task deadlines. 


Is innovative and always seeks out better ways to do things. Both in the tasks presented to them but also in other areas within their work environment. 


Is curious about technology and seeks out ways to gather more experience in new areas. 


Strong troubleshooting/problem solving abilities. 


Excellent oral and written communication skills. 


Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint. 


Experience in Financial Service industry and Risk Reporting would an asset. 


Education: 

Undergraduate computer science degree or related IT certification. 


Ici, pour vous. 

À BMO, nous sommes animés par une raison d’être commune : Avoir le cran de faire une différence dans la vie, comme en affaires. Cette raison d’être nous invite à entraîner des changements positifs et durables pour nos clients, nos collectivités et nos gens. En travaillant ensemble, en innovant et en repoussant les limites, nous transformons des vies et des entreprises et favorisons la croissance économique partout dans le monde. 

En tant que membre de l'équipe de BMO, vous êtes valorisé, respecté et entendu, et vous avez plus de moyens pour progresser et obtenir des résultats. Nous nous efforçons de vous aider à obtenir des résultats dès le premier jour, pour vous-même et nos clients. Nous vous offrirons les outils et les ressources dont vous avez besoin pour franchir de nouvelles étapes, car vous aidez nos clients à franchir les leurs. Au moyen de formation et de coaching approfondis ainsi que de soutien de la direction et d'occasions de réseautage, nous vous aiderons à acquérir une expérience enrichissante et à élargir votre groupe de compétences. 

Pour en savoir plus, visitez-nous à l'adresse https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/fr . 

BMO s'engage à offrir un milieu de travail inclusif, équitable et accessible. Nous apprenons de nos différences et tirons notre force des gens et de leurs différents points de vue. Des mesures d’adaptation sont disponibles sur demande pour les candidats qui participent à tous les aspects du processus de sélection. Pour demander des mesures d’adaptation, veuillez communiquer avec votre recruteur. 

Remarque aux recruteurs : BMO n’accepte pas les curriculum vitæ non sollicités provenant de toute source autre que le candidat directement. Tout curriculum vitæ non sollicité envoyé à BMO, directement ou indirectement, sera considéré comme la propriété de BMO. BMO ne paiera aucuns frais pour les placements découlant de la réception d’un curriculum vitæ non sollicité. Une agence de recrutement doit d’abord détenir une entente de service écrite valide et dûment signée avant d’envoyer des curriculum vitæ.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Sr. Data Analyst, Technology – Data & Analytics
 The Data & Analytics organization is looking for a highly motivated individual with strong organizational and analytical skills for the position of Senior Data Analyst. This role will be responsible for working with data subject experts to research questions about data sources, connections to other sources, lineage and ownership for projects within the newly created Target State Migrations team.
 You will be a part of the Data & Analytics organization, whose strategic goal is to create a world-class Data & Analytics company by building, embedding, and maturing a data-driven culture across Thomson Reuters.
 About the Role
 In this opportunity as Sr. Data Analyst, you will:

 Perform data requirement capture and analysis as needed for the projects.
 Map the data journey from operational system sources through any transformations in transit to its delivery into enterprise repositories (Warehouse, Data Lake, Master Data, etc.)
 Deliver detailed analysis of multiple data sources and collaborate with Data Modelers and Data Engineers.
 Innovate with new approaches to metadata elicitation, documentation, and usability by business stakeholders
 Facilitate implementation of metadata tagging, lineage/provenance practices and data quality measurement.
 Effectively communicate and liaise with other data management teams embedded across the organization and data consumers in data science and business analytics teams.
 Analyze existing data pipelines and document them as required.

 About You
 You’re a fit for the role of Sr. Data Analyst if your background includes:

 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required, Computer Science or related technical degree preferred.
 5+ years of relevant experience working with databases, data warehouses or Data and Analytics or technology operations.
 Knowledgeable about Data modelling 3NF & Dimensional, including conceptual, logical and physical.
 Proficient in SQL; experience in Analyzing data pipelines, including data models and data processing
 Hands-on experience with programming and scripting languages.
 Beginner Knowledge of AWS, Snowflake, Python, and broad understanding of technologies used to build and operate data and analytic systems.
 Excellent critical thinking, communication, presentation, documentation, troubleshooting and collaborative problem-solving skills.
 Ability to conduct business requirement gathering and analysis.


 What’s in it For You?
 You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

 COVID-19 Response: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
 Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
 Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
 Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
 Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
 Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.



 Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

 We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward. 

Accessibility 

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

 We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

 Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings click here to know more.

 More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

Title: Capacity Planning Analyst
Description:
Position Purpose

 Capacity Planning Analysts are responsible for leading small to medium subsets of larger projects and initiatives and individual processes that bring value to The Home Depot. They must possess a high level of analytical ability to distinguish multiple components of a problem and develop conclusions using quantitative skills. Key responsibilities include but are not limited to leading peers on projects, effective communication to teams and leaders, reviewing and understanding capacity/supply chain operational data, and identifying trends in the retail and supply chain industry. A successful Capacity Planning Analyst will possess and demonstrate strong leadership skills, analytical ability and communication. 
  

Position Responsibilities:


 Support optimization of daily inbound and outbound transportation plans in a Transportation Management System and daily/weekly inbound appointment schedules into the distribution centres
 Partner with Transportation and Distribution to determine key opportunities for continuous improvement within the planning cycle and output to drive both short term and long term improvement
 Partner with the Inventory Planning and Replenishment team to determine and execute capacity mitigation opportunities to improve overall productivity
 Evaluate existing reporting and analytic tools, document deficiencies and new requirements
 Validate that reporting and data analysis tools meet documented business requirements
 Provide subject matter expertise in the areas of reporting, data analysis and data models
 Perform data management through a combination of data mining, data modeling, data analysis, problem analysis; while executing day to day processes related to area of responsibility.
 Present and communicate reporting related information and learning content
 Facilitate communication with business stakeholders regarding status and reporting related initiatives
 Support the business through ad-hoc queries, and maintains reports from a variety of resources as specific to department or organizational needs 


Experience & Knowledge Required:


 Must fill minimum time-in-position and performance management code requirement of M+
 Bachelor degree or equivalent degree in a field of study (e.g. Industrial Engineering) related to the positions would be considered an asset
 2-5 years’ experience
 Experience with Six Sigma or other Process Improvement Methodology
 Proficient in: Microsoft Office Suite including Access, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, Visual Basic, SQL, Word and Visio.
 Knowledge of SAP, Manhattan WMS and Manhattan TMS would be a definite asset
 Clarifies and resolves complex business issues by breaking them down into meaningful components to determine root cause and redesigning internal and external business processes.
 Writes, speaks, and presents clearly and succinctly across a variety of communication settings and adjusts communication style to the audience by translating and articulating technical concepts to non-technical groups.
 Demonstrates originality and imagination in thinking while developing a solution to a problem.
 Utilizes fundamental concepts of finance to manage budgets, forecast costs, and provide information to account for the financial impact of decision-making.
 Adapts to and embraces change with composure, resilience, and perseverance in the face of constraints, high pressure, and adverse situations.

Title: IT- Reporting Analyst
Description:
About Northland Recognized throughout Canada as one of the most trusted names in hotels, restaurants, and sports & entertainment. Northland Properties Corporation is the force behind such brands as Sandman Hotel Group, The Sutton Place Hotels, Moxie's Grill & Bar, Chop Steakhouse & Bar, Denny's Restaurants, the Dallas Stars, Grouse Mountain, Revelstoke Mountain Resort, and Northland Asset Management Company. 
Business Challenge As Northland continues to rapidly expand its business across Canada, the US, and the UK, the company invests in cutting-edge technology to build a more customized and localized experience for its target markets. Technology and Marketing teams are spearheading initiatives such as a new eCommerce platform, Data Lake, CRM & ERP, and other future-focused Hotel and Restaurant technologies. 
Opportunity Northland is looking for a Reporting Analyst who will be a part of our Data & Analytics team and play a key role in executing the overall data visualization strategy. They will be responsible for designing, developing, managing, and supporting the dashboards/reports using Power BI, emphasizing data quality and visualization principles/standards.
 They will be required to collaborate with our business and technical teams in understanding the business problem and compile essential data into interactive visualizations that are easy to understand and interpret. They will also contribute directly to developing and enhancing data & analytics-related processes and procedures.
 This position is based in Vancouver, Canada and will report to the Director, Project Delivery. They will work closely with the IT, Finance, Marketing, and other internal departments to power insight and provide immersive dashboards to make impactful data-driven decisions.
 Responsibilities:

 Understand, translate and present business data through informative Power BI visuals and reports while designing efficient data models to transform the data into meaningful insights.
 Performs data analysis for verifying and evaluating data requirements, profiling for data quality, cleansing, modelling and prepping the data for visualizations.
 Analyze, design, deploy, troubleshoot and support all aspects of refreshing data sources, scheduling, data, reports and access for Power BI dashboards/reports.
 Works closely with the business and technical teams from the requirements phase by building initial sketches/prototypes to deploying the visualization reports in production systems and participating in the enhancements over time for performance improvements and suggestions.
 Continually monitors and verifies the data quality of visualization reports and develops KPI's/alerts.
 Create plans for testing dashboards & reports, from unit to integration and user acceptance testing.
 Create technical and other supporting documentation, such as metadata, data modelling and data lineage information concerning the dashboards/reports.
 Performs administrative activities as required, including monitoring the platform, data and dashboards security, roles, access and authentications.
 Proactively researches, consults, and recommends best practices, new functionalities and capabilities in Power BI, always seeking continuous improvement.
 Partners with the Project delivery team to establish enterprise-level reporting standards, processes and support models.


 Skills & Qualifications:

 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Technology, Information Systems or related field, or equivalent work experience
 Minimum three years of hands-on experience in designing, modelling and building interactive dashboards with Power BI, including writing complex DAX and SQL queries and implementing row-level securities.
 In-depth understanding of Microsoft Power BI ecosystem, Microsoft BI stack (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS) and dimensional data modelling.
 Strong Knowledge of visualization principles, including applying colour hierarchy, visual charts and design-oriented thinking focusing on end-users.
 Expertise working with Excel, SQL Server and Microsoft Azure Data services
 Advanced understanding of Data Management, Business Intelligence and Analytics concepts, including ETL, Data Warehousing, Data Lakes, Data Marts, Data Stores and cubes; Data Profiling, Data Quality, Data Governance, Master Data Management & Metadata Management.
 Creative thinker with excellent analytical thinking, problem-solving skills, and attention to detail
 Able to multi-task and prioritize workload
 Deep passion for data visualization and user experience design
 Strong communication skills with the ability to present information to technical and non-technical stakeholders
 Experience in the hospitality and travel industry preferred

 SUMMATION:
 Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.
 You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.
 **Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.
 **We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**
 **ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

Title: NA
Description: NA

Title: Analyst, Asset Management
Description:
YOU will assist in carrying out the team’s strategy to grow and drive results within a multi-residential portfolio. They will perform an analysis of the current asset portfolio, complete financial analysis on value-enhancing strategies, assist in developing operating budgets, and collaborate with different departments to determine how to maximize the value of assets.
 WHAT WILL YOU DO:

 Establish and foster strong relationships throughout the organization as a multifamily asset management expert.
 Oversee and interact with the property management team at Avenue Living Communities; support the operations team in understanding the asset strategy and performance expectations required to achieve financial targets.
 Prepare and present reports on asset performance to executives and various stakeholders, recommend and implement approved revisions as necessary.
 Develop pro-formas and budgets to align asset level strategies to financial goals and valuations; including scenario analysis of different strategies to present suggestions to executives
 Gather detailed market, historical, and asset information including rents, ancillary revenues, operating costs, and margins.
 Developing asset strategy plans for individual properties including long-term plans, projected performance, risk assessment, and market influences. Evaluate alignment of the capital plan and financial targets for the properties.
 Assist the investment team with acquisition assumptions and due diligence to support underwriting. Prepare detailed information for executives and the capital market team as required on asset performance.
 Assisting with budget preparation; support in setting operational and financial targets that achieve organizational goals; helping to develop and refine assumptions with the property management team; reviewing and refining budgets to improve quality; and, preparing presentation materials for field and executive levels.
 Analyzing, collecting, and presenting data from various sources, this includes using SQL to gather information from our internal software, collecting data from webpages, and other sources
 Develop and strengthen relationships with industry peers.
 Ah hoc projects as required.


 WHAT WILL YOU NEED:


 Prior experience in real estate and/or a strong interest to learn about the industry is required
 Undergraduate Degree in Finance, Accounting, Data Analytics, or Commerce
 Advanced Microsoft Office skills, including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
 Enrolled or willing to purse a financial designation is an asset (CFA, CPA etc.)
 Knowledge of SQL, Python, or R is considered an asset
 Effective communication: developing relationships within the organization is key. This role relies on successful collaboration across departments making effective communication skills essential
 Creative problem-solving: there are multiple ways to analyze data and solve problems; this role caters to someone who is curious, creative, and a good problem solver.
 Passion for real estate: this role is heavily involved in the day-to-day operation of multi-family assets.


 WHAT DO WE OFFER:


 We live and breathe our core values. We go the extra mile. We’re honest. We always have each other's back. We have tons of integrity. And we always own it and adapt - no matter the challenge.
 With the support to do things differently, grow personally and professionally and bring your whole self to work, there's no limit to the impact you can make.
 We provide a competitive compensation package composed of a group benefits plan, and discretionary profit-sharing program.
 We are committed to a strong safety work environment.


 What makes us different makes us stronger. We want Avenue Living to be a great place to work for everyone; where people feel safe, included, inspired, trusted, and supported so they can be, and bring, their best. We’re committed to creating a respectful and inclusive workplace where unique perspectives, experiences, backgrounds, cultures and attributes are valued and utilized to help achieve better results. As an organization with operations across different geographies, we celebrate the fact that our workforce is made up of people with diverse demographics. We are committed to ensuring our workplace is fair, equitable and free of discrimination and harassment.

 Subject to reasonable accommodation, this position will require the successful candidate to show proof of vaccination.

 By submitting your application, you are giving your consent for us to contact you by phone, text or email.

Title: Senior Salesforce Business Analyst
Description:
We need someone that goes above and beyond gathering requirements, we need someone that can drive the conversation and lead client requirement conversations by leveraging technical and functional experience

 This resource will develop requirements and manage IQVIA HCP Network product development. This product forms a major technical foundational component in IQVIA’s overall clinical trials strategy to deliver patient services. The role will require collaborating cross-functionally with clinical stakeholders, technology teams, offshore resources and third party vendors. Candidates should have in depth experience working with end users, developers, and other analysts to refine identified business needs through design reviews and information sessions. Candidates should be results driven, detailed orientated and work well within a global, dynamic and creative team. This candidate should have experience working in an agile environment.

 RESPONSIBILITIES:

Act as subject matter expert on Salesforce products
Perform requirements gathering and analysis in order to provide high quality and detailed requirements, ensuring the closest involvement with, and agreement from, the user community
Collaborate with designated members of the applicable business groups and product development team to create requirement documents
Facilitate and/or participate in joint analysis and design sessions with developers to understand needs of the customer
Assist with process modeling to clarify business requirements, and to enhance or re-engineer business processes, prior to, or in parallel with, solution design and implementation, as necessary
Collaborate with the HCP Network technical staff members and technical staff of existing products to build orchestrated technology and processes.
Collaborate with developers and other analysts to ensure adherence to business requirements and customer needs
Understand and Resolve conflicting end-user requirements
Author and enter requirements/user stories into a requirements management tool, such as Top Team and Jira
Follow IQVIA System Life-Cycle (SLC) and Computer System Validation (CSV) procedures, as appropriate
As needed, review SLC Development and Validation document(s) prior to authorization, to ensure that it incorporates previously-captured requirements, and includes tests or test steps that explicitly address each identified user requirement
Collaborate with functional groups by adhering to established processes to ensure that business requirements are delivered through successful project implementation of optimal, cost-effective solutions

 Collaborate with project team to ensure timely delivery and quality of all project deliverables

 REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

5 years of Business Analyst experience
Strong ability to communicate technical and data concepts to non-technical audiences, and business concepts to technical audiences
Strong analytical, organizational, verbal communication and business writing skills
Strong relationship building and facilitation skills to work directly with business users who are not technical in nature
Critical thinking abilities to take complex, ambiguous, abstract requirements and break them into smaller components, patterns, views and features
Strong knowledge of technical and grammatical editing
Strong knowledge of Software Development Life Cycles (SDLC) and agile lifecycle methodologies and the role of Business Analysis with the SDLC
Strong understanding of the Salesforce platform


 PREFERRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

Experience with validated systems
Salesforce admin certification or above
Familiarity with Agile development methodology
Pharma/CRO or healthcare experience within a regulated industry


 #LI-ZW1

 IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

Title: Business Systems Analyst II
Description:
Business Systems Analyst II - HYBRID


 Can you effectively document and communicate business requirements to IT developers?
 Do you enjoy writing IT testing and end user testing plans?
 Can you ensure that projects stay on time and avoid project creep?


   As a Business System Analyst II, you will be responsible for addressing the day-to-day needs of various sales, operations and administrative teams, including work related to system enhancements, upgrades and integration, data preparation, reporting and analytics, and works closely with stakeholders on IT/system projects at Canon Canada.
  
 Additionally, you will develop and execute transition plans to ensure successful operationalization of newly developed system enhancements, processes and solutions, which includes preparing documentation, leading training sessions, and providing subject matter support to team members, as well as during solution delivery and transition periods.
 



   We are excited to offer a new and adaptive way of working that provides flexibility in the workforce while maintaining operational readiness! By blending remote and in-office work, we are able to take advantage of the independence and flexibility that comes with working from home, and the collaboration, teamwork and sense of belonging that comes from working together face-to-face. Our Workstyle Program offers the best of both situations: structure and sociability with independence and flexibility.
  

Key Responsibilities


 Act as a point of contact to assigned business units
 Compile, Review and Analyze IT requirements with the assigned Business Units
 Work closely with the development teams to finalize the design and deliverables
 Compose internal IT testing plans
 Build, Review, and Finalize the business unit testing plans
 Support and/or Develop project plans and monitor progress
 Assist Business Units with post-implementation support


 To Succeed, You Will Need:


 Post-Seconday Degree in IT or Business Analysis
 IIBA Certification is an asset
 PMP Certification is an asset
 Minimum of 3 years of relevant work experience
 Experience in working with/analyzing JAVA applications and Oracle database
 Experience with Sharepoint, Visio, SQL
 Knowledge of Excel, Word, PowerPoint
 Project and Time Management Skills
 French is an asset


 COVID-19 SAFETY PRECAUTIONS


 Canon is committed to the health and safety of our employees, customers and communities.
 By monitoring public health conditions and following local COVID-19 guidelines, we are taking necessary precautions and putting the safety of our employees and candidates first. A critical component of our workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy.
 Employees are required to be fully vaccinated and must provide Canon with proof of vaccination or undergo regular COVID-19 Rapid Antigen Screening in order to access the workplace. Canon will provide reasonable accommodation if the successful candidate cannot be vaccinated due to grounds protected by human rights legislation in their province of employment.


 HYBRID WORK


 This position offers a Hybrid work schedule. You will be required to be in the office Mondays and Wednesdays each week, with the ability to work from home for the remainder of the week (subject to specific business needs requiring office attendance)
 When working from home, a reliable internet connection is required. Remote work is supported with cloud-based applications and collaboration tools.


 BENEFITS


 Comprehensive health coverage plan that includes medical, dental and vision
 Life insurance, disability and wellness programs
 Vacation, Paid Personal Time and Sick days
 Matching RRSP contribution & Profit Sharing Program
 Tuition Assistance Program for professional continuing education
 Discounts on Canon products, retailers, memberships and more!


 EMPLOYEE PERKS


 On-site cafeteria and outdoor patio
 Employee gym and fitness centre
 Employee referral program
 Inspire Program, online peer-to-peer recognition for redeemable points on hundreds of products.
 Community involvement

Title: Studio Planning Analyst
Description:
Company Description
  SSENSE, pronounced [es-uhns], is a Montreal-based fashion platform with global reach. Founded in 2003, SSENSE is pacing the vanguard of directional retail with a mix of luxury, streetwear, and avant-garde labels. We produce industry-leading original content and take pride in building our own technology solutions and systems from scratch. Our field of focus has grown beyond that of a typical e-commerce entity as we explore the nexus of content, commerce, and culture.
 Currently serving 150 countries, generating an average of 88 million monthly page views, and achieving high double digit annual growth since inception, SSENSE is becoming a cultural protagonist in its own right.



 Job Description
  Reporting to the Sr. Studio Planning Analyst, the Studio Planning Analyst is responsible for answering business questions using data analysis and visualizations. The Analyst translates production requirements into technical reporting requirements to create valuable insights that help ensure Studio deliverables are on time, cost effective and meet quality standards.
 This role works closely with each function within the Studio, ensuring the Studio meets its KPIs, and grows in a healthy and scalable way. The ideal candidate will work cross-functionally and requires a collaborative style, with the ability to influence and motivate to drive performance results.
 Responsibilities
 Planning & Forecasting (60%)

 Build frameworks that help define the Studio’s capacity requirements for the following season, by collecting and vetting future output estimates (number of e-commerce styles, internal requests, ad hoc projects) and analyzing against historical data and projected throughput metrics for all Studio production teams and key dependencies
 Adjust plans in-season based on actual flow of inventory, changes to throughput, and/or any other non-planned events
 Own the reporting of daily, weekly, and annual operational performance metrics
 Create and maintain KPI dashboards for all Studio disciplines to optimize ways of working for cost effectiveness and/or faster time to list
 Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to collect data requirements
 Carry out ad-hoc reporting and data analysis requests for review by the executive team, managers, partners and other stakeholders
 Document specifications for reports, dashboards, and other outputs

 Continuous Improvement and Growth Support (30%)

 Collaborate with various stakeholders of the Studio, including Finance, Technology, Product, and Real Estate, to support any strategic and growth initiatives pertaining to Studio operational processes, capacity and resource planning, including recruiting cycles, training cycles, and technology enablers
 Training and Development - 10%
 Support with onboarding related tasks, help coach and train a capable and talented team of Studio Planning Team
 Participate in developing training manuals and implementing training procedures
 Contribute to maintaining and improving the knowledge base through standard, concise and relevant documentation




 Qualifications
 

 Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Engineering, Information Technology, or related field
 A minimum of 2 years relevant experience in business analysis, data analysis or project management, e-commerce and/or creative industry experience an asset
 Prior experience in data processing, manipulating large datasets, querying databases, data analysis, and reporting
 Experience with data management and visualization software such as Tableau or similar data discovery and visualization tools an asset
 Advanced knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite, in particular Excel and PowerPoint
 Excellent English and French written and verbal communication skills,

 SKILLS

 Capacity to synthesize and simplify complex information, and clearly communicate findings
 Highly analytical with the ability to present exec-level recommendations and influence through sound quantitative and qualitative analysis
 Creative thinker with excellent problem solving abilities
 Team player with a high sense of accountability and ownership
 Ability to juggle multiple projects/multi-task and work effectively under pressure
 Ability to thrive in a fast-paced performance-driven environment, dealing with ambiguity and change
 Strong interest in retail and e-commerce and a passion for shaping the future of e-commerce an asset

Title: Accounting Analyst
Description:
Job Number:


      2022-173 
     




Business Unit:


     Winpak Division 
    




Department:


      Accounting 
     





Location:


      Winnipeg, MB 
     





Job Type:


      Full Time 
     





Close Date:


      07/29/2022 
     





Professional Areas:


      Finance/Accounting
      









Description:


Reporting to the Manager, Accounting Analysis, the Accounting Analyst is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting financial and operational data from a variety of sources. Strong communication skills will allow data analysis to be performed in consultation with subject matter experts and allow for resulting insights to be communicated verbally, in writing, and/or using financial models. A proficiency in reporting software and analytical tools (BI) will support moderate to advanced data analysis and facilitate an ongoing refinement of existing processes. As a leading user of reporting software, the candidate will also be responsible for developing and maintaining financial and operational reports utilized by a diverse set of users.


 DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Maintain familiarity with current information and ERP systems as they relate to assigned tasks - collecting and analyzing operational data and updating various financial information on an ongoing basis; assist the Manager – Accounting Analysis with the development and adaptation of new systems and procedures.
Assist the Manager – Accounting Analysis (COGNOS Administrator) with the ongoing maintenance of the business unit’s COGNOS reporting library; maintain an in-depth working knowledge of COGNOS reporting software such that the ability exists to compile/create moderate to complex level COGNOS reports to support both finance and operational demands.
Oversee and assist in the maintenance of the capital asset subledger (acquisition, disposal, and control of assets), capital expenditures status reporting, and chairing of monthly capital expenditures committee meetings.
Liaise with operations regarding capital asset policies and procedures and provide support with business case preparation during the capital project authorization phase, as required by the capital policy.
Assist in the preparation of budgets and forecasts including spending schedule compilation, historical data population, and review of purchasing information.
Assist the Costing Analyst in the preparation of quarterly standard cost updates of material inputs.
Assist the Costing Analyst in the investigation with respect to standard costing manufacturing variance results and issue manufacturing variance reporting to operations management on a weekly basis; assist the Manager – Accounting Analysis with any required adjusting journal entry preparation as required.
Complete periodic analysis and update of departmental speed and scrap rates that form the basis of standard costs for goods produced.
Prepare month-end journal entries (eg: manufacturing variance adjustments).
Prepare quarterly obsolete inventory analysis and reporting.
Assist in the development, conversion, and ongoing testing of accounting and other components of the management information system as directed by the Manager – Accounting Analysis.
Work with the Manager – Accounting Analysis to develop and prepare various management reports with the goal of assisting with continuous operational improvement.
Undertake other special projects and/or duties assigned by the Director of Finance and Administration or the Controller.
Promote teamwork, cooperation, and effective communication within the department and Company. Interact with all levels of the operation in support of Winpak’s TQI program.
Perform duties and responsibilities in a manner compliant with ISO 9001 standards.
Other duties as assigned

SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

Completion of a professional accounting designation (CPA or equivalent) or enrollment in a program targeting such completion.
3 to 5 years’ experience in an accounting/financial analysis capacity with preference given to candidates holding previous manufacturing experience.
Working knowledge of computerized accounting systems and above average skills with respect to spreadsheet software.
Previous experience and strong skills utilizing report generation software (specific experience utilizing COGNOS and/or basic computer programming skills would be considered an asset).
Previous experience conducting moderate to complex analysis on large data sets and a strong understanding of basic statistical concepts.
Ability to cross-train and maintain a working knowledge of the skills required to perform the duties assigned to the other Analyst positions.
Able to deal with all levels of an organization.
Able to work under minimal supervision and with tight deadlines.
Good interpersonal and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Strong analytical and organizational skills.

Other combinations of education, experience, knowledge, and skills will be considered.


 INDS

 Winpak is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Pre-employment drug/alcohol/background screening may be required based on facility location.


Although we appreciate all applicants, only qualified applicants will be considered for interviews.

Title: Business Intelligence Lead
Description:
OUR COMPANY BACKGROUND & CULTUREUniversity Pension Plan Ontario (UPP) is a new, jointly sponsored pension plan that serves over 37,000 members and beneficiaries from four participating universities (Queen’s University, the University of Guelph, the University of Toronto and Trent University) and 12 affiliate employers.
We are an exciting and ground-breaking pension start-up, with over $11 billion in assets under management. Our goal is to enhance the long-term sustainability of defined benefit pension plans in the university sector now and for generations to come. We are here to protect the stability of our members’ pensions and deliver service excellence—that’s our pension promise.
At UPP, we are committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and reconciliation – across race, place, culture, gender expression and sexual identity. We actively seek talent who share in this commitment and bring their whole selves to work.
THE ROLEWe are seeking a motivated experienced Business Intelligence (BI) lead with diverse experience in the different facets of data analytics, Visualization/ Dashboarding and report automation within modern cloud-based data platforms with a proven background in driving best practices with a hands-on attitude to build from ground up.
This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Business Intelligence/Visualization professional to join a team of high-performing individuals and make a great impact in a start-up organization. Reporting directly to the Director, Data and Analytics, the Business Intelligence (BI) Lead will partner with business leaders and their teams to lead the design, development, and implementation of Reporting Automation/ Dashboard/Visualization initiatives as a key input in the development BI capabilities. This role will lead and support a cross-functional matrix team that will delivery on business use cases for reporting automation, dashboarding and visualizations, in close collaboration with the broader Data & Technology team and the Business partners.
Due to COVID-19 all roles are currently home-based. Eventually, this role will be partially based in downtown Toronto with work-from-home flexibility (~2 days in office).
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES: Will be responsible for a variety of duties, including but not limited to the following:

Lead the stakeholder requirements workshops and ensure alignment of the user stories to business objectives
Lead cross-functional matrix teams for Reporting automation, Dashboarding, Visualization use cases from intake to delivery
Leading the strategic design, execution, and maintenance of the BI and visualization use cases
Create the training materials and content to support a build and ramp up of a hybrid federation model of BI development across the organization
Lead the design and development of visualizations/dashboards and along with report automation capabilities including the definition of the use case, wireframing, build of the semantic layer to delivery
Be the BI champion representing BI best practices, templates, and process across UPP and within partner stakeholders
Create and maintain interactive visualizations (i.e., Domo) through data interpretation and analysis, integrating various reporting
Create and maintain interactive data visualizations in through data interpretation and analysis, integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources
Work closely with project/delivery managers to understand and design dashboards to meet their analytical requirements, including identifying and creating or enhancing critical metrics
Ensure consistency of dashboards design across business use cases across the organization as the “Hub” in a “Hub and spoke” operating model
Facilitate and coordinate with business source system administration teams on data architecture and direct system feeds
Understand database structures and facilitate changes where required in the UPP data hub (Cloud data platform) working closely with the Data Engineering team
Oversee the publishing and operations of the visualizations, as the technology owner of the BI Toolsets (with refreshed data on a defined business need e.g., daily, weekly, quarterly, and annual basis)
Enable and support the preparation and development of reporting, presentations, and various materials for discussion at the executive level
Build efficiencies in existing processes and execution of process improvement initiatives where possible
Support the research, analysis, reporting and execution of data program initiatives
Lead special projects and ad-hoc analysis as required

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE: 

Undergraduate degree or higher post-secondary education in quantitative field of study (i.e., Math, Computer Science, Analytics, Statistics)
Minimum of 10 years of combined experience in User story/Requirements Gathering, Project intake and backlog management in agile methodologies (e.g., DevOps Kanban, Jira boards)
Minimum of 10 years combined demonstrated experience in a similar role (i.e., Business Intelligence, Analytics, Dashboard, Visualization)
Advanced hands-one expertise in a data visualization tools (i.e., Domo, Microsoft PowerBI, Tableau, Looker, Qlik Sense) and Expert Excel skills
Excellent project management skills and ability to work under pressure and manage high priority strategic projects with multiple or competing deadlines
Proven ability to communicate and synthesize complex ideas or large amounts of data into simple, concise presentations at the executive level
Exceptionally strong work ethic and a high level of analytical capabilities, attention to detail & problem-solving skills
Team player with the ability to build strong relationships across the organization at all levels; and
Strong understating of data modelling methodologies and best practices for data visualization techniques
Proven experience managing a Portfolio of Initiatives and Projects, including prioritization, and changes
Proven experience in execution and delivery to user story satisfaction
Proven experience estimating cost, capacity, and duration of initiatives

ATTRIBUTES: 

Excellent written and verbal communications
Foster a collaborative and open two-way communication on progress, issues, and blockers with both internal and external stakeholders
Ability to design and execute repeatable processes
Ability to organize and drive results from multi-layer matrix stakeholders
Ability to engage and align users and partners to reach consensus
Ability to pivot and update design to delivery as required by changing priorities and user stories
Ability to effectively identify emerging technologies, trends, standards, and products that have a strong potential to better enable UPP business units

PERSONALITY TRAITS: 

Adaptable
Optimistic
Empathetic
Inspiring
Collaborative
Self-driven
Personable
Confident
Pro-active problem solver
Ownership mindset
Continuous learner

UPP is pleased to offer accommodations for applicants with disabilities. If you are interested in applying for a job opportunity, or are contacted by UPP regarding a job opportunity, please advise of any accommodations you may require.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Engineering Systems / PLM Business Analyst
Description:
We are Industry X: We embed innovation, intelligence and sustainability in the way the world makes things and the things it makes. Industry X enables leaders to act quickly and confidently as they pivot to the future. We define Industry X as digital reinvention of manufacturing / engineering and believe that smart, sustainable, connected digital products and assets are about to create hyper-personalized industrial experiences, completely new levels of operational efficiency, transparency and traceability, tangible impact on sustainability and brand-new sources of revenue growth. Known for our ability to execute at speed, we help clients determine clear, actionable paths to competitive agility by bringing them new thinking on business and technology.

 Responsibilities of the PLM Business Analyst may include:

 Participate in requirements gathering and specifications creation
 Participate in the solution design, helping the solution architect
 Participate in specification workshops
 Develop functional specifications
 Participate in the Business process design
 Participate in industry /corporate process implementation across all related applications
 Successfully supporting the management team in different project area
 Deployment: Troubleshoot complex configuration and system issues. Document and follow up with customer issues to complete resolution
 Implementation: Prepare and support the organizational change management activities. Prepare training plan, training documentation and provide end users training.
 Documentation: Document the configuration and architecture
 Validation Tests: Conduct functional and integration testing, including preparation of test cases/scenarios and test data
 Reporting: Progress status and issues
 Maintenance: Analyze, design and produce solution enhancements
 Meet travel requirements, up to 80%
 Perform feasibility studies and process design reviews




Basic Qualifications:

 Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, or related degree
 Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) concepts and solutions


 Preferred Qualifications:

 Business Process Design Experience
 Tests management / execution experience
 Aerospace & Defense experience
 Mechanical and/or Electrical Engineering concepts and solutions
 Ability to understand business needs, articulate trade-offs, and discuss solutions with business and development teams
 Able to comfortably manage multiple tasks, communicate status, escalate issues and juggle competing priorities
 Strong team player with a “can do” attitude, and the flexibility to jump in wherever needed
 Self-starter with a bias toward action and the ability to produce results
 Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills
 Collaboration skills

Title: Data Analytics Lead Analyst - VP - Hybrid
Description:
The Data Analytics Lead Analyst is a strategic professional who stays abreast of developments within own field and contributes to directional strategy by considering their application in own job and the business. Recognized technical authority for an area within the business. Requires basic commercial awareness. There are typically multiple people within the business that provide the same level of subject matter expertise. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Significant impact on the area through complex deliverables. Provides advice and counsel related to the technology or operations of the business. Work impacts an entire area, which eventually affects the overall performance and effectiveness of the sub-function/job family.  Responsibilities:

 Integrates subject matter and industry expertise within a defined area.
 Contributes to data analytics standards around which others will operate.
 Applies in-depth understanding of how data analytics collectively integrate within the sub-function as well as coordinate and contribute to the objectives of the entire function.
 Employs developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers.
 Resolves occasionally complex and highly variable issues.
 Produces detailed analysis of issues where the best course of action is not evident from the information available, but actions must be recommended/ taken.
 Responsible for volume, quality, timeliness and delivery of data science projects along with short-term planning resource planning.
 Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

 Qualifications:

 6-10 years experience using codes for statistical modeling of large data sets

 Education:

 Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience, potentially Masters degree
