Title: Analyst- Digital & Business transformation
Description:
Don’t skip a beat, apply to Exertis-JAM!


Job Title : Analyst – Digital & Business Transformation
Division : Digital
Location : Baie d’Urfe - Hybrid
Schedule : Monday to Friday


Exertis-JAM, Making the world sound better, one brand at a time! Do these words sound like music to your ears?
Since 1972, Exertis-JAM has grown to be one of the world largest distributors of consumer electronic goods, pro-audio equipment and musical instruments. Come join us to stay true to our mission of delivering ONLY the best customer service!
What you will do:
As we embark on a multi-year digital transformation program, we are currently seeking an Analyst Digital & Business Transformation. This is a super exciting opportunity to join a team of problem solvers, and be part of a transformation, from strategy to execution.
Responsibilities:

Demonstrate clear passion for making an impact in business transformation
Demonstrate business acumen and understanding of operating models
Support end-to-end Operations transformation projects, focused on evaluating current state, identifying opportunities, and creating transformation business cases, including the supporting technologies
Participate in cross functional teams across business and operations to develop and deliver end-to-end operations strategies
Support process improvement and operational effectiveness approaches, with a focus on end-to-end supply chain
Use analytics tools to simulate and support decision making process

What we are looking for:

An interest in upskilling for a digital world and technology trends, an openness to learning new tools and adapting how you work
Proven problem solving, critical thinking, and ability to make connections between information and concepts from different sources
Excellent report writing and oral presentation skill and demonstrated experience
Strong analytical skills, experience with Alteryx/Power BI or equivalent
Ability to work within a fast-paced, collaborative, and team-based project environment.
Comfortable working iteratively and in situations without detailed instructions.
A bachelor’s degree in operations management, engineering, mathematics, supply chain, sciences or a related field
Experience in Management consulting or Data & Analytics a plus

Ready to join our team? Here is why we are one big, happy JAMily…

Group Insurance Benefits: Health & Dental, Vision, Life, Critical Illness, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability.
Wellness Incentive Program, and an Employee Assistance Program.
RRSP matching program.
Work-life balance is key: Flextime, summer hours, paid vacation, personal time off.
We value work life balance and offer a causal and fun environment.
Lively social calendar… there’s always something for everyone!
Generous employee discount on all our cool gear.
Ongoing learning opportunities.
Not to mention the opportunity to work in a highly talented, winning team!


 
Ne perdez pas le rythme – Postulez chez Exertis | JAM ! 
Titre du poste : Analyste – Transformation numérique et d'affaires
Division : Digital
Localisation : Baie d'Urfé - Hybride
Horaire : du lundi au vendredi, 2 jours sur place, 3 jours à distance


Exertis | JAM, faire que le monde sonne mieux, une marque à la fois! Est-ce que ces mots résonnent comme de la musique à vos oreilles?
Depuis 1972, Exertis | JAM est devenu un des plus importants distributeurs de matériel électronique, d’appareillage de sonorisation professionnelle et d’instruments de musique. Venez nous joindre pour demeurer fidèle à notre mission première d’offrir uniquement le meilleur service à la clientèle possible!


Ce que vous ferez:
Alors que nous nous lançons dans un programme de transformation numérique pluriannuel, nous recherchons actuellement un Analyste Digital & Business Transformation. C'est une opportunité super excitante de rejoindre une équipe de solutionneurs de problèmes et de faire partie d'une transformation, de la stratégie à l'exécution.
Responsabilités:

Démontrer une passion claire pour avoir un impact sur la transformation de l'entreprise
Démontrer un sens aigu des affaires et une compréhension des modèles opérationnels
Soutenir les projets de transformation des opérations de bout en bout, axés sur l'évaluation de l'état actuel, l'identification des opportunités et la création d'analyses de rentabilisation de transformation, y compris les technologies de support
Participer à des équipes interfonctionnelles dans l'ensemble des activités et des opérations pour développer et mettre en œuvre des stratégies d'exploitation de bout en bout
Soutenir les approches d'amélioration des processus et d'efficacité opérationnelle, en mettant l'accent sur la chaîne d'approvisionnement de bout en bout
Utiliser des outils d'analyse pour simuler et soutenir le processus de prise de décision

Ce que nous recherchons :

Un intérêt pour l'amélioration des compétences pour un monde numérique et les tendances technologiques, une ouverture à l'apprentissage de nouveaux outils et à l'adaptation de votre façon de travailler
Résolution de problèmes éprouvée, pensée critique et capacité à établir des liens entre des informations et des concepts provenant de différentes sources
Excellentes compétences en rédaction de rapports et en présentation orale et expérience démontrée
Solides compétences analytiques, expérience avec Alteryx/Power BI ou équivalent
Capacité à travailler dans un environnement de projet rapide, collaboratif et en équipe. À l'aise de travailler de manière itérative et dans des situations sans instructions détaillées.
Baccalauréat en gestion des opérations, en génie, en mathématiques, en chaîne d'approvisionnement, en sciences ou dans un domaine connexe
Expérience dans le conseil en gestion ou les données et l'analyse, un atout


 
Prêt à rejoindre notre équipe ? Voici pourquoi nous sommes une grande et heureuse JAMily…

Avantages sociaux : assurance pour soins de santé, dentaire, soins de la vue, assurance vie et assurance invalidité de courte et longue durée, ensemble d’incitatifs pour le bien-être et un programme d’aide aux employés.
Programme de cotisation égale au régime enregistré d'épargne-retraite (REÉR).
Nous donnons beaucoup d’importance à un juste équilibre travail vie et nous proposons un milieu de travail détendu et agréable.
Un calendrier d’activités sociales vivant …il y a toujours quelque chose pour chacun !!

La possibilité d’apprendre de façon continue.
Sans oublier de mentionner la chance de travailler au sein d’une équipe de grand talent, une équipe couronnée de succès!

Joignez-vous à JAM … nous ne travaillons pas seulement avec acharnement mais nous nous amusons tout aussi intensément. Vous désirez donner un nouvel essor à votre carrière? Cliquez ici pour voir toutes nos nouvelles offres d’emploi actuellement offertes! http://jamindustries.com/careers/

Title: Business System Analyst - Life Insurance
Description:
Job Duties & Responsibilities: 
The Business System Analyst/Functional Expert will be a liaison with the business, IT, operations and cross functional teams and will drive the requirements management and the requirement gathering efforts.

This position requires thorough domain knowledge
Experience in Life insurance along with strong product knowledge
Experience working with large programs/initiatives
Should be able to manage the overall requirements gathering
Leads the elicitation and documentation of Business, Functional/Technical and Non-functional requirements by conducting meetings, brainstorming sessions and/or workshops with various stake holders.
Drives the requirements, design, testing and implementation of operational and system enhancements to ensure production capabilities and system performance are both effective and efficient.
Uses in-depth knowledge of Life domain to act as functional SME for project team
Assists with Data mapping and building conversion rules
Makes recommendations for leveraging technology to introduce business process improvements, with a thorough understanding of business and technical problems and solutions as they relate to operational needs.
Communicate business directives, goals and needs to the technical team and serve as the client interface for managing user expectations and achieving client satisfaction.
Exhibits strong business knowledge and builds strong customer relationships.
Identifies and documents all assumptions / dependencies / risks and ensure that these are effectively managed with appropriate mitigation or contingency plans.
Contribute to the success of the team and its vision by encouraging open communication, innovation, teamwork and a high degree of professionalism.

Qualifications & Experience:
Must Have: 

Strong knowledge of Canadian Life, Group and P&C Insurance
3 plus years of experience as Life insurance BA experience.
Demonstrated experience in leading requirements elicitation & documentation
Demonstrated experience in use case building and data mapping.
Strong understanding of project life cycle, activities and methodologies.
Knowledge of Change Management process.

Good to Have: 

IFRS17 Knowledge

Skills Required: 

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience working with global delivery model.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Effective interviewing, influencing, facilitation, negotiation and presentation skills.

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

Title: Senior Commercial Management Analyst
Description:
Metrolinx is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Toronto’s subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster, and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario. 
We embody our values in everything that we do. We Serve with Passion, Think Forward, and Play as a Team. If you can relate, we want to hear from you! 
Our Commercial Management Office is seeking a Senior Commercial Management Analyst who supports the success of the Manager, Commercial Management (I&IT), and the Commercial Management team. Conducts contract analysis to support operational and strategic decisions. Develops, manages, and coordinates financial and budgetary implications and contract management, and administration policies and processes. Supports negotiation of capital infrastructure investment contracts, in collaboration with internal stakeholders. 
What will I be doing? 

Supports the development and implementation of comprehensive strategies, methodologies, tools and techniques for commercial management excellence and continuous improvement including, the validation of Metrolinx project requirements, and recommends commercial strategies consistent with overall strategic goals of the division 
Supports negotiations and execution of multiple projects such as vendor contractual terms negotiations, including developing presentation materials, benchmark research, financial analytics, and overall management of the project life cycle 
Provide insights and recommendations to the commercial management team and business unit leaders to drive master data related decisions. 
Develop strong presentations and PowerPoint material by gathering and synthesizing data and transforming it into illustrative frameworks and powerful presentations outlining problems/issues so that the presentation clearly outlines the issues and supports the decision making process and outlines recommendations actions required 
Support the development of commercial evidence, tools, techniques, and guidance that will demonstrate value for money for larger Metrolinx projects and leads the development for smaller files. 
Interacts and/or works with cross-functional teams, advisory committees, boards, and stakeholders to progress projects and initiatives; manages distribution of information, develops memos, provides updates, and utilizes influencing skills to achieve desired outcomes 
Conducts financial and contract analysis, and develops reports and best-in-class presentations, based on analytical findings, to support planning and decision-making by commercial management leadership 
Exercises due diligence in fiscal management and reporting, independently and when part of a project delivery team to reduce financial, legal, and reputational risks 
Provides recommendations to protect Metrolinx’s financial integrity; shows stewardship of resources with innovative options and attention to revenue generation and cost savings 
Develops commercial management processes and procedures for Metrolinx I&IT that are based on, and adhere to, those of the overall corporation 
Strong stakeholder and organizational skills to conduct and manage commercial management meetings and working sessions with internal and external stakeholders, and result orientation towards key objectives 
Demonstrates strong analytical and financial analytics skills, to analyze data, contractual documents, and financial data and develops reports and action plans for Metrolinx Senior Management on commercial risks (budget, schedule, and quality), and contingency utilization 
Develops contract negotiation, governance, and management strategies to ensure that contracts adhere to Metrolinx policies and procedures, and to minimize corporate liability and risk throughout the contract lifecycle; leads the review and analysis of the division’s contract documents to ensure that the appropriate contracting strategy and contractual clauses are applied, to reduce risk and protect the interests of Metrolinx 
Prepares primary and secondary research, develops, and disseminates information (e.g. policy, correspondence, key issues/briefing materials), and effectively communicates ideas related to broad departmental initiatives and topics 

What skills & qualifications do I need? 

Completion of a degree in Business Administration, or a combination of education, training, and experience deemed equivalent. Master of Business Administration would be considered an asset. 
Minimum six (6) years’ experience administering commercial management projects, and monitoring contractor compliance and performance against contract terms and conditions 
Experience with vendor and client coordination, to develop and monitor projects and services in compliance with legal and regulatory requirements and corporate policies and processes 
Manages and controls expenditures for operating costs, developing and providing advice and guidance to senior management 
Strong understanding of contract law and contract administration, including developing terms and conditions, quotations, negotiations, procurement, acquisitions, and dispute resolution 
Government policy development and decision-making processes 
Organizational and analytical skills to coordinate a number of complex projects under pressure to meet schedule and budget commitments, project plan adherence, and close-out 
Report development and generation, including charts and graphs, progress reports, and both written and oral presentations to senior management level audiences 
Proficiency in MS Office (e.g. Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, Access, etc.). 
Strong influencing/negotiating, as well as, political acumen capabilities to deal with a variety of stakeholders, agencies, and staff, to ensure successful outcomes and achieve goals 
Interpersonal and oral/written/presentation skills 

Accommodation: 
Accommodation will be provided throughout the hiring process, as required. Applicants must make their needs known in advance. 
Application Process:

As we send time sensitive correspondence, we recommend that you check your email regularly. If no response is received, we will assume you are no longer interested in pursuing the opportunity. Metrolinx employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in accordance with Metrolinx’s Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy as a condition of being eligible for the recruitment process. Title: Senior Technical Business Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 148866  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 The Team 
Non-Retail Risk Systems provides the project, change, & development management and services of non-retail enterprise risk systems to support the Global Risk Management (GRM) business lines.
 
The Role 
Reporting to the Senior Manager Development, the Sr. Technical Business Analyst will be involved in all phases of the Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC), including feasibility studies, research, analysis, elicit, define, assess and document detailed business and system design requirements (functional, operational, transitional, information & non-functional) for new systems & systems enhancements and identify any gaps within current capability. To join our team, the incumbent must be proactive and dynamic, demonstrate initiative, have an eagerness to learn, be adaptable to a high-paced environment, and thrive on challenge.

 Some of the Key Accountabilities include:

 Elicit, define, assess and document detailed business and system design requirements (functional, operational, transitional, information & non-functional) for new systems & systems enhancements and identify any gaps within current capability.
 Identify complex process and systems solutions to address major system needs.
 Performs analysis and evaluation of options, alternatives, and system capabilities.
 Provide strong subject matter expertise across multiple functional areas and across functional process flows or functional and cross functional teams.
 Understand complex system integrations including source and target systems and how they relate to each other and perform data analysis.
 Assist with managing projects and coordinate work with Stakeholders and Project Teams and provide post rollout support for system enhancements.
 Coordinate timing for development and testing if the change involves multi-systems to meet deployment date, provide support for developers and testers during the sprints and preparing release notes
 Participating and supporting the Intake process
 Perform CDE analysis, create reports and communicate to business partners
 Ability to handle multiple projects and activities in a timely, organized manner.
 Independently resolve complex, multi-faceted problems to meet the business needs.


 Ability to facilitate meetings, action plans and audit reports.


 What You Will Bring to Succeed 

Proficiency in Business Analysis procedures and requirements, as well as technical analysis and design requirements.
 Highly experienced in writing business requirements for system development.
 Experience in data analysis and data modeling (Conceptual and/or Logical and/or Physical) and the ability to grasp a customized repository (as defined by a relational or dimensional database) approach.
 Knowledge of enterprise applications and enterprise analysis.
 Strong SQL knowledge and skilled and experienced in working with relational database structures MS SQL Server.
 Experience working in a project environment and SDLC methodologies.
 Knowledge of Credit and Risk applications preferred.
 Strong oral and written communication skills.
 Creative problem solver, flexible, proactive and able to work in a fast paced, ever- changing environment.

 Nice to have skills:

 4-7 years of demonstrated experience in business and functional requirements elicitation, translation and documentation in insurance, financial services or technology, with demonstrated data analysis abilities.
 Experience working with big data platforms (Hadoop, etc.)
 Experience working in Agile environment
 Financial and Credit Risk / Loss experience


 The Workplace 

We are technology partners who help the business transform how our employees around the world work 
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success! 
You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world 
We foster an environment of innovation and continuous learning
 We care about our people, allowing them to design how they work to deliver amazing results 
We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), and generous vacation

 
Scotiabank
 As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. We speak more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know.  Is this Role not the Exact fit? 
Sign up to stay in touch; we’ll let you know when we have new positions on the team.

Title: SAP Business Analyst (Program Administration Officer 3)
Description:
Department: Public Works
Location: HALIFAX
Type of Employment: Term
Union Status: NSGEU - NSPG
Closing Date: 8/1/2022 (Applications are accepted until 11:59 PM Atlantic Time)



 About Us




Making the Province work is no small job.


Become part of the team today that helps to bridge the gap between the Department of Public Works SAP end users and the SAP service provider. The Operational/Financial Management Information Systems (OFMIS) team is part of the backbone of Public Works. As the OFMIS team, we provide training and hands-on support to the users of the SAP system; working to consistently analyze business issues and identify opportunities to implement improvements and support business enhancements for Public Works users.


SAP is an enterprise resource system which provides enhanced decision making, improved cost control, fosters empowerment of employees, and balances the Government’s need for sound corporate financial management with the operational specific needs of individual lines of business.




 About Our Opportunity




As the SAP Business Analyst, you are responsible for analyzing business problems along with developing, implementing and monitoring system enhancements to improve functionality and maximize the effective use of the SAP software for your Public Works clients.




 Primary Accountabilities




You will support a decentralized environment where end-users of the SAP system are located in various offices and bases across the Province. Using your sound communication and analytical skills you provide advice, assistance, and expertise in resolving functional problems. You will design and develop user-friendly training material, as well as deliver this training across the Province for over 700 end-users.


You will liaise with Head Office and field offices in a support capacity and work closely with the Service Provider and SAP Service Management in the introduction of new modules, system upgrades and system enhancements by participating in UAT testing, developing training strategies and delivering training to the departments' stakeholders. You will also manage and maintain master data for both the Inventory and Plant Maintenance modules.






 Qualifications and Experience




You have a bachelor’s degree plus five (5) years of related experience with SAP. An equivalent combination of training and experience may be considered. SAP Certification is a definite asset. A Degree in Commerce and/or a background in accounting is also an asset. 
Occasional travel within the Province is a component of this position, as such, you must have a valid driver’s license and access to a reliable motor vehicle.


You are knowledgeable and experienced with training adults. You have direct experience with the various modules of SAP and considerable experience in FI, CO, MM and PM.


You have proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and have excellent knowledge of spreadsheet software and creation, word processing, presentations, and email applications. You have a keen eye for detail and well-developed planning and organizational skills to ensure the effective delivery of the SAP training program and assistance with the efficient operation of our team.


Experience with government accounting practices and business processes is desirable. 
You are a self-starter and an innovative thinker who is solutions oriented. You analyze and present information in a clear and concise manner. You have well developed planning and organizational skills, coupled with the ability to multi-task and adapt in this fast-paced environment with competing priorities and strict deadlines. You exercise sound judgement and a high degree of professionalism when providing technical advice. You communicate for maximum results, consistently maintain a courteous disposition, and hold a high standard for client and customer service. You are a self-motivated individual who works both independently with minimal supervision and participates fully as an effective team player.


We will assess the above qualifications and competencies using one or more of the following tools: written examination, standardized tests, oral presentations, interview(s), and reference checks.




 Equivalency




An equivalent combination of training, education and experience will be considered. Related equivalencies may include, but are not limited to:



A related diploma and seven (7) years of related experience 


Applicants relying on education and experience equivalencies must demonstrate such equivalencies in their application.




 Benefits




Based on the employment status and union agreement, the Government of Nova Scotia offers its employees a wide range of benefits such as Health, Dental, Life Insurance, Pension, General Illness (Short and Long Term), Vacation and Employee and Family Assistance Programs. Click here to learn more about our various benefits offerings and eligibility criteria.






 Working Conditions





Normal work week is 35 hours/week, 7 hours/day.
May be required to work overtime on occasion.
Typically located in a comfortable office environment.
Much of the time is spent in a comfortable position with frequent opportunity to move about.
Regularly reads and interprets multiple sources of information, regular requirement to type, read and work on a computer.
May experience pressure with deadlines and need for accuracy.


 




Additional Information




This opportunity is for a Term position with an expected end date of August 28, 2024.


This position requires the successful candidate to work on-site.




 What We Offer





Career Development where you have access to career guidance, tools, resources, and ongoing training for every stage of your career.
Engaging workplace. Our Employees feel valued, respected, connected, and tuned in. We have forward-thinking policies and strategies.
Countless career paths.






Pay Grade: PR 13
Salary Range: $2,396.86 - $2,913.59 Bi-Weekly


Employment Equity Statement:
Our goal is to be a diverse workforce that is representative, at all job levels, of the citizens we serve. The Government of Nova Scotia has an Employment Equity Policy, and we welcome applications from Indigenous People, African Nova Scotians and Other Racially Visible Persons, Persons with Disabilities and Women in occupations or positions where they are under-represented. If you are a member of one of these equity groups, you are encouraged to self-identify on your electronic application.


This is a bargaining unit position initially restricted to current civil service employees represented by the Nova Scotia Government Employees Union (NSGEU). If applying from outside a government office, employees must apply correctly via this link:


 
Failure to apply correctly means that your application will not be given first consideration as a bargaining unit applicant, and will only be included if external applications are pursued.


External applicants and current casual employees will only be considered if there are no qualified civil service bargaining unit candidates. PLEASE NOTE: Candidates will not be considered for an interview if applications are incomplete or are missing information.


Offer of employment is conditional upon the completion of all applicable background checks and confirmation of credentials, the results of which must be satisfactory to the employer. We thank all applicants for the interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. All questions and concerns may be directed to Competitions@novascotia.ca.

Title: Senior IT Business Analyst
Description:
The Olympus Markets Data Strategy team is building a next generation Data Fabric to solve the evolving Business, Analytical and Regulatory needs of Citi’s Institutional Clients Group (ICG). The Fabric will bring together disparate data sources for the Global Markets & Institutional Clients organization and enable industry-leading analytics, client reporting, regulatory, surveillance, supervisory reporting(s) and data science solutions. 
The Senior IT Business Analyst is an intermediate-level position responsible for liaising between business users and technologists to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in coordination with the Technology team. The overall objective of this role is to contribute to continuous iterative exploration and investigation of business performance and other measures to gain insight and drive business planning.  Responsibilities:

 Formulate and define systems scope and objectives for complex projects and foster communication between business leaders and IT
 Consult with users and clients to solve complex system issues/problems through in-depth evaluation of business processes, systems and industry standards and recommends solutions
 Support system change processes from requirements through implementation and provide input based on analysis of information
 Consult with business clients to determine system functional specifications and provides user and operational support
 Identify and communicate risks and impacts, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
 Act as advisor or coach to new or lower level analysts and work as a team to achieve business objectives, performing other duties and functions as assigned
 Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision. 
Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy. 
Acts as SME to senior stakeholders and /or other team members.
 Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

 Qualifications:

 5-8 years of relevant experience
 Experience in data analysis with intermediate/advanced Microsoft Office Suite skills
 Proven interpersonal, data analysis, diplomatic, management and prioritization skills
 Consistently demonstrate clear and concise written and verbal communication
 Proven ability to manage multiple activities and build/develop working relationships
 Proven self-motivation to take initiative and master new tasks quickly
 Demonstrated ability to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines and approach work methodically with attention to detail

 Education:

 Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience


 Citi Canada is an equal opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities (including, without limitation, physical and mental health disabilities) during the recruitment process and otherwise in accordance with law. Individuals who view themselves as Aboriginals, members of visible minority or racialized communities, and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

 Job Family Group: Technology
  -
 Job Family: Business Analysis / Client Services
  -
 Time Type: Full time
  -

 Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

 Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi”) invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review Accessibility at Citi.

Title: Media Analyst / Analyste des médias
Description:
** French to Follow / Francais à suivre **

 Wavo is a rapidly-expanding global consulting and media planning agency with a modern approach to digital marketing. With roots in the music industry, Wavo navigates the continually evolving digital landscape to help artists, entertainers, and brands manage their digital presence, reach new audiences, and connect with fans through unique campaigns.

 Wavo’s Media Analyst team is responsible for providing campaign planning, reporting, strategy, and analytical services to work in conjunction with our Account Management and Ad Operations teams. Media Analysts determine effective strategy for digital advertising campaigns, which include devising platform and targeting tactics, setting media goal projections, reporting on campaign performance, and delivering actionable campaign insights.

 As an entry-level role, the Media Analyst position is a great place to get started in media. Team members can grow their expertise in music, digital advertising, and analysis by performing the responsibilities below:

 Responsibilities

Develop industry experience and knowledge around market trends in emerging media and content development;
Plan, report on, and evaluate media campaigns for some of the biggest releases in the music industry;
Analyze data to provide situational analysis, optimize goal projections, devise ad platform strategy, determine optimal budget allocation, report on campaign goals, and provide finalized campaign results for major music releases;
Communicate with clients to present media plans to clients for approval or modification and to report on campaign process and results;
Ensure that media objectives, strategies, and executional guidelines are clearly communicated to Account Managers and Ad Operations Specialists;
Understand and adapt to Wavo's ongoing product and technology developments;
Be an effective team player with strong communication, presentation, analytical, and creative problem-solving skills.



 Job requirements:

Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a thorough work approach
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience
Ability to multi-task and work collaboratively across multiple projects and teams
A proven track record of strong work ethic and proactivity


Preferred:

Passion for the music industry, and interest in marketing and digital advertising
Degree or 1-2 years of experience in digital advertising, communications, statistics, marketing, media, or equivalent practical experience preferred
Google Adwords certification and/or Facebook Blueprint certification


 Compensation + Work Environment

Group health and dental insurance plan;
A dynamic and empowering workspace, wherein employees come from a wide range of cultural and professional backgrounds;
Access to technological infrastructure to be able to effectively onboard and work remotely for the duration of the pandemic;
Being a part of innovation at the nexus of music, marketing/advertising, and technology.


 Equal Opportunity Employer
 Wavo hires, compensates, trains, and promotes employees regardless of race, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected status. Wavo will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Wavo encourages applicants of all ages, backgrounds and identities; as we firmly believe in fostering a diverse and welcoming workspace.

 ***

 Wavo.me est une société de marketing, d'analytique de données et de planification publicitaire internationale en pleine expansion avec une approche moderne avec le marketing digital. Enracinée dans l'industrie de la musique, Wavo navigue dans un contexte numérique en constante évolution pour aider les artistes et les maisons de disques à gérer leur présence numérique, à atteindre de nouveaux publics et à se rapprocher de leurs admirateurs grâce à des campagnes publicitaires sur mesure.

 L'équipe d'analystes média chez Wavo est chargée de fournir des services de planification de campagne, de reportage, de stratégie et d'analyse, en collaboration avec nos équipes de gestion de compte et d'opérations publicitaires. Les analystes médias déterminent une stratégie efficace pour les campagnes de publicité numérique, ce qui inclut la conception de la plate-forme et des tactiques de ciblage, l'établissement de projections d'objectifs médias, l'établissement de rapports sur les performances des campagnes et la fourniture d'informations exploitables sur les campagnes.

 En tant que poste de niveau d'entrée, le poste d'analyste média est un excellent début dans le domaine des médias. Les membres de l'équipe peuvent développer leur expertise en matière de musique, de publicité numérique et d'analyse en assumant les responsabilités ci-dessous :

 Responsabilités :

Développer une expérience et une connaissance de l'industrie autour des tendances du marché dans les médias émergents et le développement de contenu ;
Planifier, rendre compte et évaluer les campagnes médiatiques pour certaines des plus grandes sorties de l'industrie musicale ;
Analyser les données afin de fournir une analyse contextuelle, optimiser les projections d'objectifs, concevoir une stratégie de plateforme publicitaire, déterminer l'allocation budgétaire optimale, rendre compte des objectifs de la campagne et fournir les résultats finaux de la campagne pour les principales sorties musicales ;
Communiquer avec les clients afin de leur présenter les plans médias pour approbation ou modification et de rendre compte du déroulement et des résultats de la campagne ;
S'assurer que les objectifs médias, les stratégies et les directives d'exécution sont clairement communiqués aux gestionnaires de comptes et aux spécialistes des opérations publicitaires ;
Comprendre et s'adapter aux développements continus des produits et des technologies de Wavo ;
Avoir un bon esprit d'équipe et de solides compétences en matière de communication, de présentation, d'analyse et de résolution créative des problèmes.



 Qualifications:

Excellentes aptitudes à la communication verbale et écrite avec une approche de travail approfondie
Diplôme BA/BS ou expérience pratique équivalente
Capacité à effectuer plusieurs tâches et à travailler en collaboration sur plusieurs projets et équipes.
Une éthique de travail solide et une forte proactivité démontrées.
Passion pour l'industrie musicale et intérêt pour le marketing et la publicité numérique un atout.
Diplôme ou 1 à 2 ans d'expérience dans le domaine de la publicité numérique, de la communication, des statistiques, du marketing, des médias, ou une expérience pratique équivalente, un atout.
Certification Google Adwords et/ou certification Facebook Blueprint un atout.



 Compensation + Environnement de travaille:

Régime collectif d'assurance-maladie et dentaire
Un lieu de travaille dynamique et qui promouvoit l'autonomie dans un environnement où les employés viennent d'un large éventail de milieux culturels et professionnels
Prendre part à l'innovation entre le secteur de la musique, du marketing/publicité et de la technologie



 Wavo promouvoit la diversité et l'inclusion: Wavo embauche, rémunère, forme et promeut les employés sans distinction de race, de religion ou de croyance, d'origine nationale, sociale ou ethnique, de handicap, de statut d'ancien combattant ou de tout autre statut protégé. Nous pronons l'égalité et ne toléront pas la discrimination ou le harcèlement. Wavo encourage toute personne intéressée à appliquer, quel que soit son âge origine et identité.

Title: SENIOR BUSINESS SYSTEMS ANALYST
Description:
JOB SUMMARY
 The Senior Business Systems Analyst understands both business administration and information technology with a primary focus on the effective operation of information technology systems and support across the organization. The Senior Business Systems Analyst is responsible to identify problems and opportunities and provide solutions to support corporate goals and objectives.
 ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Examine new systems for improvement, report common issues, evaluate performance, and recommend new system procedures.
Research, design, and implement new systems/ upgrades that support business objectives.
Generation of custom complex system reports, data analysis and quality control, and use of business intelligence tools to support business decision making.
Develop business cases, build project plans, manage projects, and monitor project performance.
Liaise with vendors and service providers to ensure cost-effective acquisition of and ongoing support and maintenance of systems.
Ongoing review and improvement of IT service management functions.
Present project status reports and other relevant information to stakeholders at various levels of the organization.
Stay informed on new or emerging trends and technologies that provide benefits to the organization, business partners, and / or customers.
Implement project changes and interventions to achieve project objectives.
Develop appropriate training materials to assist business areas with new system use.
Oversee and assist with training and communication of new systems to employees.
Other related duties as required or assigned.

 OTHER KEY SKILLS (or product knowledge)

Knowledge of various information technology systems
Experience with transportation or fuel systems is an asset
Working experience with Sage or similar financial ERP platforms considered an asset
Advanced knowledge of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and e-mail required
Professional written and verbal communication skills

 EXPERIENCE
 4+ years’ experience in a business analysis, systems analysis, or general IT support role
 EDUCATION
 Post-Secondary Degree in Information Technology or related field preferred

Title: Technical Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Nucleo Digital is searching for senior Technical Business Systems Analysts for an ongoing large-scale transformation initiative. 
Requirements
 What will you do? 

Plan and execute detailed system requirements phases and identify, track, and resolve business systems issues 
Assess, research, analyze, and document stakeholder needs, using the recommended or selecting the appropriate information gathering and/or modelling technique to elicit requirements 
Contribute to successful completion of project objectives with high quality, within budget, and on time 
Review test plans scenarios, cases as needed 
Support Development, Quality Assurance and User Acceptance Testing activities 
Build and maintain a repository of reusable system documentation 
Identifying risks, dependencies, assumptions and constraints 
Effectively communicate and build rapport with team members, stakeholders, and business unit partners through all project phases 

What do you need to succeed? 

5+ years experience as a Business Systems Analyst and/or as a Data Analyst with progressively increasing responsibilities in the areas of requirements management on large and complex projects
Experience with vendor integrations
Excellent leadership skills
Strong data analysis skills - Experience with data mapping, data dictionaries and creating data catalogues
Exposure to modern data technologies: Hive, Tableau, Kafka, NLP
Experience with Python a must
Strong SQL experience a must - ability to join 10-15 tables
Ability to take initiative, take ownership and work independently
Strong analysis skills
Excellent requirements elicitation
Excellent communication, facilitation, presentation and stakeholder management
Strong collaboration with business, IT and operations stakeholders, plus system SMEs
Strong technical background to coordinate platform enhancements with software vendor(s) and internal business partners
Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or other related field
Agile Framework experience
Experience with Microsoft Office suite; Visio; Lucidchart, Jira; Confluence
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong facilitation and presentation skills
Ability to resolve minor conflicts/issues using different tactics for prior to escalation
Results oriented
Organized and detailed oriented
Organized with strong time management
Teamwork and Cooperation

Benefits
 What this contract position has to offer:

 Competitive rates commensurate with experience
Supportive, challenging, and collaborative work environment

Title: Senior Business Analyst (BHJOB13022_12273)
Description:
Senior Business Analyst (Reporting Development exp) – Permanent position in Vancouver:
 

 On behalf of our client in Vancouver, Ignite Technical Resources is looking for a Senior Business Analyst (Reporting Development exp) with the client for a permanent opportunity.
 


 Role Description:


   The Senior Business Analyst, Security Access Data and Reporting (SADR) analyzes business needs and develops overall strategies for how automated systems can be used to support the short- and long-term direction of the business.
   The incumbent will provide expertise and leadership in the areas of requirements definition, business process definition, business process analysis and design, functional design, configuration, implementation, testing, training, facilitation and documentation to deliver enterprise solutions to the university community. The position may manage the entire lifecycle of sub-projects which includes developing a project plan, coordinating the activities of a project team, identifying appropriate resources needed, and developing schedules to ensure timely completion of the project. This role will also manage staff directly including performance appraisals and mentorship of junior team members.
 


 Responsibilities:


 Leads the assessment of client needs by utilizing a structured requirements process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing changes) to identify business priorities and recommend options.
 Conducts workflow and gap analysis for operational support processes.
 Performs data analysis and data modeling as required.
 Engage business stakeholders, clarifying and document business requirements and translating them into technical requirements
 Engage technical stakeholders to transmit technical requirements, ensuring proper understanding of the required outputs, including data mappings, test cases and others.
 Acquires and maintains a working knowledge of the university's technical and business environment
 Understands and applies business architecture concepts to analysis to ensure strategic alignment with organizational goals, outcomes and business value.
 Conducts comprehensive and in-depth feasibility studies for projects and enhancements.
 Provides guidance and leadership to less-experienced individuals on the team.
 Identifies integration, security, scalability and performance requirements.
 Provides direction and best practices for functional team business analysts supporting the technical teams for data conversion, reporting and integrations
 Provides direction and best practices for workflow and gap analysis for enterprise business processes, analysis and identification of requirements for data, reporting and integrations
 Supports the project following appropriate project management methodology including gathering and defining project requirements, developing project plans, and schedules, identifying staffing requirements and forming project teams
 Develops and maintains a productive working relationship with project sponsors, vendors, key stakeholders other project teams, including technical teams for data conversion, reporting, security and integrations
 Works with multiple vendors to foster effective working relationships in order to ensure alignment with project goals and deadlines
 Develops user test cases and validates test results during user acceptance testing and system acceptance testing, operational acceptance testing.



 Requirements:


 8+ years of Senior BA exp (including 2 yrs of leadership exp) with Report Development and Data Modeling exp
 Demonstrated knowledge and proven experience in producing BRDs, use cases, user scenarios, user stories, and BPMs working experience on enterprise-wide projects.
 Knowledge of business process re-engineering improvement.
 Knowledge of data analysis and data modeling (conceptual, logical).



 Nice-to-have:


 Experience with classical reporting tools (Crystal Reports, etc.) and visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI) is an asset.




   Due to the volume of resumes, only those candidates being considered will be contacted.
  


   Based in Vancouver and proudly Canadian, Ignite Technical Resources has been providing Top Technical Talent to organizations across Canada since 2005.
  


   Ignite. Wired for people.
  


   Follow Ignite on Twitter @ignitetechnical and become a fan on Facebook for up-to-date information about our company including job postings!
 


About Ignite Technical Resources.:


Founded in 2005 and headquartered in Vancouver BC, Ignite Technical Resources has been the preferred IT Staffing provider for many of Canada’s largest and well-known organizations for over 15 years.By specializing in Information Technology, we ensure that our processes are focused exclusively on providing qualified IT Professionals and our commitment to speed ensures your teams and projects are staffed quickly and efficiently. Our years of experience provide us with one of the most well-developed networks of candidates in the Canadian market. Come see why Ignite Technical is one of Canada’s premier providers of IT Professionals On-Demand.Ignite Technical Resources – Your Source for Top Talent

Title: Senior Business Analyst, Informatics/Business Intelligence, DARE
Description:
As per the current Public Health Order, full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment with PHSA as of October 26, 2021.

 In accordance with the Mission, Vision and Values, and strategic directions of Provincial Health Services Authority patient safety is a priority and a responsibility shared by everyone at PHSA, and as such, the requirement to continuously improve quality and safety is inherent in all aspects of this position.
 



   The Senior Business Analyst is an integral part of the team responsible for providing leadership and analytical support for planning, monitoring and reporting on health system performance across PHSA programs with focus on Indigenous Health. Additionally, the role provides application support for adjunct applications and business intelligence tools. This role is responsible for providing leadership in business process reengineering concepts and methods and leads the analysis and documentation of business requirements on DARE projects as well as ongoing enhancements to the provincial and national health care data system.
 



   The Senior Business Analyst will lead the planning, analysis, design, and documentation of business requirements for data standardization, ad-hoc queries, reports, and interfaces. The position will have a deep understanding of Indigenous Health workflows and programs and will support operational and clinical program leaders in the development of reports related to business/operational planning, data interpretation, and data integrity and quality of the available data. In addition, this role will require broad systems understanding of PHSA priorities around Indigenous Health reporting requirements to facilitate and support planning.
 

   PHSA upholds the Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples Act and the work of Governments in cooperation with Indigenous Peoples to establish a clear and sustainable path to lasting reconciliation. Reconciliation is an ongoing process and a shared responsibility; PHSA is committed to creating opportunities which implement the Truth and Reconciliation Commission Mandate.
 



 What you’ll do


Leads program services planning and performance monitoring focused on Indigenous Health through the development of reports, direct data extraction and analysis. Provides specialized knowledge, analytical, and technical expertise in information management processes utilizing a deep understanding of data standards in relation to establishing quality reports.
Leads the formal data sourcing and analysis to help identify system deficiencies and/or operational inefficiencies in order to report and develop new ways of improving health care efficiencies with focus on Indigenous Health including the data analysis related to business case developments, project proposals, and other key strategic and transformative initiatives.
Ensures the quality, accuracy, reliability, and timeliness of the data and reports available through meticulous testing, automated and manual data reviews, performance monitoring, contingency planning, consistency reviews, and other methods as appropriate.
Leads in the analysis, criteria definition, development, testing, training, implementation and maintenance phases of assigned projects. Carries out post-implementation reviews and makes recommendations for improvements.
Provides analytical support for strategic planning and change management services for the Indigenous Health initiatives.
Leads the analysis, design, and documentation of reports, and interfaces to support planning, operations, management and evaluation reporting for Indigenous Health projects. Collaborates with other project team members as needed. This includes gathering requirements from stakeholders; negotiating changes in the context of the vision of the current and future state, defining appropriate change management strategies and monitoring and supporting best practice in documentation standards.
Leads the analysis, requirements specifications, and documentation of various business intelligence solutions, collaborating with PHSA, RHA and FNHA leaders and other project team members as needed. This includes gathering requirements from stakeholders; negotiating changes in the context of the vision of the reporting solutions; translating user requirements to technical requirements for implementation; designing reports; researching solutions; and implementing change management procedures. May occasionally take direction from a Project Manager on large projects.
Supports PHSA executives and senior program leaders with reporting requirements through the analysis of data with a deep understanding of performance metrics and benchmarking for Indigenous Health.


  Pursuant to section 41 of the British Columbia Human Rights Code, preference will be given to applicants of Indigenous Ancestry. We invite applicants to self-identify within cover letter and/or resume.
 



 What you bring


A level of education, training and experience equivalent to a Master’s degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Health Information Management, Business Administration or related discipline and five (5) years of experience in health information management, health services planning, or data analytics and use of reporting tools.
Knowledge and appreciation of the unique history, cultures, and rights of Indigenous Peoples in Canada is required.
Demonstrated ability to relate effectively to a variety of people from diverse backgrounds.
Demonstrated knowledge of Canadian colonial impacts on Indigenous people in social and health contexts, supported by significant knowledge of Canadian and Indigenous ideologies.
Lived experience with Indigenous populations and demonstrated extensive knowledge of Indigenous health care needs, services, and issues as well as knowledge of culture, protocols, traditions, and ideology of Indigenous people and organizations in British Columbia is an asset . This role requires a superior degree of critical-thinking and analytical skills with the ability to integrate broad system thinking/perspective with data to develop quality reports, operational support plans and monitor on-going performances.
This role also requires superior written skills with a high degree of producing concise, structured and very well written documents and reports.
Understanding of the Systems Development Life Cycle and project management methodology. Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to express complex ideas in simple terminology appropriate for the audience.
Demonstrated ability to use Analytics tools, spreadsheets, word-processing, presentation tools and other software at an advanced level.
Knowledge and adherence to privacy and confidentiality policies and measures to protect data. Ability to work as a member of a multi-disciplinary team, while working independently to organize workload, set priorities, and meet deadlines in a dynamic environment.
Ability to use query- and report-writing tools is an asset.
Physical ability to perform the duties of the job.


What we bring




   Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That’s why we’re focused on your care too – offering health, wellness, development programs to support you – at work and at home.
 

Join one of BC’s largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations – offering vast opportunities for growth and development.
Access to professional development opportunities through our in-house training programs, including +2,000 courses, such as our San’yas Indigenous Cultural Safety Training course, or Core Linx for Leadership roles.
Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including municipal pension plan, and psychological health & safety programs and holistic wellness resources.
Annual statutory holidays (13) with generous vacation entitlement and accruement.
PHSA is a remote work friendly employer, welcoming flexible work options to support our people (eligibility may vary, depending on position).
Perks include access to fitness classes and discounts to 350 BC-wide recreational programs, travel, technology, car and bike sharing, and more.

Title: Senior IT Business Analyst
Description:
The Olympus Markets Data Strategy team is building a next generation Data Fabric to solve the evolving Business, Analytical and Regulatory needs of Citi’s Institutional Clients Group (ICG). The Fabric will bring together disparate data sources for the Global Markets & Institutional Clients organization and enable industry-leading analytics, client reporting, regulatory, surveillance, supervisory reporting(s) and data science solutions. 
The Senior IT Business Analyst is an intermediate-level position responsible for liaising between business users and technologists to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in coordination with the Technology team. The overall objective of this role is to contribute to continuous iterative exploration and investigation of business performance and other measures to gain insight and drive business planning.  Responsibilities:

 Formulate and define systems scope and objectives for complex projects and foster communication between business leaders and IT
 Consult with users and clients to solve complex system issues/problems through in-depth evaluation of business processes, systems and industry standards and recommends solutions
 Support system change processes from requirements through implementation and provide input based on analysis of information
 Consult with business clients to determine system functional specifications and provides user and operational support
 Identify and communicate risks and impacts, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
 Act as advisor or coach to new or lower level analysts and work as a team to achieve business objectives, performing other duties and functions as assigned
 Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision. 
Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy. 
Acts as SME to senior stakeholders and /or other team members.
 Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

 Qualifications:

 5-8 years of relevant experience
 Experience in data analysis with intermediate/advanced Microsoft Office Suite skills
 Proven interpersonal, data analysis, diplomatic, management and prioritization skills
 Consistently demonstrate clear and concise written and verbal communication
 Proven ability to manage multiple activities and build/develop working relationships
 Proven self-motivation to take initiative and master new tasks quickly
 Demonstrated ability to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines and approach work methodically with attention to detail

 Education:

 Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience
