Title: Media Analyst / Analyste des médias
Description:
** French to Follow / Francais à suivre **

 Wavo is a rapidly-expanding global consulting and media planning agency with a modern approach to digital marketing. With roots in the music industry, Wavo navigates the continually evolving digital landscape to help artists, entertainers, and brands manage their digital presence, reach new audiences, and connect with fans through unique campaigns.

 Wavo’s Media Analyst team is responsible for providing campaign planning, reporting, strategy, and analytical services to work in conjunction with our Account Management and Ad Operations teams. Media Analysts determine effective strategy for digital advertising campaigns, which include devising platform and targeting tactics, setting media goal projections, reporting on campaign performance, and delivering actionable campaign insights.

 As an entry-level role, the Media Analyst position is a great place to get started in media. Team members can grow their expertise in music, digital advertising, and analysis by performing the responsibilities below:

 Responsibilities

Develop industry experience and knowledge around market trends in emerging media and content development;
Plan, report on, and evaluate media campaigns for some of the biggest releases in the music industry;
Analyze data to provide situational analysis, optimize goal projections, devise ad platform strategy, determine optimal budget allocation, report on campaign goals, and provide finalized campaign results for major music releases;
Communicate with clients to present media plans to clients for approval or modification and to report on campaign process and results;
Ensure that media objectives, strategies, and executional guidelines are clearly communicated to Account Managers and Ad Operations Specialists;
Understand and adapt to Wavo's ongoing product and technology developments;
Be an effective team player with strong communication, presentation, analytical, and creative problem-solving skills.



 Job requirements:

Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a thorough work approach
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience
Ability to multi-task and work collaboratively across multiple projects and teams
A proven track record of strong work ethic and proactivity


Preferred:

Passion for the music industry, and interest in marketing and digital advertising
Degree or 1-2 years of experience in digital advertising, communications, statistics, marketing, media, or equivalent practical experience preferred
Google Adwords certification and/or Facebook Blueprint certification


 Compensation + Work Environment

Group health and dental insurance plan;
A dynamic and empowering workspace, wherein employees come from a wide range of cultural and professional backgrounds;
Access to technological infrastructure to be able to effectively onboard and work remotely for the duration of the pandemic;
Being a part of innovation at the nexus of music, marketing/advertising, and technology.


 Equal Opportunity Employer
 Wavo hires, compensates, trains, and promotes employees regardless of race, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected status. Wavo will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Wavo encourages applicants of all ages, backgrounds and identities; as we firmly believe in fostering a diverse and welcoming workspace.

 ***

 Wavo.me est une société de marketing, d'analytique de données et de planification publicitaire internationale en pleine expansion avec une approche moderne avec le marketing digital. Enracinée dans l'industrie de la musique, Wavo navigue dans un contexte numérique en constante évolution pour aider les artistes et les maisons de disques à gérer leur présence numérique, à atteindre de nouveaux publics et à se rapprocher de leurs admirateurs grâce à des campagnes publicitaires sur mesure.

 L'équipe d'analystes média chez Wavo est chargée de fournir des services de planification de campagne, de reportage, de stratégie et d'analyse, en collaboration avec nos équipes de gestion de compte et d'opérations publicitaires. Les analystes médias déterminent une stratégie efficace pour les campagnes de publicité numérique, ce qui inclut la conception de la plate-forme et des tactiques de ciblage, l'établissement de projections d'objectifs médias, l'établissement de rapports sur les performances des campagnes et la fourniture d'informations exploitables sur les campagnes.

 En tant que poste de niveau d'entrée, le poste d'analyste média est un excellent début dans le domaine des médias. Les membres de l'équipe peuvent développer leur expertise en matière de musique, de publicité numérique et d'analyse en assumant les responsabilités ci-dessous :

 Responsabilités :

Développer une expérience et une connaissance de l'industrie autour des tendances du marché dans les médias émergents et le développement de contenu ;
Planifier, rendre compte et évaluer les campagnes médiatiques pour certaines des plus grandes sorties de l'industrie musicale ;
Analyser les données afin de fournir une analyse contextuelle, optimiser les projections d'objectifs, concevoir une stratégie de plateforme publicitaire, déterminer l'allocation budgétaire optimale, rendre compte des objectifs de la campagne et fournir les résultats finaux de la campagne pour les principales sorties musicales ;
Communiquer avec les clients afin de leur présenter les plans médias pour approbation ou modification et de rendre compte du déroulement et des résultats de la campagne ;
S'assurer que les objectifs médias, les stratégies et les directives d'exécution sont clairement communiqués aux gestionnaires de comptes et aux spécialistes des opérations publicitaires ;
Comprendre et s'adapter aux développements continus des produits et des technologies de Wavo ;
Avoir un bon esprit d'équipe et de solides compétences en matière de communication, de présentation, d'analyse et de résolution créative des problèmes.



 Qualifications:

Excellentes aptitudes à la communication verbale et écrite avec une approche de travail approfondie
Diplôme BA/BS ou expérience pratique équivalente
Capacité à effectuer plusieurs tâches et à travailler en collaboration sur plusieurs projets et équipes.
Une éthique de travail solide et une forte proactivité démontrées.
Passion pour l'industrie musicale et intérêt pour le marketing et la publicité numérique un atout.
Diplôme ou 1 à 2 ans d'expérience dans le domaine de la publicité numérique, de la communication, des statistiques, du marketing, des médias, ou une expérience pratique équivalente, un atout.
Certification Google Adwords et/ou certification Facebook Blueprint un atout.



 Compensation + Environnement de travaille:

Régime collectif d'assurance-maladie et dentaire
Un lieu de travaille dynamique et qui promouvoit l'autonomie dans un environnement où les employés viennent d'un large éventail de milieux culturels et professionnels
Prendre part à l'innovation entre le secteur de la musique, du marketing/publicité et de la technologie



 Wavo promouvoit la diversité et l'inclusion: Wavo embauche, rémunère, forme et promeut les employés sans distinction de race, de religion ou de croyance, d'origine nationale, sociale ou ethnique, de handicap, de statut d'ancien combattant ou de tout autre statut protégé. Nous pronons l'égalité et ne toléront pas la discrimination ou le harcèlement. Wavo encourage toute personne intéressée à appliquer, quel que soit son âge origine et identité.

Title: SENIOR BUSINESS SYSTEMS ANALYST
Description:
JOB SUMMARY
 The Senior Business Systems Analyst understands both business administration and information technology with a primary focus on the effective operation of information technology systems and support across the organization. The Senior Business Systems Analyst is responsible to identify problems and opportunities and provide solutions to support corporate goals and objectives.
 ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Examine new systems for improvement, report common issues, evaluate performance, and recommend new system procedures.
Research, design, and implement new systems/ upgrades that support business objectives.
Generation of custom complex system reports, data analysis and quality control, and use of business intelligence tools to support business decision making.
Develop business cases, build project plans, manage projects, and monitor project performance.
Liaise with vendors and service providers to ensure cost-effective acquisition of and ongoing support and maintenance of systems.
Ongoing review and improvement of IT service management functions.
Present project status reports and other relevant information to stakeholders at various levels of the organization.
Stay informed on new or emerging trends and technologies that provide benefits to the organization, business partners, and / or customers.
Implement project changes and interventions to achieve project objectives.
Develop appropriate training materials to assist business areas with new system use.
Oversee and assist with training and communication of new systems to employees.
Other related duties as required or assigned.

 OTHER KEY SKILLS (or product knowledge)

Knowledge of various information technology systems
Experience with transportation or fuel systems is an asset
Working experience with Sage or similar financial ERP platforms considered an asset
Advanced knowledge of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and e-mail required
Professional written and verbal communication skills

 EXPERIENCE
 4+ years’ experience in a business analysis, systems analysis, or general IT support role
 EDUCATION
 Post-Secondary Degree in Information Technology or related field preferred

Title: Technical Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Nucleo Digital is searching for senior Technical Business Systems Analysts for an ongoing large-scale transformation initiative. 
Requirements
 What will you do? 

Plan and execute detailed system requirements phases and identify, track, and resolve business systems issues 
Assess, research, analyze, and document stakeholder needs, using the recommended or selecting the appropriate information gathering and/or modelling technique to elicit requirements 
Contribute to successful completion of project objectives with high quality, within budget, and on time 
Review test plans scenarios, cases as needed 
Support Development, Quality Assurance and User Acceptance Testing activities 
Build and maintain a repository of reusable system documentation 
Identifying risks, dependencies, assumptions and constraints 
Effectively communicate and build rapport with team members, stakeholders, and business unit partners through all project phases 

What do you need to succeed? 

5+ years experience as a Business Systems Analyst and/or as a Data Analyst with progressively increasing responsibilities in the areas of requirements management on large and complex projects
Experience with vendor integrations
Excellent leadership skills
Strong data analysis skills - Experience with data mapping, data dictionaries and creating data catalogues
Exposure to modern data technologies: Hive, Tableau, Kafka, NLP
Experience with Python a must
Strong SQL experience a must - ability to join 10-15 tables
Ability to take initiative, take ownership and work independently
Strong analysis skills
Excellent requirements elicitation
Excellent communication, facilitation, presentation and stakeholder management
Strong collaboration with business, IT and operations stakeholders, plus system SMEs
Strong technical background to coordinate platform enhancements with software vendor(s) and internal business partners
Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or other related field
Agile Framework experience
Experience with Microsoft Office suite; Visio; Lucidchart, Jira; Confluence
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong facilitation and presentation skills
Ability to resolve minor conflicts/issues using different tactics for prior to escalation
Results oriented
Organized and detailed oriented
Organized with strong time management
Teamwork and Cooperation

Benefits
 What this contract position has to offer:

 Competitive rates commensurate with experience
Supportive, challenging, and collaborative work environment

Title: Senior Business Analyst (BHJOB13022_12273)
Description:
Senior Business Analyst (Reporting Development exp) – Permanent position in Vancouver:
 

 On behalf of our client in Vancouver, Ignite Technical Resources is looking for a Senior Business Analyst (Reporting Development exp) with the client for a permanent opportunity.
 


 Role Description:


   The Senior Business Analyst, Security Access Data and Reporting (SADR) analyzes business needs and develops overall strategies for how automated systems can be used to support the short- and long-term direction of the business.
   The incumbent will provide expertise and leadership in the areas of requirements definition, business process definition, business process analysis and design, functional design, configuration, implementation, testing, training, facilitation and documentation to deliver enterprise solutions to the university community. The position may manage the entire lifecycle of sub-projects which includes developing a project plan, coordinating the activities of a project team, identifying appropriate resources needed, and developing schedules to ensure timely completion of the project. This role will also manage staff directly including performance appraisals and mentorship of junior team members.
 


 Responsibilities:


 Leads the assessment of client needs by utilizing a structured requirements process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing changes) to identify business priorities and recommend options.
 Conducts workflow and gap analysis for operational support processes.
 Performs data analysis and data modeling as required.
 Engage business stakeholders, clarifying and document business requirements and translating them into technical requirements
 Engage technical stakeholders to transmit technical requirements, ensuring proper understanding of the required outputs, including data mappings, test cases and others.
 Acquires and maintains a working knowledge of the university's technical and business environment
 Understands and applies business architecture concepts to analysis to ensure strategic alignment with organizational goals, outcomes and business value.
 Conducts comprehensive and in-depth feasibility studies for projects and enhancements.
 Provides guidance and leadership to less-experienced individuals on the team.
 Identifies integration, security, scalability and performance requirements.
 Provides direction and best practices for functional team business analysts supporting the technical teams for data conversion, reporting and integrations
 Provides direction and best practices for workflow and gap analysis for enterprise business processes, analysis and identification of requirements for data, reporting and integrations
 Supports the project following appropriate project management methodology including gathering and defining project requirements, developing project plans, and schedules, identifying staffing requirements and forming project teams
 Develops and maintains a productive working relationship with project sponsors, vendors, key stakeholders other project teams, including technical teams for data conversion, reporting, security and integrations
 Works with multiple vendors to foster effective working relationships in order to ensure alignment with project goals and deadlines
 Develops user test cases and validates test results during user acceptance testing and system acceptance testing, operational acceptance testing.



 Requirements:


 8+ years of Senior BA exp (including 2 yrs of leadership exp) with Report Development and Data Modeling exp
 Demonstrated knowledge and proven experience in producing BRDs, use cases, user scenarios, user stories, and BPMs working experience on enterprise-wide projects.
 Knowledge of business process re-engineering improvement.
 Knowledge of data analysis and data modeling (conceptual, logical).



 Nice-to-have:


 Experience with classical reporting tools (Crystal Reports, etc.) and visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI) is an asset.




   Due to the volume of resumes, only those candidates being considered will be contacted.
  


   Based in Vancouver and proudly Canadian, Ignite Technical Resources has been providing Top Technical Talent to organizations across Canada since 2005.
  


   Ignite. Wired for people.
  


   Follow Ignite on Twitter @ignitetechnical and become a fan on Facebook for up-to-date information about our company including job postings!
 


About Ignite Technical Resources.:


Founded in 2005 and headquartered in Vancouver BC, Ignite Technical Resources has been the preferred IT Staffing provider for many of Canada’s largest and well-known organizations for over 15 years.By specializing in Information Technology, we ensure that our processes are focused exclusively on providing qualified IT Professionals and our commitment to speed ensures your teams and projects are staffed quickly and efficiently. Our years of experience provide us with one of the most well-developed networks of candidates in the Canadian market. Come see why Ignite Technical is one of Canada’s premier providers of IT Professionals On-Demand.Ignite Technical Resources – Your Source for Top Talent

Title: Senior Business Analyst, Informatics/Business Intelligence, DARE
Description:
As per the current Public Health Order, full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment with PHSA as of October 26, 2021.

 In accordance with the Mission, Vision and Values, and strategic directions of Provincial Health Services Authority patient safety is a priority and a responsibility shared by everyone at PHSA, and as such, the requirement to continuously improve quality and safety is inherent in all aspects of this position.
 



   The Senior Business Analyst is an integral part of the team responsible for providing leadership and analytical support for planning, monitoring and reporting on health system performance across PHSA programs with focus on Indigenous Health. Additionally, the role provides application support for adjunct applications and business intelligence tools. This role is responsible for providing leadership in business process reengineering concepts and methods and leads the analysis and documentation of business requirements on DARE projects as well as ongoing enhancements to the provincial and national health care data system.
 



   The Senior Business Analyst will lead the planning, analysis, design, and documentation of business requirements for data standardization, ad-hoc queries, reports, and interfaces. The position will have a deep understanding of Indigenous Health workflows and programs and will support operational and clinical program leaders in the development of reports related to business/operational planning, data interpretation, and data integrity and quality of the available data. In addition, this role will require broad systems understanding of PHSA priorities around Indigenous Health reporting requirements to facilitate and support planning.
 

   PHSA upholds the Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples Act and the work of Governments in cooperation with Indigenous Peoples to establish a clear and sustainable path to lasting reconciliation. Reconciliation is an ongoing process and a shared responsibility; PHSA is committed to creating opportunities which implement the Truth and Reconciliation Commission Mandate.

This includes gathering requirements from stakeholders; negotiating changes in the context of the vision of the reporting solutions; translating user requirements to technical requirements for implementation; designing reports; researching solutions; and implementing change management procedures. This role also requires superior written skills with a high degree of producing concise, structured and very well written documents and reports.

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst (Business Intelligence)
Description:
Location: Toronto, ON, CA Vancouver, British Columbia, CA Calgary, AB, CA 
    







     Req ID: 27781 
    







     Jobs by Category: Sales and Marketing 
    







     Job Function: Technology 
    







     Status: Full Time 
    







     Schedule: Regular 
    







Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 The Direct-To-Consumer (D2C) channel team is a fast-paced and growing residential sales team that is at the forefront of innovation for TELUS.


Our D2C Reporting & Financial Planning team is responsible for arming our sales teams with the tools, processes and data to enable a better customer experience and deliver on sales & marketing targets for TELUS.


We are looking for a passionate and dynamic individual to join our team and play an important role in building critical reporting capabilities and generating data-driven business insights for our ever-expanding D2C Channel team! As a Sr. Business Systems Analyst (Business Intelligence), you will have the opportunity to collaborate with leadership teams to understand the biggest challenges to solve and are passionate about turning data into actionable insights that will accelerate channel outcomes.



In partnership with our development partners, you'll build the roadmap and constantly enhance our data and reporting capabilities to drive real change within the channel
As part of the data and reporting team, you’ll be integral to rapidly grow and operationalize the D2C channel by developing a comprehensive set of reporting and analytics.



What you’ll do




Design and build data models, views, BI semantic layers, and BI assets for governed reporting and self-service data discovery and analytics
Engage in workshops with various business stakeholders to understand business requirements for new reporting and analytics use cases, and develop dashboards and reports that fully meet their needs.
You’ll be continuously consulting and collaborating with marketing and sales teams to develop timely and accurate reporting to provide actionable insights
Leading the implementation of executive dashboards and self-serve reporting using Tableau and Domo, to help the leadership make informed data-driven decisions
You will be at the forefront of analyzing results, and you can develop executive recommendations which you will present to leadership and stakeholders








What you bring




7+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Engineer, Business Systems Analyst, Business Analyst, Data Engineer, or similar role
You bring 7+ years of experience in driving data-based decisions in a consultative style to executive and senior management stakeholders
You have extensive experience and in-depth knowledge of identifying requirements and building reporting solutions & system roadmaps in collaboration with key stakeholders
Proficiency with some of the following technologies: SQL, Oracle, SSIS, Informatica, R, Python, Azure Data Factory, AWS Glue, GCP, Tableau, Domo, Power BI etc.
Skilled at quickly deriving insights with large data sets and creating visualizations, you will have at least 7+ years of hands-on experience with Oracle and SQL Server databases (SQL), and you will build the foundations as TELUS moves to the Google Cloud Platform
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment and at the same time able to collaborate with stakeholders
Excellent analytical ability, strong organizational skills, ability to prioritize, ability to multi-task, work under pressure, and meet deadlines promptly




Great-to-haves




Post-secondary degree in Computer Science or Engineering and/or equivalent experience
7-10 years of data analytics and reporting
5 years of telecom and/or home security experience
Certification in Business Analysis/ Business Intelligence tech stack


#LI-REMOTE

Title: Senior Business Analyst/Project Manager
Description:
Job ID #343290
 Senior Business Analyst/Project Manager 
On behalf of our client in the Automotive Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Senior Business Analyst/Project Manager. 
Senior Business Analyst/Project Manager – Job Description 

Plan, manage, lead and oversee the end-to-end delivery of requirements throughout the lifecycle of the project in alignment with the business and/or enterprise needs and strategies 
Effectively elicits to probe, challenge and understand requirements 
Provide recommendations and direction based on the end-to-end customer experience and lead the prioritization of requirements and leverage data were available when making decisions 
Provide thought leadership and work collaboratively with relevant stakeholders to support business benefits and changes to business processes, policies and systems across lines of business 
Collaborate with technology, business and product owners and provide recommendations to support our partners' development of system requirements and design, testing plans, change management plans, deployment plan, artifacts/deliverables to ensure business needs are met 
Establish and maintain requirements traceability 
Proactively identify risks, issues, assumptions, dependencies, constraints and anticipate and effectively manage risks related to requirements to achieve business objectives 
Identifies, validates and documents current state processes working with the business and stakeholders to design the desired future state 
Communicates progress on BA work packages, including requirements management, in a concise and timely manner, escalating issues to project manager, partners and manager where appropriate 
Support Quality Assurance activities which include review test plan, test cases and provide guidance on testing and defect reporting 
Foster a positive and cohesive team environment/culture that encourages productivity, innovation, process improvement, teamwork and a high-level of professionalism 

Senior Business Analyst/Project Manager – Mandatory Skills 

Expert knowledge of business analysis, requirements management, project delivery practices and standards across the project life cycle 
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to communicate clearly with Senior Management and other business partners 
Advanced communication and facilitation skills - interviewing, observational and listening - to talk with individuals and groups about their needs and ask the right questions to surface essential requirements information 
Analytical skills to critically evaluate the information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts and decompose high-level information into details of underlying true needs 
Ability to understand and translate the technical aspects of the application to non-technical partners/peers 
Organizational skills to work with the vast array of information gathered during elicitation and analysis and to cope with rapidly changing information 
Interpersonal skills to help influence, negotiate priorities and to resolve conflicts among project resources 
Ability to develop strong relationships with peers, business and IT partners 
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment, multi-task and work with minimal supervision 
Work effectively in a team environment and be able to interact with all levels of personnel from various functional areas 
5-7 years of relevant experience as Senior BA/Lead 
Experience with Waterfall and Agile projects 

Senior Business Analyst/Project Manager - Assignment Start Date 
ASAP – 8 months to start 
Senior Business Analyst/Project Manager - Assignment Location 
Toronto, ON – Work Hybrid

Title: Senior Business Intelligence and Reporting Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and this includes our vast data.
 The Business Intelligence group delves into our data, past and present, to develop crucial metrics and reporting functionality that better informs and optimizes key businesses decisions across the organization.
 This is the team building the tools, reports, dashboards, cubes and scorecards that deliver and process vital data to business partners across the enterprise.
 Joining us in Business Intelligence & Reporting is an opportunity to advance and deepen your career and to help TD serve its customers in a way we never have before.



Job Description

Are you a big picture thinker? Fantastic! This is exactly the kind of thinking TD needs when it comes to our business intelligence support and analytics. In this role, we need you to take a holistic, high level approach to collection and reporting of data for major projects and initiatives across TD.
 As data's role in providing extraordinary products and services to our customers grows, we'll look to the valued expertise you'll provide in this role, to develop, adopt and evolve the best in class reporting and business intelligence capability.
 Does this sound like you? You're a natural leader, and can lead major initiatives and projects, joining business owners and partners to determine business needs and recommend solutions. Moreover, you have a talent for looking at a collection of data and drawing rare insights. In this role, we'll need you to include those insights and commentary within the existing reporting packages you deliver. Finally, you'll fit in well if you like to own your space and execute with speed and precision, relishing all challenges as opportunities to dig in, collaborate and take TD into the future of banking.
 As a Senior Business Intelligence & Reporting Analyst, you will: 

     Produce specialized reporting packages, dashboards and scorecards for businesses
    

      Lead the implementation of initiatives in support of overall business/function strategy
    

      Conduct analysis to provide improved BI to inform management leadership team
    

      Craft complex and comprehensive BI reporting packages and dashboards utilizing data infrastructure, localized datamarts and external data sources
    

      Validate the quality and integrity of the data included in all reporting
    

      Develop substantial and insightful commentary/insights on new and existing reporting packages.
    

      Work with business partners to understand business objectives and develop valuable reporting and provide ad-hoc data extracts
    

      Understand business drivers, definitions and metrics in order to interpret findings, take action and provide relevant direction
    

      Lead the development and implementation of portfolio reporting (e.g. acquisition, attrition, portfolio growth, profitability, etc.)
    

      Provide (and may develop) complex reporting, analysis, and assessments at the functional or enterprise level
    

      Work independently as the senior analyst / expert and may provide technical support to others
    

      Maintain expert knowledge of all main data sources for the data used within the business unit and ability to effectively utilize these data sources for reporting purposes
    

      Ideally have or acquire knowledge of broader enterprise reporting platforms and data sources and ability to integrate data across the enterprise
     `
   


Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD?  Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:

 Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
 Five (5) or more years relevant experience #LI-Hybrid




Inclusiveness

Title: Contract Senior Business Analyst- Information Technology
Description:
Let’s impact lives for the better! 
Alberta Blue Cross® is an Alberta based organization dedicated to delivering exceptional customer experience and community leadership. We’re committed to providing the best health coverage to over 1.8 million members and take an active role in promoting the wellness of all Albertans. 
OVERVIEW:
Alberta Blue Cross® is seeking a contract senior business analyst to direct and lead the analysis of business processes and business requirements for the implementation of a new cloud-based Finance solution. The business analyst will have experience of Finance processes and systems and be responsible for providing business analysis expertise in the areas of requirements documentation, testing strategies, modeling techniques, standards and tools.
WHAT YOU WILL DO:

Work collaboratively with Functional SMEs, System Analysts and Solution Architects to design and document data integration requirements between operational systems and core Finance systems.
 Consult with clients to gather and effectively capture complex business requirements in the form of use cases at an advanced level.
 Document requirements using use case modeling concepts.
 Liaise with the technical staff to provide the business perspective during system analysis and design phases.
 Work with the project manager to plan the day to day management of the business analysis, design, development and testing tasks. Assists in enforcement of project deadlines and schedules.
 Support design and documentation of future state processes and data flow. Support planning for and execution of end-to-end integration testing.
 Participate in the test plan development process by working collaboratively to develop test cases, scenarios, and specifications that assess whether the system satisfies all of the business requirements.
 Actively participate in project review meetings providing status updates to the business sponsor and project manager.
 Identify any potential schedule or project problems and provide solutions to alleviate any problems.
 Support the development of the user training documentation for business users to ensure effective and efficient use of the new systems.
 Coordinate the efforts of other business analysts.
 Prepare ad hoc reports.

WHAT YOU WILL HAVE:

Diploma or degree in Computer Science/Software Development or related field is required.
 A minimum of ten years direct experience in the areas of business analysis and user acceptance testing.
 Experience of Finance system implementation in a Business Analyst role.
 Experience in designing integrations between Finance and operational systems.
 Knowledge of end-to-end Finance business processes.
 Experience of the Workday HCM and Finance cloud solution is preferred.
 Strong facilitation skills that will be utilized in conducting user workshops to define requirements.
 Demonstrated strong proficiency in Unified Modeling Language (UML), including but not limited to activity diagrams, use cases, sequence diagrams etc.
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with both the user community and technical teams.
 Experience in drawing out requirements from the business teams and effectively communicate those requirements to the technical teams.
 Superior analytical and problem-solving skills, including the ability to recognize symptoms, diagnose causes and identify alternative solutions.
 Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office, Microsoft Project, Visio, and SQL Navigator.
 Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment.
 Decision-making ability and demonstrated leadership potential is essential.
 Demonstrated ability to pay persistent attention to detail, while maintaining an overall view of the situation and the big picture.
 Ability to multitask and meet the challenges of a fast-paced changing environment.
 Working knowledge of/experience with Project Management body of knowledge and software development methodologies would be beneficial.

Alberta Blue Cross® is an inclusive employer committed to a workplace that reflects the diversity of the communities we serve. We empower and are advocates for our employees by welcoming, respecting and valuing their unique perspectives, backgrounds and experiences.  This position will remain open until a suitable candidate is selected. If you have the qualifications we are looking for, apply online at careers.ab.bluecross.ca.

Title: Settlement Analyst
Description:
At NRG, we’re bringing the power of energy to people and organizations by putting customers at the center of everything we do. We generate electricity and provide energy solutions and natural gas to millions of customers through our diverse portfolio of retail brands. A Fortune 500 company, operating in the United States and Canada, NRG delivers innovative solutions while advocating for competitive energy markets and customer choice, working towards a sustainable energy future. More information is available at www.nrg.com. Connect with NRG on Facebook, LinkedIn and follow us on Twitter @nrgenergy.
 Job Summary:

 Reporting to the Sr Manager Revenue Assurance for Direct Energy Home (an NRG Company) in Calgary, Settlement Analyst is responsible for wholesale and retail settlement functions of gas and power in Alberta for both Regulated and Competitive, within the Alberta Billing & Collections team. Ensure completion of settlement processing, data analysis, reporting (corporate/financial), internal control testing and support external audits. Additional responsibilities will include monitoring the settlement system for updates as required including liaising with developers and performing user acceptance testing to changes. Supporting the other areas of the business, including but not limited to Accounting, Settlements, Revenue Assurance, FP&A and Business Partnering are also included.

 Essential Duties/Responsibilities:


 Facilitate maintenance of Direct Energy’s proprietary electricity and gas settlement and revenue assurance systems (NOMAD) with production support staff.
 Create test plans/cases and perform user acceptance testing for system enhancements and changes.
 Build and maintain settlement and billing volume balancing schedules as well as other audit schedules. Identify, track, and resolve exceptions as required. Ensure workload is distributed and coordinate cross training of tasks.
 Support the DER-Finance department in the Regulated Rate Application and numerous audits (financial, risk and controls, regulatory, etc.)
 Ensure Direct Energy customers receive timely and accurate invoices.
 Provide reconciliation and analysis of distribution charges for Regulated and Deregulated.
 Provide key support for external audit of revenue for the Alberta market.
 Participate in industry and market sessions (AUC Rules 4/21/28) as required.
 Scheduled and ad hoc reporting and analysis as required for internal processes as well as requests from various departments.
 Other duties as assigned


 Working Conditions:


 Open office environment, working in office 1-2 days per week, 3-4 days per week remote
 Some overtime required as special projects arise.
 Minimal Travel


 Minimum Requirements:


 Relevant experience with Oracle, MS Access, MS Excel, and SQL (TOAD, SQL Developer, Golden, etc) is required.


 Preferred Qualifications:


 Knowledge of Alberta Utilities Commission rules for tariff bill code, system settlement codes for electricity and natural gas (AUC Rules 4/21/28).
 SAP / Business Objects / BPC experience a plus
   
 Previous experience in a utility billing or customer care environment


 .

 Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:


 Effective communication skills and experience interacting with senior leaders
 Independently manage multiple tasks, projects and ability to prioritize
 Ability to self-review work and adapt to change / Strong analytical and organization skills

 #CB-LH
 #NRG
 #LI-LH
 NRG Energy is committed to providing broad access to employment opportunities so that diverse job seekers can apply to positions, and to ensuring our workforce represents the diverse communities we serve. We abide by human rights legislation and accommodate applicants and employees in accordance with applicable law.
 Any information you provide through this form will be used and disclosed for the purposes of considering your application and, if you are offered a job, in relation to your employment (including post employment activities). If you have provided references, you consent to us contacting such references and obtaining your personal information from them. Do not submit references if you have not obtained the consent of such references. Your personal information will otherwise be handled in accordance with our privacy policy.

Title: Systems Analyst
Description:
Systems AnalystMCAP at a GlanceJoining MCAP means you will be a part of our diverse workforce of highly talented individuals who are recognized for their expertise and success! At MCAP, your professional expertise, commitment to teamwork and passion for service excellence are recognized and rewarded with competitive total rewards offering, a career with continuous learning and development (formal & informal training), and exciting opportunities in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment.The RoleThis position is primarily responsible for the day-to-day operations and production support of the Single-Family Servicing Application IT team. The Systems Analyst will work on system administrations\changes along with incidents, requests, tasks, and problem resolution, including off-hours problem resolution of supported applications. In addition, the Systems Analyst will participate in all aspects of software development and/or integration, with direct accountability of software development.
*KEY RESPONSIBILITIES*Provides day-to-day support to ensure availability and integrity of business applications

Responds to queries about system functionality and provides problem resolution
Monitors ServiceDesk queue and triages tickets accordingly
Participates in problem reviews, resolution and troubleshoots problems.
Provides ongoing system maintenance and monitoring to ensure adherence to defined SLAs
Performs root cause analysis of recurring issues and remediate or provide recommendations toward permanent solutions
Progressively becomes a Subject Matter Expert for the applications being supported
Continually drives process improvements by identifying opportunities for automation
Participates in the development, implementation, and maintenance of plans to ensure the continuation of critical operations in the event of a disaster or interruption.
Provides off-hours support as part of an on-call rotation along with occasional weekend work

Builds and maintains relationships with business units

Develops and maintains effective and professional working relationships with IT team members
Maintains ongoing communication with business users as well as negotiating and managing client expectations

Participates in software analysis/development and system configuration changes

Analyzes, and evaluates user needs to determine solution design and impact of proposed changes to application(s).
Collaborates with team members on design and impact of proposed changes.
Provides estimates on work effort of assignments
Converts requirements into program specifications.
Designs, programs, and configures system and environment setup
Creates unit and system test plans and runs tests, coordinates User Acceptance Testing and revises programs as necessary.
Responsible for writing system documentation including design docs, implementation checklists and plans, operating and on-call procedures as defined by the methodology.
Participates in code and implementation reviews
Assists in the implementation of application changes

Consults on applications, components or technology

Provides ad-hoc reports and data extracts.
Participates in reviews of analysis, design and code
Provides input to business analysts and quality assurance analysts activities
Provides external service providers and vendors with information on interface requirements, MCAP processes, and MCAP standards, etc.

*What You Bring To The Team*

1-4 years of experience with application analysis, design and development experience using a range of systems, and data analysis, and design tools and & techniques
1-4 years of experience with full-cycle development ability


Knowledge of the applications’ underlying technology and tools:

o MS SQL, T-SQL, Stored Procedures, SharePoint, ASP.Net, C#, Visual Studio, TFS, XML/XSD, WPF, MS Entity Framework, Windows Servero iSeries AS/400 toolkit (CL, Cobol, Query/400, DB2, WebSphere, IFS), (nice to have)o Azure DevOps, VSTS, and Git (nice to have)

Understands software development lifecycle and the practices and procedures of software development including Agile Development Methodology
Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal
Strong analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills, along with the ability to interpret client needs.
Ability to develop strong working relationships with internal and external business partners and clients
Self-starter, results-oriented with proven success in prioritizing and managing multiple tasks/projects of varying complexity in the context of business operations.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with a high degree of change and competing priorities
Ability to write high-quality documentation
Computer Science Degree or equivalent

If this sounds like you and you are looking to be a part of one of Canada’s largest independent mortgage finance companies in Canada, then we want to hear from you!Be A Part Of Something Great
MCAP is Canada’s largest independent Mortgage Finance company with over $140 billion in assets under management providing mortgage solutions for residential and commercial properties. For over 35 years, MCAP originates, trades, securitizes and services mortgages in offices across Canada. MCAP originates residential mortgages exclusively through the mortgage broker channel as we believe that a professional mortgage broker is a consumer's best option and MCAP actively promotes the services of mortgage brokers across the country. MCAP is also a leader in the Canadian residential construction lending market with over 25 years in the business. Our teams of dedicated professionals serve a variety of developer, construction and lender clients across Canada.Position #:  req1525Employment Status: Permanent Full TimeLocation: Waterloo; OntarioNumber Of Openings: 1Department: Information TechnologyInternal Job Title: Systems Analyst

Title: Senior Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

    The DDI (Data Delivery & Innovation) – Innovation team is focused on building the next generation of tools and analytics for Sales & Traders and Investment Bankers. The new platform is designed to enhance the workflows of sales, traders, and bankers, and significantly improve productivity by focusing on high-value efforts and simplifying low-value tasks. The DDI Innovation team is actively collaborating with the Investment Banking, Sales & Trading and Technology teams to design and drive the roadmap of the products being built.
   


Job Description

The ESG Senior Analyst will be an integral member of the DDI Innovation Team working closely with the ESG Strategy Manager and reporting to the Director, DDI Innovation – ESG Strategy, who is responsible for the TD Securities climate-related data strategy and implementation, informing and advising key senior stakeholders and creating alignment across enterprise lines of business on ESG matters. The implementation of the ESG Strategy requires us to deliver enhanced Data Science technology and platforms, end-to-end process capabilities to support our business and stakeholders and proper risk management guardrails for anticipated regulatory changes. Strategic change management is valued in this role in order for the existing ESG model to be scaled across the enterprise.



Job Requirements

Job Responsibilities

 Facilitate the end-to-end delivery across all business and technology aspects of the ESG workstream within a delivery operating model to maximize efficiency, effectiveness, and scalability.
 Lead and facilitate documentation of business requirements and implementation of new solutions, including associated data transformation, data quality assessment and acceptance testing; definition of business processes, ensuring operational efficiencies.
 Document reporting needs for credit risk management, sustainable finance teams, and key senior stakeholders.
 Provide timely and effective communication on project status, analyses and findings to TOM, Workstream Leads, and various stakeholders; understanding and managing cross-stream dependencies.
 Responsible for executing the stream across all domains in order to meet the stated success criteria, milestones, with explicit consideration to business process, change impacts and transition from delivery to business as usual; monitor progress accordingly.
 Assist with stream resource planning, issues/risk and financial plans to support the ESG strategic and infrastructure roadmaps.
 Collaborate closely with Technology to define and document relevant architecture and infrastructure roadmap; document business requirements and relevant data sources as it relates to executing on the ESG model.
 Complete process documentation for auditing purposes; assist with Data Science workflow and process documentation



 Knowledge of project delivery methodologies (including TD Agile scaling frameworks) an asset.
 Demonstrated planning and implementation experience; continuous drive for improvement.
 Ability to clearly communicate complex financial concepts and obtain clarifications as necessary when discussing requirements.
 Superior organizational skills – must be able to identify and track project dependencies and blockers, ensure proper resolution of outstanding items, document meeting minutes and takeaways in a clear and concise manner.
 Advanced data manipulation skills – ability to derive findings/conclusions from large datasets and trouble-shoot errors.
 Willingness to learn-on-the-fly and evolve the stakeholder engagement model, innovative mindset.
 Knowledge of data infrastructure; technical expertise and technologically adept.
 Excellent communication and presentation skills; ability to explain complex concepts concisely and comprehensively.
 Ability to articulate strategic vision; strong project management skills with ability to prioritize effectively against competing goals.
 Skilled in using computer applications including MS Excel; experience with Python and Data Analytics tools an asset; data science experience a plus.
 Energetic self-starter, well-organized, detail-oriented, able to work occasionally under pressure in a fast-paced environment and establish priorities with minimal supervision.




Additional Information


University degree or equivalent in business or sustainability

Title: Compliance Analyst
Description:
Are you highly organized and detail-oriented? Do you have a passion for business data? Do you want to make a meaningful impact on the success of a pre-IPO, hyper-growth tech unicorn?

 At GeoComply, our mission is to empower the future of digital trust. We operate at the center of a new generation of cybersecurity companies, leveraging today's geolocation data to make better risk-based decisions. Working as a critical piece of the security infrastructure for some of the world’s largest tech companies like DraftKings, FanDuel, the BBC and Akamai, we are the global market-leader for compliance-grade geolocation data and a critical piece of the decision engine. We have big plans in the next few years, including a targeted IPO and various M&A opportunities.

 At the heart of it all is people - we are deeply committed to creating and sustaining a world-class experience for our employees, customers, and partners.

 Located in Las Vegas, New York, or Vancouver, BC, the Compliance Analyst will play an integral role in driving the success of the government relations and compliance teams. As the Compliance Analyst you will be the trusted source of assessing compliance risks through data evaluation. You will work collaboratively across teams to conceive and design projects and presentations that will optimize communications between GeoComply and our valued customers and regulators.

 What You Will Be Doing


 Be the go-to resource for the Government Relations team to conduct and compile data analysis, presentations, whitepapers, and other materials for use with clients, regulators, and other external stakeholders
Document and maintain an internal database of systems and processes for the Government Relations team; create internal management procedures to build out and grow internal tools and capabilities
Use robust data analysis to conduct investigations and make recommendations to Compliance Account Managers on clients’ compliance risks
Collaborate with internal teams (such as Account Management, Compliance Fraud Analytics, Customer Success, and others) to ensure clients have the reports and tools necessary to address compliance risk from all angles, such as player communications, UX, etc.
Assist in researching new markets, and manage internal database of laws and regulations
Respond to regulator requests and provide answers and information as needed; assist with regulator engagement by attending meetings, taking notes and maintaining internal records
Understand and anticipate geolocation, anti-fraud and AML compliance risks and how our data can be leveraged in these arenas



 About You


 1+ years of experience in account management, risk management, fintech or regtech, KYC/due diligence, forensic accounting, and/or government relations
Demonstrated ability to maintain a high level of integrity, discretion, and confidentiality
Analytical and detail-oriented, with a passionate for data analysis
Excellent organization, prioritization, and time management skills; ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Must have strong interpersonal skills and highly effective oral and written communication skills Excellent proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint), and G Suite Programs (Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Slides)

Bonus

B.A. in, government affairs, business, finance, law or related field
Gaming industry experience



 Let us share why we think you’d love working with us.


 We have a track record of success and a vision and a plan for a promising future. GeoComply has close to 100% market share for player location regulatory compliance in the US gaming space. And we have fuelled that momentum with the expansion into new markets - media & entertainment and fintech.
We are proud of our values and we live them in all of our actions, conversations, and work: There’s always a way; Together we can do more; Aim higher. Then higher; Act with integrity; For the greater good.


We are proud to be part of a global team that develops award-winning solutions for some of the world’s largest and most innovative companies.
We will support you on your learning journey. We invest in employee career growth and development. Our learning & development commitment includes leadership and technical development, a substantial budget for education and training, as well as dedicated work hours for self-study.
We care about our team. Our GeoComply team is talented, has a bias for action, and is known for their positive attitude and energy. Team members are generously rewarded with competitive salaries, incentives, and a comprehensive benefits package.
We care about giving back to the communities in which we live and work. GeoComply supports a broad range of community initiatives through donations and employee volunteer activities.
We know that work can be fun. We take the time to create employee events and experiences where everyone can connect and celebrate.



 Now What? Send us your resume and a cover letter. We Can’t Wait To Meet You.

 At GeoComply, we live our value of Act with Integrity. Our workplace is built on mutual respect and inclusion. We know that diversity of experience and thought has led to connection, innovation, and our company’s success. We welcome applicants of all backgrounds, experiences, beliefs, and identities.

Title: Applications Production Support Intermediate Analyst
Description:
The Apps Support Intmd Analyst is a developing professional role. Deals with most problems independently and has some latitude to solve complex problems. Integrates in-depth specialty area knowledge with a solid understanding of industry standards and practices. Good understanding of how the team and area integrate with others in accomplishing the objectives of the subfunction/ job family. Applies analytical thinking and knowledge of data analysis tools and methodologies. Requires attention to detail when making judgments and recommendations based on the analysis of factual information. Typically deals with variable issues with potentially broader business impact. Applies professional judgment when interpreting data and results. Breaks down information in a systematic and communicable manner. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to exchange potentially complex/sensitive information. Moderate but direct impact through close contact with the businesses' core activities. Quality and timeliness of service provided will affect the effectiveness of own team and other closely related teams.

 The successful candidate will be managing support activities for (BCMA) Banking, Capital Markets and Advisory. Our network-driven strategy allows us to offer an integrated suite of wholesale banking products and services to clients who value our unmatched country presence and who require a financial services partner that can help them grow in any country where they do business. Joining this team will enable you to explore cutting edge technologies and acquire core Capital Banking domain knowledge. The ideal candidate should be technically astute, well organized, proactive, and also to possess good multi-tasking skills.
 Responsibilities:

 The Apps Support Intmd Analyst provides technical and business support for users of Citi Applcations.
 Utilizes good understanding of apps support procedures and concepts and basic knowledge of other technical areas to field issues and queries from stakeholders, provide short-term resolutions and work with relevant technology partners for long term remediation.
 Develop a comprehensive understanding of how areas of apps support collectively integrate to contribute to achieving business goals.
 Act as a liaison between users/traders, interfacing internal technology groups and vendors
 Participates in disaster recovery testing
 Participate in application releases, from development, testing and deployment into production.
 perform post release checkouts after application releases and infrastructure updates. Develop and maintain technical support documentation.
 Considers implications of the application of technology to the current environment.
 Analyzes applications to identify risks, vulnerabilities and security issues.
 Makes evaluative judgments based on analysis of factual information; resolves problems by identifying and selecting solutions Cooperation with Development colleagues to prioritize bug fixes and support tooling requirements.
 Directly impacts the business by ensuring the quality of work provided by self and others; impacts own team and closely related work teams.
 Exchanges ideas and information
 Active involvement in and ownership of Support Project items, covering Stability, Efficiency, and Effectiveness initiatives.
 Performs other duties and functions as assigned in a concise and logical manner.
 Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

 Qualifications:


 2-5 years experience
 Basic knowledge or interest about apps support procedures, concepts and of other technical areas.
 Participation in some process improvements.
 JAVA experience in the past.
 Understanding of TOMCAT Server and Deployments
 Knowledge of active monitoring tools (Tivoli, Nagios, ITRS, Uptime, etc.)
 Previous experience or interest in standardization of procedures and practices.
 Basic Business knowledge/ understanding of financial markets and products.
 Knowledge/ experience of problem Management Tools.
 Understands of how own sub-function integrates within the function and commercial awareness
 Evaluates (sometimes complex) situations using multiple sources of information Developed communication and diplomacy skills to persuade and influence
 Good customer service, communication and interpersonal skills
 Good knowledge of the business and its technology strategy
 Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication skills
 Knowledge of issue tracking and reporting using tools
 Good all-round team member
 Effectively share information with other support team members and with other technology teams
 Ability to plan and organize workload
 Ability to communicate appropriately to relevant stakeholder

 Education:

 Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience

 Nice to have skills 

Rest API Knowledge, Understanding on Kafka Integrations
 Ability to develop support tools/scripts as required
 Functional knowledge of SQL + ability to write SQL database script
 Deeper understanding of web technologies
 Understanding of IP networks + ability to analyze and monitor network traffic
 Exposure to Mongo DB technology is a value add

Title: Senior Business Analyst (Web Accessibility Projects)
Description:
OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY  As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.

 THE OPPORTUNITY: #INDOT
 The Senior Business Systems Analyst will deliver results that will make the organization more profitable. They can work on multiple projects simultaneously and translate business data into digestible information that improves corporate processes. Their focus will be on process design, process reengineering, business requirements, gap analysis, data flows and provide internal ticket triage support for the business.
 Working under the Manager, IT PMO, the Senior Business Systems Analyst will work with their manager and leads to ensure the quality and timeliness of work.

 YOU ARE GREAT AT: 

Working closely with broad user groups to coordinate and complete Operational Excellence activities to support sponsored projects and enhancements by
   
 Documenting and developing current state process flows
 Determining and documenting business requirements for business processes and ensure they don’t conflict with the requirements for future projects
 Preparing Gap Analysis
 Documenting and developing future state process flows
 Participating in the discussions of the functional spec & technical design
 Developing comprehensive E2E test cases and steps that will be loaded into HPALM
 Managing & triaging defects assigned during testing
 Obtaining sign off from the business for go live
 Preparing communications out to the business for the change impacts
 Preparing user training documentation for new functionality if required
 Documenting & coordinating the deployment plan

 Holding regular stakeholder meetings to keep all interested parties updated in project progress
 Providing support to business users on systems issues, escalating to Manager, CoE or an IT development/technical team as appropriate.
 Providing period end support to users as required, escalations, solutions.
 Tracking and triaging tickets created for supported systems.
 Experience with content management systems, “Front-end” web development (HTML/CSS/JS)
 Using applications such as Web applications, API’s, SAP, ITSM, ServiceNow, HPALM, SQL.
 Creating and building Operational Excellence Culture through inclusion, engagement, communication, and celebration
 Using active listening and discussion skills to identify issues, ensure understanding and facilitate problem-solving
 Matching different influence strategies and negotiating styles to fit the person or situation
 Providing development opportunities and support to maximize Operational Excellence orientation across the organization
 Collaborating with others to generate appropriate Operational Excellence deployment plan with organizational measures of success.
 Acting as communication liaison between IT team and other pillars and functional areas.
 Involving and coaching business leaders in preparing for and sustaining change
 Being a change champion within the site and network by prompting questions and promoting team-based behavior


 WHAT YOU’LL BRING: 

3 - 5 years of professional/technical experience – prior experience in the web space including web development projects 
BA certified or equivalent experience
 IAAP-certifications: Web Accessibility Specialist (WAS) / Certified Professional in Accessibility Core Competencies (CPACC)
 Knows the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG)
 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in business / accounting
 Strong experience in user testing and project management
 Ability to prioritize, organize, and accomplish multiple tasks, both as part of a team and independently
 Proven project management skills. Ability to develop value-based business cases along with our business partner, document detailed process flows, and define gaps
 Ability to write detailed business requirements to translate into functional design
 Attention to detail with emphasis on accuracy and quality
 Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills
 Experience in production support is an asset
 A high standard for work ethic and quality is required

Title: Analyst Strategic Planning
Description:
Company Overview
 Targray - Building sustainable solutions for a world in transition
 Targray is a global leader in the sourcing, transportation, storage, trading and distribution of commodities and advanced materials for a broad range of industry sectors.
 Established in 1987 in Montreal, Canada, Targray is a global leader in the sourcing, transportation, storage, trading and distribution of commodities and advanced materials for a broad range of industry sectors. Our supply solutions help reduce the world's carbon footprint while enabling our customers to create safer, more reliable products for consumers.
 Targray has operations in 11 countries and over $860M USD in annual sales. In 2019, the company made its debut appearance on the FP500, Financial Post’s ranking of the top 500 corporations in Canada by revenue.

 Great Place to Work® | Best Workplaces in Quebec (2020)
 Deloitte | Best Managed Companies (2019 - 2022)
 EY Canada | Quebec Entrepreneur of the Year (2016)
 HSBC | International Business Award (2012)
 Profit 100 Fastest-Growing Companies in Canada (2006, 2009)

 What we look for
 At Targray, we are committed to helping our people achieve their goals. We strive to be the best in our field and that starts with you. You will have the chance to build a promising career in a culturally diverse company that will prioritize your personal growth and has a great support system in place to help you thrive. We are counting on you to contribute towards our success, and that begins today. Join us and be a part of our amazing team!
 We are looking for passionate, dedicated, and talented individuals with the ability to align with our goals. If you are ambitious and motivated, someone who wants to learn, develop, and think sustainability, then this role is for you.

 Job Summary

 As a part of our continued expansion, Targray is looking for an Analyst, Strategic Planning to work with our CEO based in our Montreal Head Office.

 Job Responsibilities

 As an Analyst, Strategic Planning, you will support the President and leadership team with the overall coordination & organization of activities required to execute on Targray’s strategy, including but not limited to:

 Evaluating new commodity markets for Targray to enter, analyzing the overall product prospects world wide as well as quantifying the value of the different segments of the supply chain.
 Operating at a tactical, strategic, and operational level, handling the oversight of projects that do not neatly fit within the organizational chart or that fall between departments or leadership areas of responsibility.
 Managing projects from “idea” to full execution (end-to-end) and identifying potential project risks based on data analytics.
 Coordinating the BHAG quarterly exercise - assemble organizational annual goals, measure progress, and provide updates to stakeholders.
 Identifying risks of the different projects, and with the proper stakeholders, developing the appropriate contingency plans to overcome them.
 Supporting specific cross-functional work-streams.
 Preparing dashboards, scorecards, and other supporting materials to build the holistic view of initiatives.
 Tracking outcomes and action items and generating reports on the performance of the different implemented strategies.
 Completing quantitative and qualitative analysis (financial analysis, competitive benchmarking, surveys) to provide actionable insights that will support the development of our strategic plan.
 Researching, building, and presenting business cases related to new strategic initiatives, in collaboration with sponsors and other key stakeholders.
 Addressing opportunities for continuous improvement through analytical support, process redefinition or creation of new tools/dashboards.
 Researching and analyzing market intelligence to support merger and acquisition targets that are presented to Executive Leadership.
 Supporting development of material for meetings with Board of Directors, for the Annual Summit or for any other purpose or key external stakeholders
 Developing presentations for the President as needed.
 Developing trusted relationships with partners (Finance, Sales, Legal, HR & Operations) to help develop portfolio strategies and action plans that enable business success.
 Acting as a point of contact or gatekeeper between top management and other stakeholders.


 Job Requirements


 Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field e.g.: Finance, Management, Economics.
 MBA Degree. Either the MBA or Bachelor’s degree must have a Finance concentration.
 2 to 5 years of relevant work or internship experience (e.g., Investment Banking, consulting, corporate strategic planning).
 You have the ability to plan, organize, prioritize and handle multiple time sensitive tasks in a demanding global environment.
 You have demonstrated the ability to be a team player and take initiative, as well as the ability to be decisive.
 You have the ability to build governance, reports and KPIs to support the team objectives.
 You are able to develop and deliver presentations to different levels of management.
 Considered an asset: relevant certifications (e.g., CFA, PMP), relevant experience in the industry.
 Excellent ability to communicate ideas effectively – both verbally and in writing in English and French.

 IDEAL CANDIDATE ATTRIBUTES

 Entrepreneurial mindset with a natural drive to solve challenging problems.
 Intellectually curious and loves to learn.
 Achieves high performance standards as an individual and team member.
 Easily adapts and successfully operates in a volatile and dynamic environment.
 Conveys a professional attitude along with strong communication and interpersonal skill.
 Passionate about innovation and the evolutionary aspects of sustainability.
 Critical thinking - Demonstrated analytical skills; able to synthesize data and “connect the dots”.
 Ability to work autonomously and navigate ambiguity in a high-performing culture, under pressure and with time-sensitive deadlines.


 Benefits


 Beautiful, spacious and modern workplace environment.
 Highly competitive remuneration.
 Flexible work arrangement policy.
 On-site gym facility reserved for employees.
 Generous company-wide profit-sharing plan.
 Medical and dental insurance.
 Retirement Savings Plan with employer matching.
 Subsidized healthy lunch program with fresh meals served daily.


 Diversity & Inclusion
 Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We are committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. We welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds, and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. When people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.
 For more information about our company, please visit https://www.targray.com/.

Title: Business Information Management Analyst II
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

Business Information Management (BIM) at TD is part of a creative, enterprise-wide data and analytics ecosystem. Roles in BIM are highly professional and valued, specialized yet inter-connected and focused on making the availability of business information to designers, developers and decision-makers a priority, all with a united purpose to serve customers and continually build a better bank.
 We're looking for analytical and agile professionals who can merge and translate data into technology and business information, serving today's business needs and setting in motion TD's longer-term goals and strategic objectives.
 If you get data, its power and potential, we think you'll love working at TD, where data knows no bounds and where your professional expertise will help to drive the business forward and take your own career to new heights.



Job Description

Are you an experienced analytical thinker, at ease working on your own or driving forward the success of your team? If so, this role offers a hands-on and high-career growth opportunity to provide business information management support for a range of activities in data and analytics.
 Enjoy partnering with and learning from experts? In this experienced professional role, you'll work within your team as well as lead projects or work streams within broader projects, to help design, develop and support key business information management solutions for TD.
 As Business Information Management Analyst II, you will:

 Focus on providing specialized business support, in your area of specialty
 Lead projects or work streams within broader projects of moderate risk and be accountable for managing own work, while acting as contact point for raised issues and ongoing activities, processes and functional programs
 Conduct a range of data analyses, demonstrating your experience with very large datasets and big data technologies; assessing business information-related data requirements aligned to business needs and for specific data platforms, applications systems and servers
 Partner and collaborate with internal team and business and technology partners to elicit information / data requirements and articulate requirements
 Resolve data / application issues and support the user community by helping them interpret data
 Develop and maintain knowledge of data available from upstream sources and data within relevant platform / applications (e.g. through data profiling, data quality reporting tools, business metadata capture)
 Define, build and manage data dictionary / catalogue for data platforms, systems, servers, applications
 Gather, review, analyze, profile, validate and map system data warehouse to meet reporting needs
 Run quality assurance reports and ensure metadata and data lineage is captured, compatible and maintained in compliance with data management tools and processes as well as enterprise data standards, policies and guidelines
 Participate fully as a team member, support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality and innovation and, ensure timely communication of issues/points of interest




Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:

 Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
 Three (3) or more years relevant experience from a business administration, statistical, mathematical, scientific or financial background
 Sound conceptual knowledge in your area of specialty
 Fluent in one or more programming languages
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
 Solid knowledge of various data sources, tools and technologies used in preparing summaries/reports
 Knowledge of competitor and market trends
 Strong ability to analyze, organize and prioritize work while meeting multiple deadlines
 Expertise in using analytical software tools, MS Office, data analysis methods and reporting techniques
 Proficient to work together and independently, communicate positively and professionally (both in speaking and writing), follow instructions/direction, and help building positive relationships across teams and functions
 Act as a brand champion for our business area / function and TD, both internally and externally




Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
