Title: Senior Deposit Insurance Analyst
Description:
Job Description:
  .
The BC Financial Services Authority (BCFSA) protects British Columbians during their most important financial transactions. We regulate BC ’s financial services market, including credit unions, trust companies, registered pension plans, insurance companies and mortgage brokers.
We uphold public confidence by impartially setting and enforcing standards for real estate professionals. We also ensure that consumers dealing with licensed real estate professionals are protected against wrongful actions. By overseeing the most significant financial transactions in BC we ensure fairness, legality and the prosperity of consumers and the province.
BCFSA is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all groups. This includes women, visible minorities, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, persons of diverse sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (LGBTQ2S+), and others who may contribute to diversity at BCFSA.
We recognize unique styles, perspectives, beliefs, and creativity that support a diverse, respectful, inclusive and collaborative work environment. To achieve this, we stay committed to:
Hiring team members who represent the population we serve Removing barriers that may prevent equitable employment Supporting respectful work environments where everyone feels included and able to produce excellent results
BCFSA is proud to be Great Place to Work Certified™ organization based on direct feedback from our team members.
WHAT WE OFFER:
Healthy living and work-life balance Comprehensive health and wellness benefits plan Opportunities for personal and professional development Competitive compensation A challenging and engaging team environment Defined benefits pension plan Flexible work arrangement for eligible positions A beautiful office location in downtown Vancouver
SUMMARY This position conducts risk surveillance and analysis activities on BC credit unions and recommends pricing and premium rates to maintain the deposit insurance fund.

ACCOUNTABILITIES


Analyzes the BC credit union system and institution risks, and contributes to the identification and ongoing monitoring of relevant risk indicators.
Conducts analyses and recommends pricing and premiums to be paid by the BC credit unions to the deposit insurance fund.
Conducts analyses and recommends optimal fund targets and fund size based on market and risk assessments of the BC credit union system.
Interprets legislation, regulation, policies, procedures, and relevant information to make recommendations that support the BCFSA’s objectives.
Develops risk management and reporting standards.
Maintains the deposit insurance premium calculation methodology.
Participates in contingency planning relating to deposit insurance payouts.
Works with stakeholders to gather information and implement project recommendations.
Responds to inquiries regarding analysis conducted and the identification of risks.
Contributes to, participates in, and supports organizational business transformation initiatives.
Develops briefing notes, correspondence, and information material for internal and external audiences.
Actively participates in research studies, special projects and presentations, and stakeholder engagements.
Contributes to the team’s development of internal work practices (e.g., policies, procedures and tools).
Provides orientation and training to internal and/or external stakeholders within area of responsibility.



 JOB REQUIREMENTS


Degree in business, finance, accounting, or economics and several years of related experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
 Related experience includes:
   o Analyses or examinations experience in the financial services, business or commercial sectors
   o Interpreting and applying legislation, regulations, and/or policy
  

Knowledge of content, interpretation, and application of the Financial Institutions Act/Regulations and the Credit Union Incorporation Act/Regulations.
Knowledge of the credit union business model.
Knowledge of the methods and procedures involved in the development and management of deposit protection programs.
Knowledge of financial analysis techniques and business operational procedures.
Ability to exercise judgement, initiative, and discretion.
Ability to influence stakeholders to comply with legislation regulations and policies.
Superior oral and written communication skills.
Knowledge of risk management principles and methods. Risk management designation is an asset but not a requirement
Knowledge and experience with data analysis tools such as Python, Power BI and SQL are an asset but not a requirement


Please be advised that BCFSA requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of hire and ongoing employment. Candidates will be requested to provide proof of vaccination status, and may only be exempted from the requirements of proof and full vaccination if they request and are approved for a medical exemption or a Human Rights Code accommodation. Such a request must be made during, not after, the recruitment process.

Title: Business Intelligence Engineer, Exports-Visibility
Description:
BA in Computer Science or related 
3+ years of experience working with databases and building metrics 
Strong knowledge in SQL and Python 

 Job summary 
Global Mile (GM) Exports supports Amazon’s strategic vision of bringing worldwide cross-border product selection at the lowest price to our customers and helping sellers and vendors (manufacturers, distributors and brand owners) navigate international trade and logistics. We design and build products and programs with a focus on customer, seller, and vendor experience, and global scalability. 

 Key job responsibilities 
Key job responsibilities 
1. Write high quality optimized SQL to retrieve and analyze data from relational databases (ex. Redshift) 
2. Collaborate with other Business Intelligence teams to design and implement ETL data pipelines for extracting and analyzing billions of records from multiple databases. 
3. Work closely with Data Engineers and business users to design clean and scalable data sources required for analytics and reporting. 
4. Work closely with data scientists and product management to drive data-driven improvements to science artifacts 
5. Create user–friendly, repeatable reporting solutions to minimize ad hoc customer requests 
6. Define and develop business-critical metrics, reports, key performance indicators, and financials across all forecasting products that are consumable by a wide range of functions and levels. 

 About the team 
GM Exports works directly with logistics cross-border carriers and partner with several stakeholder teams to constantly improve the international delivery experience. In GM Exports, the Exports Visibility team is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Business Intelligence Engineer to join our team in Bellevue. GM Exports is growing rapidly in scope, scale and complexity - driving ever growing data needs to support critical business decisions. Our ideal candidate is someone who is always learning as the business grows and as relevant technologies continue to evolve. If you enjoy innovating, thinking big and want to contribute directly to the success of an industry changing business, you may be a prime candidate for this position. 

 BA in Computer Science or related 
3+ years of experience working with databases and building metrics 
Strong knowledge in SQL and Python 

 Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

Title: Disability Claims Analyst
Description:
Disability Claims Analyst
 The Health and Safety Claims Analyst position is a crucial part of our Claims Management, Early and Safe Return to Work and Risk processes. Reporting directly to the Disability Claims Manager with strong support to our Risk department , this role is responsible for coordinating and administrating occupational and non occupational claims, commercial insurance programs as well as data management, maintaining records, preventing loss, and helping to design and maintain key KPI’s. By assessing and promoting the needs of the business by proactively managing disability claims and supporting the Health & Safety/Risk programs, you will bring tangible results and work collaboratively throughout our Canadian sites in a manner that is in line with our Company Goals and Values.
 Who We Are
 Emterra Group is a dynamic, growth-oriented, and safety-focused group of companies. organizations have been deemed to be an “essential service” by providing collection and processing for recycling, organics, and waste that keep our communities clean and safe. With customer service and safety as our focus, we are looking for an energetic and driven employee to support our growing company and play a crucial role in waste diversion and the circular economy. Emterra is proud to be recognized as one of Canada’s Greenest Employers, a certified diverse supplier of the Canadian Aboriginal and Minority Supplier Council (CAMSC) and the Canadian Women Business Enterprise National Council (WBE).
 Reasons to Apply, Stay and Grow with Emterra Group

 Opportunity to be part of one of Canada’s Greenest Employers!
 Competitive wages and annual wage increases!
 Comprehensive health benefits (drug, dental, vision, LTD, life insurance)!
 Employee Assistance Program, paid for by the Company!
 Tuition reimbursement program and professional development support!
 Be part of an entrepreneurial organization that wants to continue to learn and grow!
 Ability to have impact and make change!

 Role Responsibilities

 As the first point of contact for the administration of all work and non work related claims, will work with the Disability Claims Manager and Leaders in the field to ensure the proper and timely filing of all claims.
 Administrates and enters all claims into various databases as well as disability providers and/or governing bodies.
 Active participant and minutes facilitator for the Joint Health & Safety Committee.
 In conjunction with our Risk, Health and Safety Department, assists with the administration and monitoring of insurance claims.
 Maintains computerized claim files and hard copy claims filing system by compiling the relevant documents, opinions, and recommendations of all parties.
 Coordinates information from operating departments on reported claims, legal defenses, and organizing claim files.
 Assists in the development and monitoring of contracts for adjusters, brokers, and commercial insurance services/programs in conjunction with the Risk, Health and Safety Departmental leader.
 Assists the Risk Manager in designing and implementing risk management programs that are intended to reduce the potential liability of future insurance claims.
 Participates in the ongoing review of existing policies and procedures related to claim administration.
 Responds to inquiries from various stakeholders throughout Canada regarding claims administration and return to work practices.
 Under the direction of the Disability Claims Manager, will participate in disability and return to work management awareness training.
 Review and lead Emterra’s occupational and non occupational injury administration and program, disability management programs utilizing best practice to optimize supports and resources at each site.
 Under the direction of the Disability Claims Manager, provide regular updates to a variety of stakeholders (employees, managers, physicians, specialists, unions, providers, etc.) and gather the relevant information allowing the initial and ongoing assessment and management of an employee’s occupational and non-occupational injuries.
 Liaise with LTD Insurer to determine status of claims, action plans and next steps.
 Develop, compile, coordinate, analyze and monitor various case management reports.
 Track exemptible incidents from the Attendance Management Program for all Non-Culpable absenteeism in coordination and collaboration with the HR department.
 Provide supplemental coverage for the Disability Claims Management during vacation, time off etc.
 Currently, a hybrid work arrangement will be in place however this may change depending on business needs and government legislation.

 Qualifications

 1-2 years’ experience with administrative experience in data analytics.
 Post secondary education in a related field is an asset.
 Occupational Health and Safety certification is an asset.
 Knowledge of Provincial Workers Compensation legislation, Provincial Employment Standards Acts and Occupational Health and Safety regulations, Duty to Accommodate, Human Rights Code, Privacy laws, FIPPA, etc.; and provincial specific legislation (e.g., AODA).
 Excellent written and oral communication with various cross functional teams and internal and external stakeholders.
 Ability to develop and analyze relevant occupational health and safety statistical data.
 Ability to handle sensitive issues and to protect confidential medical information.
 Excellent computer skills with working knowledge of various software, including Microsoft Office.
 Creation of power point presentations for management and supporting departments.
 Ability to work independently and collaboratively as a team member.
 Exceptional problem-solving abilities and professional judgement.
 Previous work experience at Provincial Workers Compensation organizations is an asset.

 Are you ready to jumpstart your career by joining one of Canada’s Greenest Employers and become part of the environmental solution? If so, apply now! We appreciate all applicants who apply however only those who are qualified, will be contacted.
 Emterra Group is committed to maintaining an equitable, fair, and diverse environment. Any applicants who have a disability or require reasonable accommodation may speak directly with our dedicated Talent Acquisition and Recruitment Specialists. Reasonable accommodations will be assessed on a case-by-case basis.

Title: SAP Business Analyst / Analyste commercial SAP
Description:
Fastco Canada is seeking a strategic ERP Business Analyst who can solve organizational information problems by analyzing requirements; engaging in process improvement, and making critical recommendations on system controls and protocols.
Reporting to the Director of Information Systems, the ERP Business Analyst will be an integral member of the IT department: a small, yet growing, and nimble team working in a fast-paced environment. He or she will share his experience with the members of his team and ensure processes and technologies used are on path of continuous improvement and aligned with corporate objectives.
The ERP Business Analyst will perform other related duties as requested by his immediate superior, in accordance with internal procedures and rules.
_RESPONSABILITIES_*ERP Business Analysis 50%*

Analyze functional requirements to assist in developing solutions to challenges related to system integrations.
Examine user requirements, procedures, and problems to improve existing processes.
Review existing integrations to understand capabilities, limitations, and make recommendations, including complimentary software solutions or developments.
Collaborate with appropriate business units, production support team members, and developers on requirements gathering, solution design, and creation of production support specifications.
Document, develop and revise system design procedures, test procedures and quality standards, as well as updating system documentation.
Configuring solutions where applicable
Consult with management to reach agreement on system operating principles, and work with internal clients on information computation or processing needs to be addressed.
Assist Key Users in delivering enhancements across the different functional groups

SAP User Support 50%

Troubleshooting with end users across all business units
Manage user access and privileges
Update and manage business configuration requests
Provide reporting and key data points to assist users in their roles.
Assist staff in resolving issues, such as system incidents, as well as training users on core functionalities and enhancements.
Coordinate remote sessions across business units to enhance communication and user adoption.
Provide SAP-related training to new hires.

BEHAVIOURS RELATED TO THE FUNCTION

Demonstrate very strong analytical and communication skills.
Strong organizational skills.
Self-motivated and driven.
Able to work in a team and independently.
Demonstrate a positive attitude in work and remains calm in stressful situations.
Demonstrate a good sense of planning.
Demonstrate a high degree of adaptability and initiative.

ACADEMIC SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s degree and/or 5+ years of experience in a similar role
SAP ByDesign or SAP Business One experience or similar ERP solutions
Excellent communication skills in both English and French
Previous experience in systems integration
Proven track record in process improvement
Exceptional communication and listening skills, quick learner that is willing to put in as much time as needed to come up-to-speed.
Must have desire and aptitude to work in technical, fast-paced atmosphere.
Ability to work on multiple tasks simultaneously.
Good analytical and troubleshooting skills.
Related experience in the automotive industry would be an asset.

Fastco Canada est à la recherche d'un analyste commercial ERP stratégique capable de résoudre les problèmes d'information organisationnelle en analysant les exigences ; doit s'engager activement dans l'amélioration des processus et fournir des recommandations critiques sur les contrôles et les protocoles du système.
Relevant du directeur des système informatiques, l’analyste commercial ERP sera un membre intégral du département informatique : une petite équipe agile, travaillant dans un environnement au rythme rapide. Le candidat ou la candidate partagera son expérience avec les membres de son équipe et veillera à ce que les technologies et les processus utilisés soient en voie d’amélioration continue et alignés avec les objectifs de l'entreprise.
L’analyste commercial ERP effectue d'autres tâches connexes à la demande de son superviseur immédiat, le tout conformément aux procédures et règles internes.
RESPONSABILITÉS
Analyste commercial ERP 50% 

Analyser les exigences fonctionnelles pour aider à développer des solutions aux défis liés aux intégrations de systèmes.
Examiner les exigences, les procédures et les problèmes des utilisateurs afin d'améliorer les processus existants.
_ Passez en revue les intégrations existantes pour comprendre les capacités, les limites et faire des recommandations, y compris des solutions ou des développements de logiciels complémentaires._
Collaborer avec les unités commerciales appropriées, les membres de l'équipe de support de production et les développeurs sur la collecte des exigences, la conception de solutions et la création de spécifications de support de production.
Documenter, développer et réviser les procédures de conception du système, les procédures de test et les normes de qualité, ainsi que mettre à jour la documentation du système. 
Configurer des solutions lorsque nécessaire.
Consulter la direction pour parvenir à un accord sur les principes de fonctionnement du système et travailler avec les clients internes sur le calcul ou le traitement des informations à adresser. 
Participer à l'élaboration et au lancement de SAP CoE “Centre of Excellence”.

Assistance aux utilisateurs SAP 50% 

Résoudre les problèmes des utilisateurs de toutes les unités commerciales.
Fournir des rapports et des données essentielles afin d'aider les utilisateurs dans leurs rôles.
Aider le personnel à résoudre les problèmes, tels que les incidents survenant dans le système et aider à former les utilisateurs sur les fonctionnalités de base et d'amélioration.
Coordonner des sessions à distance entre les unités commerciales afin d'améliorer la communication et l'adoption par les utilisateurs.
Fournir une formation SAP aux nouveaux employés.

COMPORTEMENTS LIÉS À LA FONCTION

Démontrer de très fortes aptitudes d'analyse et de communication.
Fortes compétences organisationnelles.
Motivé et déterminé.
Capable de travailler en équipe et de façon autonome.
Démontrer une attitude positive au travail et rester calme lors de situations stressantes.
Démontrer un bon sens de la planification.
Démontrer un haut degré d'adaptabilité et d'initiative.

ASPECTS ACADÉMIQUES ET EXPÉRIENCE 

Baccalauréat et / ou 5 ans et plus d’expérience dans un rôle similaire.
Expérience avec SAP ByDesign ou SAP Business One ou solutions ERP similaires.
Expérience antérieure en intégration de systèmes.
Antécédents prouvés dans l'amélioration des processus.
Compétences exceptionnelles en communication et en écoute. Doit apprendre rapidement et être prêt à consacrer les heures nécessaires pour approfondir rapidement les connaissances nécessaires.
Doit avoir le désir et la capacité de travailler dans une atmosphère technique et au rythme rapide.
Capacité à travailler sur plusieurs tâches simultanément.
Bonnes capacités d'analyse et de résolution de problèmes.
Excellentes compétences de communication en anglais et en français.
Une expérience connexe dans l'industrie automobile serait un atout.

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Location: Scarborough, ON, CA Edmonton, AB, CA Kamloops, British Columbia, CA Markham, ON, CA Kitchener, ON, CA Brampton, ON, CA Winnipeg, MB, CA Calgary, AB, CA Etobicoke, ON, CA Fredericton, New Brunswick, CA Burlington, ON, CA Vancouver, British Columbia, CA Mississauga, ON, CA Ottawa, ON, CA London, ON, CA Montreal, Quebec, CA Burnaby, British Columbia, CA Vaughan, ON, CA Moncton, New Brunswick, CA Kelowna, British Columbia, CA Oakville, ON, CA 
    







     Req ID: 27863 
    







     Jobs by Category: Technology Solutions 
    







     Job Function: Technology 
    







     Status: Full Time 
    







     Schedule: Regular 
    







Description




Our team is transforming a legacy enterprise ticketing system into a modern cloud based solution that serves multiple customer and network teams. There is no detail too small for us to improve the user experience, efficiency, and productivity of the systems we support. Even if it’s near seconds the focus is on delivering incremental gains in application capability and speed.


As a Senior Business Systems Analyst within our Reliability Centre of Excellence portfolio, you will be responsible for supporting the design, development and operational support of reliable Ticketing solutions. Operating in a BMC Remedy AR System custom environment, you will work with stakeholders to identify and prioritize opportunities. You will be joining a team that is passionate and proud of developing applications that enable internal agents to serve external customers and to drive continual improvements to workplace processes and automation initiatives.


What you’ll do:



Gather requirements from customers and end users and design, test and deploy ticketing solutions
Collaborate with business and network teams to identify opportunities and launch new products and services
Use modern coding languages (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, REST [JSON], Java and Java Servlets, Apache/Tomcat and Linux experience) to deliver customizations which optimize functionality and support business requirements
Lead assessment of potential technology/software solutions to improve efficiency
Troubleshoot issues experienced by customers
Act as a change champion (apply strong communication and change management skills) to successfully deliver on project goals
Mentor and coach other team members


 




Qualifications


 

What you bring:



5+ years’ experience as a Business Systems Analyst
Configuration and customization experience with BMC Remedy Action Request System/Helix
Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, REST (JSON), Java and Java Servlets
Apache/Tomcat and Linux experience
Good understanding of Oracle database (SQL) with data modeling experience
Planning and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and multitask
Diploma/Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering

Title: SAP Data Analyst - Manager
Description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 SAP Data Analyst – Manager
 The opportunity
 EY Consulting Services is a fast-moving, high-growth area with huge potential. We are currently seeking a Manager to join our SAP enterprise applications team.
 This team offers variety, challenge, responsibility, and the opportunity to realize your leadership potential. To address the shifting landscape of our clients' needs, EY has established a national Center of Excellence focusing in the broad topics of Enterprise Intelligence, Risk Transformation, IT Risk, and Enabling Technologies. Enabling Technologies primarily focuses on the design and optimization of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) packages such as SAP solutions. Our team typically works with Fortune 1000 clients across a variety of industries, Manufacturing, Pharma, Energy/Utilities, Transportation, Telecommunications, Entertainment/Media, Oil/Gas, and Consumer Goods/Retail.  Your key responsibilities
 As a Consultant, you'll assist in developing applicable methodologies, tools, approaches, points of view, thought leadership, and accelerators to differentiate EY in the ERP consulting market. You will also participate in large-scale SAP solution implementation engagements in a client-facing capacity and be required to demonstrate functional and technical leadership by helping our clients to collaboratively solve their challenges.
 To qualify, candidates must possess:
 Soft-skills:

 Experience leading clients through new data concepts (Data Stewards, Data Governance, Mock Loads, Data Object Master, Data Owners, etc.)
 Should be a self-starter with excellent verbal and written communication skills. Should be comfortable interfacing with a client on a daily basis. This role requires daily interaction with the client at many levels including executives.
 Strong written and verbal communication, presentation, client service and technical writing skills, coupled with a strong interest in further developing and integrating enterprise domain knowledge with technology skills.
 Effectively team with diverse skills and backgrounds and foster an innovative and inclusive team-oriented work environment.
 Consistently deliver quality client services, driving high-quality work products within the expected timeframes and on budget.
 Ability to challenge stakeholders against SAP industry best practices and propose creative solutions to address business requirements.
 Participated in large-scale SAP client engagements with prior consulting experience and a demonstrated history of driving revenue within existing clients and in developing new prospects at the "C" level of Fortune 500 companies.
 Monitor progress manage risk and ensure key stakeholders are kept informed about progress and expected outcomes. Manage expectations of client service delivery. Stay abreast of current business and industry trends relevant to the client's business.
 A willingness to travel to meet client needs; depending on the project travel may be estimated at 25-75%.


 Hard-skills:

 5-7 years of SAP MDM experience, 3+ E2E implementations,
 Extensive data migration (ETLV) experience and expertise in S/4HANA data migration using SAP Data Services. Knowledge of various S/4 data loading methods (IDOCs, LTMC/LTMOM, LSMW, and custom programs)
 Good understanding of SAP data conversion lifecycle covering data readiness, data conversion design-build-test, mock loads, data validation, data cutover
 Experience of SAP data profiling and cleansing (de-duplication, match/merge, standardization, rationalization)
 Deep knowledge of key SAP objects (e.g MM, BP, Equipment, Functional Locations, BOMs) and working knowledge of a few SAP functional modules:
   
 Record to Report (FI, CO)
 Procure to Pay (MM, IM, EWM)
 Project Systems, Portfolio and Project Management
 Plant Maintenance, Quality Management
 Production Planning, IBP
 HR

 Experience delivering SAP data conversion solutions for Oil, Gas and/or Energy clients is a bonus.


 What we look for
 We’re interested in passionate leaders with a strong vision and a desire to stay on top of trends in the IT Consulting space. If you have a strong passion for helping businesses achieve their IT strategy, this role is for you.
 What we offer  At EY, our Total Rewards package supports our commitment to creating a leading people culture - built on high-performance teaming - where everyone can achieve their potential and contribute to building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. It's one of the many reasons we repeatedly win awards for being a great place to work.
 We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:

 Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
 Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
 The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you


 Diversity and Inclusion at EY  Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We’re committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. From our actions to combat systemic racism and our advocacy for the LGBT+ community to our innovative Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, we welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.

 EY Way of Work and your health and safety  EY Way of Work recognizes flexibility in the way we collaborate, innovate and deliver with the ability to work in-person and remotely. To support a healthy and safe in-person working environment, EY has implemented various layers of health and safety controls while working in the office or at client or other locations. A critical component of EY’s workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy which requires all personnel to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless an accommodation based on a reason protected by human rights legislation is provided  If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Make your mark. Apply today.
 EY is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.

 EY | Building a better working world

 EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

 Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

 Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Title: Compensation & Classification Analyst
Description:
Reporting to the Executive Director, People, and receiving day to day work direction from the Compensation/Classification Advisors, the Compensation & Classification Analyst provides a variety of classification/compensation services in support and maintenance of internal/external compensation and classification records, systems and reporting requirements, contract administration including annual pay and performance adjustments, and the delivery of services to clients across Providence Health Care (PHC) such as assisting with the preparation and classification of job descriptions, organizational charts, and industry-related research activities. 
   Skills Practical knowledge of collective agreements, applicable employment legislation and regulations. 
    Ability to organize work of self, identifying and managing multiple and complex priorities, meet deadlines, and work under pressure with minimum supervision. 
    Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills including business writing skills. 
    Demonstrated ability to effective use Microsoft Office Suite products such as Word, Excel, Power Point, and Outlook at an intermediate to advanced level. 
    Demonstrated use and understanding of HR information systems and applicant hiring systems. Knowledge of PeopleSoft HCM is an asset. 
    Demonstrated ability to use online communication tools such as Skype, Zoom, etc. 
    Ability to work effectively, independently and in collaboration with others. 
    Ability to deal with others effectively, at all levels of the organization. 
    Demonstrated ability to identify, analyze, and resolve problems. 
    Demonstrated ability to utilize a customer service approach to staff and clients. 
    Physical ability to perform the duties of the position. 
   
Education A level of education, training and experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources plus two (2) to three (3) years’ recent related human resources experience including working in a unionized environment, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Previous experience in compensation or benefits is preferred. 
   Duties Maintains and updates Compensation & Classification and Public and Industry Reporting databases such as the CJDD, CRP and LIGER including scanning, uploading, and indexing required documentation and updating/obsoleting of files and data and liaising with applicable agencies on systems changes and updates. 
   
 Functions as a super-user on Compensation & Compensation related systems, identifies and investigates data and system issues, provides systems advice and makes recommendations, develops reports and queries, and works within People Services and other departments to determine the root of the issue and to troubleshoot solutions. Identifies opportunities for service improvement, provides input on changes, drafts processes and guidelines documents, and participates in business process improvement. 
   
 Prepares individual employee contract renewal and reclassification letters for various PHC departments. Liaises with areas such Payroll, Records and Benefits, Recruitment and/or Finance to process, investigate or follow up on queries such as contract terms such as benefit entitlement, vacation accruals, pay adjustments, stipends, retroactive payments, positions numbers, job code updates, etc. 
   
 Assists with the annual processing of pay adjustments for unionized and non-contract staff including sending out appropriate notifications to staff or Managers, working with Sustainment and HR Data Analytics to update HR Connect and PeopleSoft systems, proofing documentation, and reviewing exception reports. Prepares costings of wage increases for review. 
   
 Conducts regular audits of job code table, job inventory, CJDD and other classification and compensation records to ensure accuracy and integrity of data. 
   
 Conducts assigned research on classification and compensation matters such as completion of industry surveys and preparation and distribution of internal surveys. Assists with the completion of costing spreadsheets and reports for grievance liability or pay changes for Finance, HEABC or other stakeholders. 
   
 Updates and maintains Compensation/Classification repositories of job descriptions, information directories, intranet site, and departmental filing systems. 
   
 Prepares job descriptions for specific/designated areas and classifications including conducting job audits if required, preparation of job description including review of qualifications, assignment of classification/evaluation for review by Compensation and Classification Advisor as required. Submits to Union or HEABC as appropriate. 
   
 Assists Compensation and Classification Advisors with responses to Union objections to job descriptions or HEABC queries, by researching appropriate response based on requirements of classification system, clarification of duties and requirements with applicable department/program, and reviewing interpretations and jurisprudence as necessary. 
   
 Provides support and participates in Compensation & Classification projects. Prepares and maintains project tracking documentation, training materials, statistical information and reports. 
   
 Participates in meetings, provides information, and takes action as appropriate. 
   
 Performs other related duties as assigned.

Title: HRIS Analyst
Description:
Closing Date: August 1, 2022



 This is a temporary role for 1 year.

 Reporting to the Manager, People Systems, the HRIS Analyst will apply HR process knowledge and experience to maintain and administer all aspects of the following:

 SAP SuccessFactors HXM
 Global Workforce Analytics (GWA) database powered by the Microsoft Business Intelligence Suite.





 Responsibilities:




 SAP SuccessFactors HXM
 Uphold the application of HR policies, practices, and programs through ongoing maintenance and support of SAP SuccessFactors, including configuration, security authorizations and reporting.
 Assist in the organization, execution, and support of annual projects such as: benefit enrollment, salary review, bonus review, and year-end processes.
 Act as a champion of change and provide HR system consulting services to various corporate and site HR functions such as Compensation, Benefits, Pensions and Payroll.
 Investigate and troubleshoot data and systems issues, coordinating with end users, Information Technology, and vendors as necessary.
 Perform data audits to ensure data integrity.
 Design report specifications and develop and generate routine and ad hoc reports.
 Identify opportunities to leverage HR systems to solve business process challenges.
 Document HRIS processes, procedures, and develop training materials. Provide documentation and/or training to functional units as needed.





 Qualifications:




 Bachelor’s degree in Commerce, Business Management, Computer Science or similar.
 CPHR designation is an asset.
 Minimum of 5 years HR experience, with at least 4 years HR Systems configuration, reporting, training, and testing experience.
 The following systems experience:
      
 SAP SuccessFactors HXM – Employee Central, Learning Management Systems, and Employee Central Benefits
 Excel – advanced (Lookup Functions, Pivot Tables, advanced charting and analysis, Macros)
 Microsoft Visio or similar process mapping tools

 Intermediate knowledge of human resources, payroll, and benefits principles and practices.
 Experience implementing and/or upgrading an HR system (full lifecycle from requirements gathering to aftercare support).
 Experience in a multinational, geographically dispersed company, with union experience an asset.
 Ability to analyze data and apply critical thinking to resolve issues and suggest solutions and improvements.
 Strong planning, project management, and organization skills.
 Customer focused with ability to influence cooperation between vendors, sites, and functions.
 Clear and concise communicator, with experience delivering training.
 Excellent judgment, discretion, and tact. Ability to handle confidential and personal information to ensure compliance with PIPA, PIPEDA, and other regional privacy laws.





 About Teck



 Successful candidates must be fully vaccinated against infection by COVID-19. Candidates who are unable to be vaccinated due to a personal characteristic protected under applicable human rights legislation may request to be exempt from this requirement. We will do our best to accommodate those who are unable to be vaccinated.




 Teck is consistently recognized as a top employer for our commitment to a healthy and positive work environment. Our team is focused on fostering a workplace where everyone is included, valued and equipped for the future. In 2021, Teck was proud to be selected as one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers for four years in a row, and also named as one of Canada’s Top Employers for Young People. In 2020, Teck was named to Forbes World’s Best Employers List and in 2021, we were recognized in Forbes Canada’s Best Employers 2021 List.  Teck is a diversified resource company committed to responsible mining and mineral development with major business units focused on copper, steelmaking coal, zinc and energy. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, its shares are listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbols TECK.A and TECK.B and the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TECK.

Title: Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS) Analyst
Description:
The Sudbury Catholic District School Board is located in Northeastern Ontario and serves approximately 6,000 students in 18 schools located in Greater Sudbury, as well as in Markstay and Killarney. Greater Sudbury is 3,627 square kilometers in area, making it the geographically largest municipality in Ontario and second largest in Canada. Greater Sudbury is considered a city of lakes, containing 330 lakes and the largest lake contained within a city, Lake Wanapitei.
Our School Board is host to and celebrates diverse cultures and is comprised of dedicated staff committed to high quality education that inspires and promotes lifelong learning. The Board is currently seeking an HRIS Analyst to join our dynamic team.
Reporting to the Senior Manager of Human Resources, the HRIS Analyst is primarily responsible for collecting, analyzing, and maintaining Human Resources software and data in conjunction with Human Resources Services and Information Management Services. The HRIS Analyst will serve as the main point of contact for end user support and configuring the HRIS and related systems for various projects, as well as supporting Human Resource Services in Human Resource related matters.
ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS
Education / Certification:

Post-secondary degree/diploma in Human Resources Management, Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Analytics, or equivalent in training as determined by the Board
Ministry of Labour “Worker Health & Safety Awareness in 4 Steps” training certificate

Experience Required:

3-5 years of HRIS experience in a Human Resources or HRIS Analyst capacity

Knowledge / Skills / Abilities:

Expert in Human Resources Information Systems, report writing
Expert level skills required in Microsoft Excel
Proficiency with other MS Office tools (Word, Outlook, PowerPoint etc.) and database management systems
Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to summarize information concisely and present in written, graphical and/or verbal format, to covey complex information to all levels of stakeholders
Demonstrated experience building working relationships and providing exemplary customer service to multiple stakeholders
Strong quantitative, analytical and problem-solving skills
Demonstrated experience in project management and organizational skills
Capable of making decisions within guidelines and policies
Ability to meet restrictive deadlines, and manage competing priorities
Ability to maintain a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail; skilled in manipulating data
Well-developed interpersonal skills and the ability to work both independently and within a team environment
Demonstrated experience interpreting employment legislation and collective agreements in a multi-union environment
Working knowledge of relevant legislation, including the Ontario Labour Relations Act, the Human Rights Code, the Employment Standards Act and the Municipal Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Information Technology education/experience is preferred
Certified Human Resources Professional/Leader (CHRP/CHRL) and/or Payroll Compliance Practitioner (PCP) designation considered an asset
Working knowledge of the Education Act and its regulations
Knowledge of School Board policies and procedures, TPP, OMERS, Ontario College of Teachers, Basic and Additional Qualifications

The successful candidate will be required to produce a satisfactory police record check: Vulnerable Sector Check.
The annual salary range for this position is $66,468 to $83,092 with a comprehensive benefit package.
For more information on this opportunity and working for the Sudbury Catholic District School Board, please contact Human Resources services for the fully detailed job description and visit the board website. Qualified applicants apply online at sudburycatholicschools.simplication.com. Please attach a cover letter and resume, including the contact information for three professional references, by 12:00 p.m., July 21, 2022.
As part of its commitment to equity, diversity and inclusivity, the Sudbury Catholic District School Board encourages and welcomes applications from individuals ofequity-seeking populations.
All applicants are thanked for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
In accordance with the Municipal Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act, personal information is being collected under the authority of the Education Act and will be used for employee recruitment and selection purposes. For questions about this collection of information please contact Human Resources Services at (705) 673-5620.
If you require a disability-related accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, or if you have questions about this collection of information, please contact Human Resources Services at (705) 673-5620.
Thank you for your interest in Sudbury Catholic Schools.
www.sudburycatholicschools.ca

Salary: $66,468.00-$83,092.00 per year

Day shift

Title: SAP Business Analyst / Analyste commercial SAP
Description:
Fastco Canada is seeking a strategic ERP Business Analyst who can solve organizational information problems by analyzing requirements; engaging in process improvement, and making critical recommendations on system controls and protocols.
Reporting to the Director of Information Systems, the ERP Business Analyst will be an integral member of the IT department: a small, yet growing, and nimble team working in a fast-paced environment. He or she will share his experience with the members of his team and ensure processes and technologies used are on path of continuous improvement and aligned with corporate objectives.
The ERP Business Analyst will perform other related duties as requested by his immediate superior, in accordance with internal procedures and rules.
_RESPONSABILITIES_*ERP Business Analysis 50%*

Analyze functional requirements to assist in developing solutions to challenges related to system integrations.
Examine user requirements, procedures, and problems to improve existing processes.
Review existing integrations to understand capabilities, limitations, and make recommendations, including complimentary software solutions or developments.
Collaborate with appropriate business units, production support team members, and developers on requirements gathering, solution design, and creation of production support specifications.
Document, develop and revise system design procedures, test procedures and quality standards, as well as updating system documentation.
Configuring solutions where applicable
Consult with management to reach agreement on system operating principles, and work with internal clients on information computation or processing needs to be addressed.
Assist Key Users in delivering enhancements across the different functional groups

SAP User Support 50%

Troubleshooting with end users across all business units
Manage user access and privileges
Update and manage business configuration requests
Provide reporting and key data points to assist users in their roles.
Assist staff in resolving issues, such as system incidents, as well as training users on core functionalities and enhancements.
Coordinate remote sessions across business units to enhance communication and user adoption.
Provide SAP-related training to new hires.

BEHAVIOURS RELATED TO THE FUNCTION

Demonstrate very strong analytical and communication skills.
Strong organizational skills.
Self-motivated and driven.
Able to work in a team and independently.
Demonstrate a positive attitude in work and remains calm in stressful situations.
Demonstrate a good sense of planning.
Demonstrate a high degree of adaptability and initiative.

ACADEMIC SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s degree and/or 5+ years of experience in a similar role
SAP ByDesign or SAP Business One experience or similar ERP solutions
Excellent communication skills in both English and French
Previous experience in systems integration
Proven track record in process improvement
Exceptional communication and listening skills, quick learner that is willing to put in as much time as needed to come up-to-speed.
Must have desire and aptitude to work in technical, fast-paced atmosphere.
Ability to work on multiple tasks simultaneously.
Good analytical and troubleshooting skills.
Related experience in the automotive industry would be an asset.

Fastco Canada est à la recherche d'un analyste commercial ERP stratégique capable de résoudre les problèmes d'information organisationnelle en analysant les exigences ; doit s'engager activement dans l'amélioration des processus et fournir des recommandations critiques sur les contrôles et les protocoles du système.
Relevant du directeur des système informatiques, l’analyste commercial ERP sera un membre intégral du département informatique : une petite équipe agile, travaillant dans un environnement au rythme rapide. Le candidat ou la candidate partagera son expérience avec les membres de son équipe et veillera à ce que les technologies et les processus utilisés soient en voie d’amélioration continue et alignés avec les objectifs de l'entreprise.
L’analyste commercial ERP effectue d'autres tâches connexes à la demande de son superviseur immédiat, le tout conformément aux procédures et règles internes.
RESPONSABILITÉS
Analyste commercial ERP 50% 

Analyser les exigences fonctionnelles pour aider à développer des solutions aux défis liés aux intégrations de systèmes.
Examiner les exigences, les procédures et les problèmes des utilisateurs afin d'améliorer les processus existants.
_ Passez en revue les intégrations existantes pour comprendre les capacités, les limites et faire des recommandations, y compris des solutions ou des développements de logiciels complémentaires._
Collaborer avec les unités commerciales appropriées, les membres de l'équipe de support de production et les développeurs sur la collecte des exigences, la conception de solutions et la création de spécifications de support de production.
Documenter, développer et réviser les procédures de conception du système, les procédures de test et les normes de qualité, ainsi que mettre à jour la documentation du système. 
Configurer des solutions lorsque nécessaire.
Consulter la direction pour parvenir à un accord sur les principes de fonctionnement du système et travailler avec les clients internes sur le calcul ou le traitement des informations à adresser. 
Participer à l'élaboration et au lancement de SAP CoE “Centre of Excellence”.

Assistance aux utilisateurs SAP 50% 

Résoudre les problèmes des utilisateurs de toutes les unités commerciales.
Fournir des rapports et des données essentielles afin d'aider les utilisateurs dans leurs rôles.
Aider le personnel à résoudre les problèmes, tels que les incidents survenant dans le système et aider à former les utilisateurs sur les fonctionnalités de base et d'amélioration.
Coordonner des sessions à distance entre les unités commerciales afin d'améliorer la communication et l'adoption par les utilisateurs.
Fournir une formation SAP aux nouveaux employés.

COMPORTEMENTS LIÉS À LA FONCTION

Démontrer de très fortes aptitudes d'analyse et de communication.
Fortes compétences organisationnelles.
Motivé et déterminé.
Capable de travailler en équipe et de façon autonome.
Démontrer une attitude positive au travail et rester calme lors de situations stressantes.
Démontrer un bon sens de la planification.
Démontrer un haut degré d'adaptabilité et d'initiative.

ASPECTS ACADÉMIQUES ET EXPÉRIENCE 

Baccalauréat et / ou 5 ans et plus d’expérience dans un rôle similaire.
Expérience avec SAP ByDesign ou SAP Business One ou solutions ERP similaires.
Expérience antérieure en intégration de systèmes.
Antécédents prouvés dans l'amélioration des processus.
Compétences exceptionnelles en communication et en écoute. Doit apprendre rapidement et être prêt à consacrer les heures nécessaires pour approfondir rapidement les connaissances nécessaires.
Doit avoir le désir et la capacité de travailler dans une atmosphère technique et au rythme rapide.
Capacité à travailler sur plusieurs tâches simultanément.
Bonnes capacités d'analyse et de résolution de problèmes.
Excellentes compétences de communication en anglais et en français.
Une expérience connexe dans l'industrie automobile serait un atout.

Casual dress
Company events

Employee assistance program

RRSP match
Store discount
Tuition reimbursement
Wellness program
Work from home

8 hour shift

Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

related: 4 years (preferred)

English and French (required)

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Location: Scarborough, ON, CA Edmonton, AB, CA Kamloops, British Columbia, CA Markham, ON, CA Kitchener, ON, CA Brampton, ON, CA Winnipeg, MB, CA Calgary, AB, CA Etobicoke, ON, CA Fredericton, New Brunswick, CA Burlington, ON, CA Vancouver, British Columbia, CA Mississauga, ON, CA Ottawa, ON, CA London, ON, CA Montreal, Quebec, CA Burnaby, British Columbia, CA Vaughan, ON, CA Moncton, New Brunswick, CA Kelowna, British Columbia, CA Oakville, ON, CA 
    







     Req ID: 27863 
    







     Jobs by Category: Technology Solutions 
    







     Job Function: Technology 
    







     Status: Full Time 
    







     Schedule: Regular 
    







Description




Our team is transforming a legacy enterprise ticketing system into a modern cloud based solution that serves multiple customer and network teams. There is no detail too small for us to improve the user experience, efficiency, and productivity of the systems we support. Even if it’s near seconds the focus is on delivering incremental gains in application capability and speed.


As a Senior Business Systems Analyst within our Reliability Centre of Excellence portfolio, you will be responsible for supporting the design, development and operational support of reliable Ticketing solutions. Operating in a BMC Remedy AR System custom environment, you will work with stakeholders to identify and prioritize opportunities. You will be joining a team that is passionate and proud of developing applications that enable internal agents to serve external customers and to drive continual improvements to workplace processes and automation initiatives.


What you’ll do:



Gather requirements from customers and end users and design, test and deploy ticketing solutions
Collaborate with business and network teams to identify opportunities and launch new products and services
Use modern coding languages (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, REST [JSON], Java and Java Servlets, Apache/Tomcat and Linux experience) to deliver customizations which optimize functionality and support business requirements
Lead assessment of potential technology/software solutions to improve efficiency
Troubleshoot issues experienced by customers
Act as a change champion (apply strong communication and change management skills) to successfully deliver on project goals
Mentor and coach other team members


 




Qualifications


 

What you bring:



5+ years’ experience as a Business Systems Analyst
Configuration and customization experience with BMC Remedy Action Request System/Helix
Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, REST (JSON), Java and Java Servlets
Apache/Tomcat and Linux experience
Good understanding of Oracle database (SQL) with data modeling experience
Planning and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and multitask
Diploma/Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering

Title: SAP Data Analyst - Manager
Description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 SAP Data Analyst – Manager
 The opportunity
 EY Consulting Services is a fast-moving, high-growth area with huge potential. We are currently seeking a Manager to join our SAP enterprise applications team.
 This team offers variety, challenge, responsibility, and the opportunity to realize your leadership potential. To address the shifting landscape of our clients' needs, EY has established a national Center of Excellence focusing in the broad topics of Enterprise Intelligence, Risk Transformation, IT Risk, and Enabling Technologies. Enabling Technologies primarily focuses on the design and optimization of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) packages such as SAP solutions. Our team typically works with Fortune 1000 clients across a variety of industries, Manufacturing, Pharma, Energy/Utilities, Transportation, Telecommunications, Entertainment/Media, Oil/Gas, and Consumer Goods/Retail.  Your key responsibilities
 As a Consultant, you'll assist in developing applicable methodologies, tools, approaches, points of view, thought leadership, and accelerators to differentiate EY in the ERP consulting market. You will also participate in large-scale SAP solution implementation engagements in a client-facing capacity and be required to demonstrate functional and technical leadership by helping our clients to collaboratively solve their challenges.
 To qualify, candidates must possess:
 Soft-skills:

 Experience leading clients through new data concepts (Data Stewards, Data Governance, Mock Loads, Data Object Master, Data Owners, etc.)
 Should be a self-starter with excellent verbal and written communication skills. Should be comfortable interfacing with a client on a daily basis. This role requires daily interaction with the client at many levels including executives.
 Strong written and verbal communication, presentation, client service and technical writing skills, coupled with a strong interest in further developing and integrating enterprise domain knowledge with technology skills.
 Effectively team with diverse skills and backgrounds and foster an innovative and inclusive team-oriented work environment.
 Consistently deliver quality client services, driving high-quality work products within the expected timeframes and on budget.
 Ability to challenge stakeholders against SAP industry best practices and propose creative solutions to address business requirements.
 Participated in large-scale SAP client engagements with prior consulting experience and a demonstrated history of driving revenue within existing clients and in developing new prospects at the "C" level of Fortune 500 companies.
 Monitor progress manage risk and ensure key stakeholders are kept informed about progress and expected outcomes. Manage expectations of client service delivery. Stay abreast of current business and industry trends relevant to the client's business.
 A willingness to travel to meet client needs; depending on the project travel may be estimated at 25-75%.


 Hard-skills:

 5-7 years of SAP MDM experience, 3+ E2E implementations,
 Extensive data migration (ETLV) experience and expertise in S/4HANA data migration using SAP Data Services. Knowledge of various S/4 data loading methods (IDOCs, LTMC/LTMOM, LSMW, and custom programs)
 Good understanding of SAP data conversion lifecycle covering data readiness, data conversion design-build-test, mock loads, data validation, data cutover
 Experience of SAP data profiling and cleansing (de-duplication, match/merge, standardization, rationalization)
 Deep knowledge of key SAP objects (e.g MM, BP, Equipment, Functional Locations, BOMs) and working knowledge of a few SAP functional modules:
   
 Record to Report (FI, CO)
 Procure to Pay (MM, IM, EWM)
 Project Systems, Portfolio and Project Management
 Plant Maintenance, Quality Management
 Production Planning, IBP
 HR

 Experience delivering SAP data conversion solutions for Oil, Gas and/or Energy clients is a bonus.


 What we look for
 We’re interested in passionate leaders with a strong vision and a desire to stay on top of trends in the IT Consulting space. If you have a strong passion for helping businesses achieve their IT strategy, this role is for you.
 What we offer  At EY, our Total Rewards package supports our commitment to creating a leading people culture - built on high-performance teaming - where everyone can achieve their potential and contribute to building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. It's one of the many reasons we repeatedly win awards for being a great place to work.
 We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:

 Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
 Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
 The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you


 Diversity and Inclusion at EY  Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We’re committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. From our actions to combat systemic racism and our advocacy for the LGBT+ community to our innovative Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, we welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.

 EY Way of Work and your health and safety  EY Way of Work recognizes flexibility in the way we collaborate, innovate and deliver with the ability to work in-person and remotely. To support a healthy and safe in-person working environment, EY has implemented various layers of health and safety controls while working in the office or at client or other locations. A critical component of EY’s workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy which requires all personnel to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless an accommodation based on a reason protected by human rights legislation is provided  If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Make your mark. Apply today.
 EY is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.

 EY | Building a better working world

 EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

 Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

 Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Title: Compensation & Classification Analyst
Description:
Reporting to the Executive Director, People, and receiving day to day work direction from the Compensation/Classification Advisors, the Compensation & Classification Analyst provides a variety of classification/compensation services in support and maintenance of internal/external compensation and classification records, systems and reporting requirements, contract administration including annual pay and performance adjustments, and the delivery of services to clients across Providence Health Care (PHC) such as assisting with the preparation and classification of job descriptions, organizational charts, and industry-related research activities. 
   Skills Practical knowledge of collective agreements, applicable employment legislation and regulations. 
    Ability to organize work of self, identifying and managing multiple and complex priorities, meet deadlines, and work under pressure with minimum supervision. 
    Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills including business writing skills. 
    Demonstrated ability to effective use Microsoft Office Suite products such as Word, Excel, Power Point, and Outlook at an intermediate to advanced level. 
    Demonstrated use and understanding of HR information systems and applicant hiring systems. Knowledge of PeopleSoft HCM is an asset. 
    Demonstrated ability to use online communication tools such as Skype, Zoom, etc. 
    Ability to work effectively, independently and in collaboration with others. 
    Ability to deal with others effectively, at all levels of the organization. 
    Demonstrated ability to identify, analyze, and resolve problems. 
    Demonstrated ability to utilize a customer service approach to staff and clients. 
    Physical ability to perform the duties of the position. 
   
Education A level of education, training and experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources plus two (2) to three (3) years’ recent related human resources experience including working in a unionized environment, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Previous experience in compensation or benefits is preferred. 
   Duties Maintains and updates Compensation & Classification and Public and Industry Reporting databases such as the CJDD, CRP and LIGER including scanning, uploading, and indexing required documentation and updating/obsoleting of files and data and liaising with applicable agencies on systems changes and updates. 
   
 Functions as a super-user on Compensation & Compensation related systems, identifies and investigates data and system issues, provides systems advice and makes recommendations, develops reports and queries, and works within People Services and other departments to determine the root of the issue and to troubleshoot solutions. Identifies opportunities for service improvement, provides input on changes, drafts processes and guidelines documents, and participates in business process improvement. 
   
 Prepares individual employee contract renewal and reclassification letters for various PHC departments. Liaises with areas such Payroll, Records and Benefits, Recruitment and/or Finance to process, investigate or follow up on queries such as contract terms such as benefit entitlement, vacation accruals, pay adjustments, stipends, retroactive payments, positions numbers, job code updates, etc. 
   
 Assists with the annual processing of pay adjustments for unionized and non-contract staff including sending out appropriate notifications to staff or Managers, working with Sustainment and HR Data Analytics to update HR Connect and PeopleSoft systems, proofing documentation, and reviewing exception reports. Prepares costings of wage increases for review. 
   
 Conducts regular audits of job code table, job inventory, CJDD and other classification and compensation records to ensure accuracy and integrity of data. 
   
 Conducts assigned research on classification and compensation matters such as completion of industry surveys and preparation and distribution of internal surveys. Assists with the completion of costing spreadsheets and reports for grievance liability or pay changes for Finance, HEABC or other stakeholders. 
   
 Updates and maintains Compensation/Classification repositories of job descriptions, information directories, intranet site, and departmental filing systems. 
   
 Prepares job descriptions for specific/designated areas and classifications including conducting job audits if required, preparation of job description including review of qualifications, assignment of classification/evaluation for review by Compensation and Classification Advisor as required. Submits to Union or HEABC as appropriate. 
   
 Assists Compensation and Classification Advisors with responses to Union objections to job descriptions or HEABC queries, by researching appropriate response based on requirements of classification system, clarification of duties and requirements with applicable department/program, and reviewing interpretations and jurisprudence as necessary. 
   
 Provides support and participates in Compensation & Classification projects. Prepares and maintains project tracking documentation, training materials, statistical information and reports. 
   
 Participates in meetings, provides information, and takes action as appropriate. 
   
 Performs other related duties as assigned.

Title: HRIS Analyst
Description:
Closing Date: August 1, 2022



 This is a temporary role for 1 year.

 Reporting to the Manager, People Systems, the HRIS Analyst will apply HR process knowledge and experience to maintain and administer all aspects of the following:

 SAP SuccessFactors HXM
 Global Workforce Analytics (GWA) database powered by the Microsoft Business Intelligence Suite.





 Responsibilities:




 SAP SuccessFactors HXM
 Uphold the application of HR policies, practices, and programs through ongoing maintenance and support of SAP SuccessFactors, including configuration, security authorizations and reporting.
 Assist in the organization, execution, and support of annual projects such as: benefit enrollment, salary review, bonus review, and year-end processes.
 Act as a champion of change and provide HR system consulting services to various corporate and site HR functions such as Compensation, Benefits, Pensions and Payroll.
 Investigate and troubleshoot data and systems issues, coordinating with end users, Information Technology, and vendors as necessary.
 Perform data audits to ensure data integrity.
 Design report specifications and develop and generate routine and ad hoc reports.
 Identify opportunities to leverage HR systems to solve business process challenges.
 Document HRIS processes, procedures, and develop training materials. Provide documentation and/or training to functional units as needed.





 Qualifications:




 Bachelor’s degree in Commerce, Business Management, Computer Science or similar.
 CPHR designation is an asset.
 Minimum of 5 years HR experience, with at least 4 years HR Systems configuration, reporting, training, and testing experience.
 The following systems experience:
      
 SAP SuccessFactors HXM – Employee Central, Learning Management Systems, and Employee Central Benefits
 Excel – advanced (Lookup Functions, Pivot Tables, advanced charting and analysis, Macros)
 Microsoft Visio or similar process mapping tools

 Intermediate knowledge of human resources, payroll, and benefits principles and practices.
 Experience implementing and/or upgrading an HR system (full lifecycle from requirements gathering to aftercare support).
 Experience in a multinational, geographically dispersed company, with union experience an asset.
 Ability to analyze data and apply critical thinking to resolve issues and suggest solutions and improvements.
 Strong planning, project management, and organization skills.
 Customer focused with ability to influence cooperation between vendors, sites, and functions.
 Clear and concise communicator, with experience delivering training.
 Excellent judgment, discretion, and tact. Ability to handle confidential and personal information to ensure compliance with PIPA, PIPEDA, and other regional privacy laws.





 About Teck



 Successful candidates must be fully vaccinated against infection by COVID-19. Candidates who are unable to be vaccinated due to a personal characteristic protected under applicable human rights legislation may request to be exempt from this requirement. We will do our best to accommodate those who are unable to be vaccinated.




 Teck is consistently recognized as a top employer for our commitment to a healthy and positive work environment. Our team is focused on fostering a workplace where everyone is included, valued and equipped for the future. In 2021, Teck was proud to be selected as one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers for four years in a row, and also named as one of Canada’s Top Employers for Young People. In 2020, Teck was named to Forbes World’s Best Employers List and in 2021, we were recognized in Forbes Canada’s Best Employers 2021 List.  Teck is a diversified resource company committed to responsible mining and mineral development with major business units focused on copper, steelmaking coal, zinc and energy. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, its shares are listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbols TECK.A and TECK.B and the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TECK.

Title: Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS) Analyst
Description:
The Sudbury Catholic District School Board is located in Northeastern Ontario and serves approximately 6,000 students in 18 schools located in Greater Sudbury, as well as in Markstay and Killarney. Greater Sudbury is 3,627 square kilometers in area, making it the geographically largest municipality in Ontario and second largest in Canada. Greater Sudbury is considered a city of lakes, containing 330 lakes and the largest lake contained within a city, Lake Wanapitei.
Our School Board is host to and celebrates diverse cultures and is comprised of dedicated staff committed to high quality education that inspires and promotes lifelong learning. The Board is currently seeking an HRIS Analyst to join our dynamic team.
Reporting to the Senior Manager of Human Resources, the HRIS Analyst is primarily responsible for collecting, analyzing, and maintaining Human Resources software and data in conjunction with Human Resources Services and Information Management Services. The HRIS Analyst will serve as the main point of contact for end user support and configuring the HRIS and related systems for various projects, as well as supporting Human Resource Services in Human Resource related matters.
ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS
Education / Certification:

Post-secondary degree/diploma in Human Resources Management, Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Analytics, or equivalent in training as determined by the Board
Ministry of Labour “Worker Health & Safety Awareness in 4 Steps” training certificate

Experience Required:

3-5 years of HRIS experience in a Human Resources or HRIS Analyst capacity

Knowledge / Skills / Abilities:

Expert in Human Resources Information Systems, report writing
Expert level skills required in Microsoft Excel
Proficiency with other MS Office tools (Word, Outlook, PowerPoint etc.) and database management systems
Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to summarize information concisely and present in written, graphical and/or verbal format, to covey complex information to all levels of stakeholders
Demonstrated experience building working relationships and providing exemplary customer service to multiple stakeholders
Strong quantitative, analytical and problem-solving skills
Demonstrated experience in project management and organizational skills
Capable of making decisions within guidelines and policies
Ability to meet restrictive deadlines, and manage competing priorities
Ability to maintain a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail; skilled in manipulating data
Well-developed interpersonal skills and the ability to work both independently and within a team environment
Demonstrated experience interpreting employment legislation and collective agreements in a multi-union environment
Working knowledge of relevant legislation, including the Ontario Labour Relations Act, the Human Rights Code, the Employment Standards Act and the Municipal Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Information Technology education/experience is preferred
Certified Human Resources Professional/Leader (CHRP/CHRL) and/or Payroll Compliance Practitioner (PCP) designation considered an asset
Working knowledge of the Education Act and its regulations
Knowledge of School Board policies and procedures, TPP, OMERS, Ontario College of Teachers, Basic and Additional Qualifications

The successful candidate will be required to produce a satisfactory police record check: Vulnerable Sector Check.
The annual salary range for this position is $66,468 to $83,092 with a comprehensive benefit package.
For more information on this opportunity and working for the Sudbury Catholic District School Board, please contact Human Resources services for the fully detailed job description and visit the board website. Qualified applicants apply online at sudburycatholicschools.simplication.com. Please attach a cover letter and resume, including the contact information for three professional references, by 12:00 p.m., July 21, 2022.
As part of its commitment to equity, diversity and inclusivity, the Sudbury Catholic District School Board encourages and welcomes applications from individuals ofequity-seeking populations.
All applicants are thanked for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
