Title: Sr. Consultant, Application Development (Cognos BI)
Description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
 


   At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
 


   To learn more about CIBC, please visit 
  
   CIBC.com
  



   Job Description
 


   What you'll be doing
 


   You’ll be joining CIBC’s CRM, Corporate & Investment Banking, Finance and Adjudication Technology| Capital Markets Technology ,TI&I . You’ll be at the heart of CIBC’s digital transformation, successfully delivering complex, enterprise-scale mobile projects involving multiple back-end systems. As an Application Consultant, you’ll assemble, implement and maintain easy, flexible, and personalized solutions that enhance the client experience across both iOS and Android. You’ll lead the planning and strategy for the technical design, development and integration of these applications.
 


   How you'll succeed
 



     Design and development - Perform and coordinate complicated application programming activities. Design the application's technical infrastructure using specific databases, programming languages, utilities, and testing approaches. Lead the design and development of cost-effective and innovative solutions.
   


     Strategic planning - Develop multi-year technology roadmaps that align with the bank’s vision, strategy, and business goals. Lead multiple complicated projects involving backend systems, new technology, and the enhancement of existing applications.
   


     Leadership skills - Act as the mobile development team lead and run code-review sessions with the wider team to ensure the project is on track to meet goals. Support and mentor intermediate and senior developers by sharing knowledge, collaborating and problem solving.
   



   Who you are
 



     You embrace and advocate change. You'll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
   


     Your influence makes a difference. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by sharing your expertise.
   


     You’re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
   


     You're motivated by collective success. You know that teamwork can transform a good idea into a great one. You know that an inclusive team that enjoys working together can bring a vision to life.
   


     You can demonstrate experience in:
   

     Analysis, Design Development and support of Business Intelligence Projects at enterprise level.
   


     Expertise on a range of Data warehousing products and Cognos BI.
   


     Solid experience in Migrating BI Projects from other BI tools like Cognos to Tableau or Power BI will be a focual point.
   


     Proficient in Framework Manager Modeling (Database Layer, Intermediate Layer, Presentation Layer, Packages) and Complex Report building with Report Studio
   


     Strong experience in Cognos administration; starting up and shutting down the servers for maintenance purpose, setting up security groups and cognos roles.
   


     Experience in Migrating reports between different versions of ognos BI and Analytics.
   


     Strong experience in using 3rd party tools like Motio and BSP Metamanager to ease the administration of Cognos BI.
   


     Exposure to Cognos environments with Fix packs and Service packs and configuration of Cognos servers both in windows and Linux environments.
   


     Experience in integration of Cognos and Salesforce for the purpose of Report Development.
   


     Strong experience with MDX Functions in Report Studio using Multi-dimensional Sources.
   


     Experienced with Multiple Relational Databases including Oracle, MS SQL Server, Teradata and DB2
   


     Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.
   



   What CIBC offers
 


   At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.
 



     We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program
   


     Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients
   


     We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development
   



   What you need to know
 



     CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact 
    
     Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
    



     You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.
   



   Job Location
  Toronto-CC East 13th Floor
 
   Employment Type
  Regular
 

   Weekly Hours
  37.5
 
   Skills
 
 Application Development, Business Requirements, Functional Designs, Solutions Development, Technical Consulting

Title: CRM Analyst
Description:
Company Description
  Laura Canada is an iconic and innovative family-owned retailer housing two leading women’s fashion apparel brands, Laura and Melanie Lyne. Based in Laval, Quebec, we design, produce, market and distribute quality apparel across Canada. We proudly employ over 2,000 dedicated team members and operate more than 140 locations and two online stores. We attribute our success to the unwavering commitment of our team to delivering outstanding customer experiences while embodying our shared values of integrity, respect, teamwork, performance, and passion.
 At Laura Canada, we believe that delivering an outstanding customer experience is driven by our commitment to an outstanding employee experience.



 Job Description
  The CRM Analyst is responsible for the implementation and development of CRM and digital analytics solutions across Laura and Melanie Lyne websites. They will play both a technical and strategic role across our organization. They will shape the future of online and offline marketing efforts by providing key analyses on a variety of business metrics.
 1. CRM Analysis

 Provides multi-channel (direct mail, email, social, paid media, affiliates, etc.) analysis of marketing campaigns including ROI reports and other KPIs.
 Provides customer-specific statistical reports, as required.
 Prepares and distributes various daily, weekly and monthly CRM reports, as required.
 Performs the maintenance and reporting of all loyalty programs and provides assistance when needed.
 Works with the email team to setup marketing automation communications and manages all related dataflow required.
 Develops and presents clear and comprehensive findings/recommendations to leadership on key analytical initiatives.
 Integrates existing analytical tools (segmentations, models, etc.) into analytical deliverables, manipulates, analyzes, and interprets data from different sources.

 2. Database Maintenance

 Subject matter expert on the data sources contained in the customer database and how they can be leveraged to address business challenges and opportunities.
 Verifies and processes all incoming sales, merchandise, employee, email, store and customer information into CRM system. Ensures all internal processes related to CRM are running correctly.
 Performs various database maintenance functions.

 3. Internal Customer Support

 Assists in CRM/Analytical-related IT projects.
 Assists all other departments with CRM/Analytics-related requests.




 Qualifications
 

 University degree with a minimum three (3) years of experience performing and leading digital and CRM analytics.
 Expert in site analytics tools implementation and development, in particular Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager
 Experience with behavioral, funnel, cohort, checkout and attribution analysis as well as A/B testing in an eCommerce context
 Experience with data integration (FTP, API, email) and data modeling in a web analytics context is an asset.
 Experience with the Google Marketing Platform products (Adwords, DCM, DBM) and their integration within the Google Analytics suite is an asset.
 Experience using a CRM data tool like Aptos
 Proficient in Microsoft Excel/Google Sheets and Microsoft PowerPoint/Google Slides
 Has a true passion for analyzing data.
 Has developed project management skills.
 Strong interest and knowledge of the fashion industry (brands, designers, customers)
 Bilingualism

 Additional Information
  At Laura Canada, there are no limits to what you can achieve - come see for yourself!
 To know more about the Company, visit https://www.lauracanada.ca/en/.

Title: Senior Analyst, PC Optimum Portfolio Management
Description:
At Loblaw Digital, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experiences, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. Loblaw Digital is the team responsible for building and operating the online businesses of Canada’s largest and most successful retailer. Based in downtown Toronto, we are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, and collaborative team working towards transforming the way Canadians shop by creating leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, loyalty, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started! To achieve these goals, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to collaborate and solve challenging problems and make significant and lasting impact on Canadians.
 


 Working with the Loyalty team is about making a difference. Customers rely on the PC Optimum program to help them balance their budgets as well as find inspiration. They seek out the score of offsetting grocery bills and the satisfaction of treating themselves to the latest health and beauty trends. We are committed to being the most engaging and rewarding program in the world by making everyday shopping more easy, personal, rewarding and fun
 


 The PC Optimum team is responsible for growing our best-in-class Loyalty program, which currently touches tens of millions of customers across Canada. To continue driving the program forward, we are seeking a Senior Analyst who will be responsible for leading and supporting new initiatives for the program to drive member engagement and acquisition. Leveraging a solid understanding of business strategy and loyalty programs as well as customer data/analytics, this individual will be the strategy lead/support pushing forward new initiatives for PC Optimum. They are expected to lead projects collaboratively with cross functional teams (Marketing, Digital, Research, Operations, Data Analytics).
 


 You will : 




  Extract meaningful insights to develop strategy to solve sometimes ambiguous business/customer problems
 

   Build presentations to clearly articulate insights, while simplifying complex data and processes for various levels of audiences including senior management
 

   Deep dive into customer journeys to understand and empathize with customer pain points and identify opportunities with respect to customer engagement, business strategy, and experience with our Loyalty program
 

   Work with data teams to extract data to develop actionable insights
 

   Synthesize large amounts of data from multiple sources, including customer transaction data, consumer & syndicated research, market share, and campaign results.
 

   Lead projects collaboratively across cross-functional pods of Loblaw Digital, Marketing, Loblaw Technology, DI&A, Operations, and the Customer COE to see strategy through to execution
 

   Develop short term and long-term strategies paired with realistic go to market executional plans that is centered in customer centricity.
 

   Support the execution of loyalty initiatives/strategies at Loblaws, analyze results, and loop back on how to improve
 


 You have:



 An open mind for new ideas and processes- everyone is heard
 

   A collaborative roll-up-our-sleeves mentality
 

   A penchant for the “why not”
 


 Does this sound like you?



 A passion for advocating for the customer and helping teams deliver exceptional customer experience
 

   The ability to collect data, define problems, form complex queries, establish facts and draw valid and actionable conclusions
 

   Killer communication skills. You write well. You speak eloquently. You can explain just about anything to anyone, and you’re comfortable communicating in writing and on the phone
 

   The motivation to learn and constantly improve processes and tools
 

   Sensational organization skills. You thrive on everything having a place and keeping the team accountable and on track The people skills required to work with and influence cross functional teams
 

   A love for problem solving. You like taking on difficult challenges and finding creative solutions. You don’t get flustered easily. If you don’t know the answer, you’ll dig until you find it
 

   A talent for detail. As far as you’re concerned, anything worth doing is worth doing right, every single time. You stay focused and nothing falls through the cracks on your watch
 

   University degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Business, or other relevant fields
 

   1-3 years of experience in strategy and/or product management within loyalty, retail, CPG, Consulting, financial institution company
 


 How you’ll succeed



 At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce. You will get to work with some of the best digital minds and will have the support of world class technologies to craft products our customers will love!
 


 Loblaw Digital recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired. In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

Title: Senior Analyst Program Funding
Description:
Job Description: 
 
 Senior Analyst Program Funding 


2 Contract Full-time positions- Duration: Approximately eighteen (18) months


 Human Services- Early Years and Child Care Services



 The Role…..





  Providing expert guidance and advice on the development and implementation of funding programs, policies and processes for the Early Years and Child Care (EYCC) system in Peel.
 


 You will be accountable for…..


 Supporting the strategic oversight of EYCC system funding distribution and reconciliation processes for licensed child care providers and EarlyON agencies in Peel. 
Supporting the development of innovative program requirements, application processes and guidelines, reporting protocols and risk management frameworks appropriate to various types of funding programs.
 Supporting the strategic oversight of the EYCC budget to ensure it is aligned with provincial and local direction, program requirements and expected outcomes. 
Preparing information for program reporting requirements and ensure program policies and procedures are consistent with provincial and regional policy and funding administration guidelines.
 Developing various tools, processes, methodologies and reporting practices for EYCC funding and recommend and implement changes as necessary to reflect the changing landscape of the EYCC system in Peel. 
Conducting on-site funding reviews of child care and early years program providers and report preparation to ensure proper use of public funds.
 Coordinating and preparing documentation for the annual operating budgets and Education Finance Information System (EFIS) reporting to the province ensuring consistency with provincial and regional funding policies and guidelines.
 Providing strategic analysis and business practices expertise, consultation and advisory services that will assist in decision-making and inform policy and program development. 
Developing frameworks and performing analysis to ensure that funded EYCC agencies are in compliance with program requirements and other similar agreements, standards, guidelines and relevant legislation/regulations.
 Supporting the development, implementation and ongoing maintenance of an internal funds management technology system for funding management and evaluation.
 Liaising with the Corporate Financial Services Unit on program analysis and reporting issues and projects.



 Qualifications:


 A university degree/diploma in Finance- Accounting, Business, Math, Statistics, Computer Science or a related field with at least five years of related work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience including at least two years of experience in an analyst role 
Strong analytical, math and critical thinking skills
 Advanced skills in MS Excel and other data analysis tools (MS Access, etc.).
 Experience with applied research, policy analysis, organizational learning, program design and evaluation
 Advanced knowledge of funding distribution, budgeting and costing
 Strong project management and organizational skills
 Strong problem-solving skills and able to identify and respond quickly to emerging issues.
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills to communicate complex ideas and present data
 Ability to demonstrate innovative thinking and initiative and a “self-starting” attitude to initiate projects
 Highly collaborative with strong interpersonal skills and a demonstrated customer service focus
 Experience with auditing and report writing 
Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) designation is an asset
 Knowledge of early years and child care funding programs is an asset
 Familiarity with the Education Financial Information System (EFIS) is an asset

 Location: In this role you will have the ability to work remotely and attend on-site when required based on operational requirements at 10 Peel Centre Drive, Barmpton. The frequency of on-site activities may vary on a weekly basis and based on operational requirements. Your remote work location must be located within the province of Ontario.
 Hours Of Work: 35 hours/week The Region of Peel offers job based flexible hours of work that allows employees to manage personal and professional responsibilities while at the same time ensures business operational needs and customer service expectations are achieved.
 Interview: Our recruitment process will be completed with video conference technology.


 If this opportunity matches your qualifications and experience, please apply on-line.



 As part of the Region’s ongoing commitment to health and safety, there are enhanced Covid-19 specific safety protocols and/or personal protective equipment requirements (e.g. masks, eye protection, etc.) in place to help protect health and safety. The additional requirements are determined based on the nature of the work being carried out.




 New employees who commence employment on or after October 1, 2021 are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Being fully vaccinated is determined as the status of having received the full series of approved vaccines (both doses of a two dose vaccine series, one dose of a single dose vaccine series) and any additional doses required and approved by Health Canada and having satisfied the full post vaccination period required to ensure vaccination efficacy. The Region of Peel reserves the right to request proof of vaccination at any time. Acceptable proof includes an Ontario Ministry of Health COVID-19 vaccine receipt which you can obtain through the Provincial portal 
https://covid19.ontariohealth.ca/
, or other government-issued vaccine passport or certification.



 The requirement to be fully vaccinated is subject to the Ontario 
Human Rights Code. If you are not fully vaccinated
, a documented medical reason provided by a physician or registered nurse and time period for the medical reason may be accepted.

 About Us: 
  The Region of Peel serves more than 1.4 million residents and approximately 173,000 businesses in Brampton, Caledon and Mississauga. We deliver a wide range of resident focused services across the Region. 
Our 20-year vision for Peel is “Community for Life.” Our goal is to create a place where everyone enjoys a sense of belonging and has access to the services and opportunities needed to thrive in each stage of their lives. Our 2015-2035 Strategic Plan outlines the work we're focused on to bring this vision to life.
 To learn more about the Region of Peel, explore peelregion.ca.
 Additional Information: 
 
   The Region of Peel is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone is respected and valued for their contributions, and where everyone is treated fairly and has opportunity to grow and develop. As one of the most diverse regions in Canada, we are committed to establishing a qualified workforce that is reflective of the population we serve.
 


 The Region of Peel is committed to providing accommodations throughout the recruitment process, upon request. If you require accommodation please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs. Accessible formats and communication supports are available. Please contact zzg-hrtalentacquisition@peelregion.ca. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.
 


 Please be advised, the Region of Peel uses email to communicate with their applicants for open job competitions. It is the applicant’s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e. testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the position and your application will be removed from the competition.

Title: Accounting Analyst, Scotia Leasing - Canadian Business Banking
Description:
Requisition ID: 158020  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Accounting Analyst, Scotia Leasing, Canadian Business Banking

 Purpose

 Reporting to the Assistant Manager Finance, the Accounting Analyst is responsible for the timely and accurate accounting of the Scotia Leasing portfolios. In In this role, you will perform numerous time sensitive accounting functions including completion of daily cash accounting, daily posting and daily accounting packages. In addition, the incumbent is required to prepare all journal entries, account reconciliations, maintain the general ledger, manage the month-end close process, prepare month end financial reports, and provide information required by Bank of Nova Scotia Taxation.

 A complete working knowledge of established accounting standards, specialized lease accounting principles, accounting procedures and internal controls for the department in accordance with IFRS and accounting standards, is required.

 Accountabilities


 Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.



 Responsible for the maintenance of the Scotia Leasing General Ledger in accordance with Accounting standards and the Bank's policies and procedures by:

  Maintaining the chart of accounts and account mapping to the internal financial reports and the Banks General Ledger.  Maintaining the trial balance for Scotia Leasing and "ownership" of the accounting system using ACCPAC.  Understanding the breadth of product offerings in Scotia Leasing that require specialized accounting knowledge of lease accounting.


 Responsible for all cash accounting and daily accounting procedures including:

  Balancing 100% of transactions in ACCPAC to physical funding requests.  Updating general ledger from multiple data sources, trial balance and regional accounts.  Preparing the daily accounting package for review and approval by the Assistant Manager Finance.  Preparing account activity analysis and complete account reconciliations.  Booking FX deals for Scotia Leasing using ScotiaFX platform.  Reviewing and auditing payout statements received from Portfolio Management team.  Accurately preparing the PST/GST/HST accounting and sales tax schedules/reporting required by BNS Taxation.  Preparing monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reporting for Scotia Leasing and Canadian Banking-Finance.  Liaising with Canadian Banking Finance, Taxation, Executive, external and internal auditors and others as required to provide and obtain information  Preparation of cash accounting journal entries for approval by the Assistant Manager Finance.  Processing a variety of transactions in multiple currencies within time constraints / daily deadlines.  Processing pre-authorized payments (“PAP”) and debit memo's and account for all returned PAP and cheques.


 Responsible for the month-end accounting close and preparation of internal financial reports including:

  Completing all recurring journal entries for posting.  Preparing the control checklist for approval.  Managing the update of the general ledger.  Processing monthly trial balance and prepare the related worksheet underlying the detailed P&L.  Ensuring all control accounts are reconciled to the monthly extract from Infolease including but not limited to: Net investment in leases; Finance Income; Fee Income; Non-interest income; and Interest Expense.  Working independently to solve day-to-day problems in accounting.


 Provide Backup to Assistant Manager, Finance by:

  Liaising with Commercial Banking-Customer Experience, Canadian Banking-Finance, Taxation, external and internal auditors and others, as required, to provide and obtain information.  Assisting in the preparation of monthly financial and management reporting.  Assisting with audits and implementing all financial and accounting controls.  Assisting with performing the daily close of the G/L based on nightly job stream processing in Infolease.  Assisting with balancing the sub-ledger (Infolease) to the G/L for all lease accounting.  Assisting with the preparation of year-end CCA report and associated reconciliations.  Assisting in special projects as required.


 Provide excellent customer service, meeting Bank's Scotia Service Standards by:

  Responding quickly and accurately to inquiries from Management, support units, customers, suppliers and other Bank departments.  Resolving transaction issues in accordance with Service Standards and/or escalating when necessary.  Maintaining the confidentiality of information and ensuring security of data and applications  Ensuring that all reporting deadlines are met.  Escalating any major issues or problems to the Assistant Manager, Finance for resolution.


 Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.



 Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.



 Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.



Education / Experience / Other Information:


 Minimum 5 years’ experience working in an Accounting/Finance Environment
University degree and working towards a recognized Accounting designation preferable (CMA, CGA, or CA)
Banking/financial/leasing experience highly desirable
Knowledge of GAAP, IFRS, CCA classes, Taxation (Federal and Provincial), banking regulations and issues involving Leasing/Lending Products, Lease &/or Loan Accounting
Experience using FFT, BESS wire payment system, ScotiaConnect
Strong computer skills (Windows, Excel (Advanced proficiency level preferred), Word, GL systems (e.g., ACCPAC), lease application systems and other application systems desirable)



Strong inter-personal communication skills. Ability to effectively interface and work effectively in a team environment required.
Strong problem-solving skills, customer service skills and ability to work independently and efficiently to meet deadlines, in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to multi-task
Ability to work non-standard work hours as required


 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Business System Analyst Loyalty,CRM,Clienteling,CDP
Description:
Location: TORONTO, Ontario, Canada 
   

Category: The Bay Technology
   



Job Opened: July 12th, 2022 
   

Education: Bachelor's Degree 
   



Job Number: 220003NC 
   

Job Type: Full-Time
   



Remote: Yes 
   



job description
 Day In The Life:
As a Business System Analyst for Loyalty, CRM, Clientelling & CDP, you will focus on gathering and documenting business requirements for the Loyalty/CRM/Clienteling team. You will engage business and IT stakeholders to plan, elicit, analyze, document and validate system requirements that meet business needs. Working with a solution architect, and other business analysts, developers, and engineers from cross-functional teams, you will leverage an analytical approach to understand the current business process, perform gap analysis, assess options, and propose the solution design, using Agile methodology.
The successful candidate will analyze the business requirements for the Project and Convert them into Business Rules, Business Processes, Activity diagrams, use-case, detailed Technical requirements, and system goals and pass it to cross-functional and relevant teams like OMS, POS, Data, Middleware etc. This individual will also act as liaison between product business owners and technical staff. They will have led multiple projects through scope/discovery, estimation, development, implementation, and post deployment support with the ability to influence solution design.


What You Will Do:

Perform application system analysis, prepare data flow diagrams and design screen/report layouts as part of business systems solution/application design
Responsible for solving complex business issues, which requires critical thinking and thinking outside the box
Documents all processes, changes, and solutions
Develop, coordinate, execute and perform in-depth tests, including system, unit testing, and functional testing
Communicate in weekly/biweekly status, showing progress against outstanding milestones., status, issues, risks and dependencies
Manage day to day Change Requests
Administer and participate in system integration and supports acceptance testing
Assist project team in presenting an application/solution Context to IT & User interface teams
Assist users in developing conversion and implementation procedures
Assist project team in presenting an application/solution Context to IT & User interface team
Assist users in developing conversion and implementation procedures
Develop systems context with Integration/ Technical Developers
Analytical approach and techniques used to understand business problem/requirement and propose recommended solutions
Develop a clearly defined and agreed upon project functional and non-functional requirements and translate business requirements to technical specifications for development
Work with Project Managers and Developers to define project scope and objectives based on business needs and industry standard
Balancing user community needs/requirements with project schedule and IT resources available to determine system design


 
What You Will Need:

4 year college degree /university
Have considerable experience in Loyalty, CRM, CDP in E-commerce / Retail Set-up
QA testing experience required
Experience leading meetings and gathering requirements
Strong oral/written communication skills
Strong analytical/organizational skills
Time management when involved in multiple projects of complex nature
Functional expertise - Customer Selling Channels - POS Retail, POS Banking, Pricing, Promotional/Loyalty program
Omni Channel * Mobile - Customer experience exposure
Working Knowledge of SQL, UML, Databases, Digital systems and a good understanding of IT practices and methodologies
MS Office - PM, Visio, PowerPoint
Test Tools (Exposure)
Retail – POS, Payments, Pricing, Loyalty - store systems
Planning and estimating techniques
Strong System Analysis Skills - Functional



What You Can Expect:

A People-first culture where One Team spirit and Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion are celebrated and promoted at every step of the way
An opportunity to work with highly supportive teams to help you build the career you want and leave your Stripe at The Bay
A competitive benefits package including unlimited paid vacation, medical, dental, vision, parental leave top up coverages, retirement savings and more
A ways of Working Program that enables you to work where you are most effective
A living Well Program that provides a variety of offerings and resources to enhance your physical, mental, and financial wellness, including corporate gym membership rates.
An amazing associate discount of up to 40% off top brands


 
About The Bay:
As Canada’s oldest startup, The Bay is a digital-first, purpose-led retailer. Our mission is to help Canadians live their best style of life. 
The Bay is on a high-growth trajectory to become one of the largest digital retail businesses in Canada through TheBay.com and its Marketplace. If you are looking to join an iconic brand, create impactful change and be recognized for your work, we want you to join our team. 
At The Bay, smart, high-performing team members will challenge you to learn and grow every day. We value ambitious work and great ideas grounded in data and insights. We are looking for talented people who love a fast-paced environment, embrace change and are looking to make an impact with groundbreaking ideas.
We are a digital-first company and brand for a diverse world and we need a diverse team to reach our potential. Come and join a winning team that supports collaboration and demonstrates innovation, energy, creativity and vision every day.


Interested in Social Media?
Follow us on LinkedIn & Instagram


NOTE: Only applications submitted online will be accepted.
The Bay welcomes all applicants for this position; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
 Thank you for your interest In The Bay. We look forward to reviewing your application. 
The Bay provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, The Bay complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
The Bay welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used

Title: Business Intelligence College Instructor
Description:

Monday to Sunday (Schedule may vary depending on business needs).

$41 - will vary depending on schedule ( i.e. : weekends)

Fall 2022 semester. (September 2022)
PRIMARY DUTIES
Canada College Inc. is an educational institution offering college programs (Attestations of Collegial Studies) and language programs. It is a very well-known test center for internationally recognized tests (IELTS and TEF/TEFAQ). To make an impact in the world of education, Canada College Inc. always seeks partnerships with the business world, other educational institutions and community establishments. Canada College Inc. is seeking a Business Intelligence Instructor to join our team. The candidate will teach Business courses using high-impact practices to diverse student populations at our Downtown campuses. Instructors are expected to create a dynamic learning environment that emphasizes student success.
Teaching responsibilities will include but not limited to:

Instruct and help students learn. Provide academic assistance in a variety of learning situations.
Develop, modify, and continuously improve course plans, curricula, evaluation procedures and instruments.
Prepare and maintain all course-related records including evaluation and attendance and submit information as required.
Identify, prepare, and organize course material and learning resources for course delivery.
Assist new instructors when required.
Attend all departmental and pedagogical meetings.
Other related duties

REQUIREMENTS 

Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and French
Expert knowledge of and practical experience using BI solutions in PowerBI, Python and SQL.
Strong understanding of data engineering, data modelling and architecture concepts.
Expertise in building custom BI reports and analytical solutions with PowerBI.
Solid understanding of modern database technologies, data modelling techniques and underlying infrastructure.
Experience in Advanced SQL development and proficient in creating DAX and MDX queries, and the creation of reports, data sets, and dashboards using SSRS and Power BI.
Knowledge and experience in prototyping, designing, and requirement analysis.

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s degree in the related field or equivalent. Master’s degree (Asset).
2-5 years of work experience in the related field. Business Intelligence (Preferred).
Teaching experience (preferred).

We encourage and welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds and people with disabilities who have the qualifications to apply.

Title: BI Senior Analyst / Developer
Description:
For Current Agropur Employees:
                                      

                                        Please apply for this job through the Career application of your 
                                       
                                        Workday Home Page.
                                       








































   Job Type:
  Regular
 

   Working at Agropur means choosing a committed employer who invests daily to give its employees the means to develop professionally. It is also means being part of a large family where simplicity and honesty are lived on a daily basis and where the management style is based on integrity, openness and autonomy. Invest in yourself and join Agropur to realize your full potential.
 


   As a technical expert, the BI Senior Analyst / Developer works with Business Analysts to understand the organization's objectives and the business metrics that are required. The analyst actively tracks stakeholder needs and develops technical solutions to meet those needs in the form of reports and decision-making support tools.
 


   The BI Senior Analyst / Developer is a key player in a dynamic team that supports key users in Agropur’s various departments. The analyst develops partnerships to leverage his or her expertise and diligently executes various of Agropur business intelligence (BI) projects independently.
 


   This role is responsible for the architecture and development of enhancements to data and analytical (D&A) systems, providing level-2 support to more than 100 users.
 


   More specifically, the BI Senior Analyst / Developer:
 



     Makes note of and understands the needs of stakeholders across the organization and translates their needs into technical solutions
   


     Proposes and designs optimized and automated solutions
   


     Analyzes, models and designs data extraction and manipulation (ETL) solutions
   


     Acts as an expert and a technical resource for BI systems
   


     Ensures data validity and report access via our BI tools
   


     Remains on the lookout for new technologies and proposes innovative solutions
   



   Requirements
 



     Bachelor’s degree in Information Science, Industrial Engineering or another relevant field
   


     At least seven (7 ) years of experience designing and deploying data models with process descriptions of their structure, associations, and relationships, as well as the constraints of the available data
   


     Excellent knowledge of ETL platforms
   


     Excellent knowledge of databases and SQL language
   


     Excellent knowledge of data modeling
   


     Experience with SAP, SAP Analytics Cloud, AWS, Snowflake, Python
   


     Is curious and motivated to learn new BI tools and programming languages
   


     Strong oral and written communication skills

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Company: Pages Jaunes Solutions Numériques et Médias Limitée
Description:
Colleagues you’ll love.
 A dynamic and collaborative workplace where you can contribute to our story.
 Comprehensive benefits from day one.
 This is the #YPLife and what working at YP is all about.
 What is a Business Intelligence Developer at Yellow Pages?
 Want to contribute to the development and prosperity of local small and medium-sized businesses? Welcome to Yellow Pages! As a Google Premium Partner and Facebook Marketing Partner, Yellow Pages is a leader in digital marketing for companies across Canada.
 You will have to provide business intelligence knowledge and support linked to organizational performance of the attainment of corporate objectives. The developer is expected to make use, apply models, interpret and educate on the company data and information systems.
 Responsibilities:

 Analyse source system data and develop ETL packages
 Interface with business users to assist them with ad hoc requests and understanding BI data structures
 Preform support duties
 Navigate code from existing applications and learn them with minimal assistance
 Become familiar with various data sources and their application in order to define the data needs.
 Open to learning new innovative technologies and upgrading knowledge on existing ones

 What do you need to be a Business Intelligence Developer at Yellow Pages?
 Qualifications:

 Bachelors degree in quantitative studies, business administration, business intelligence or Management Information Systems or equivalent.
 Highly familiar with Microsoft BI Stack (SQL, Sql Server, SSIS, SSRS, Power BI)
 5+ years of related experience in data analysis, decision-making support and business intelligence.
 Supervisory experience is an asset.
 Bilingualism an asset

 Nice to have:

 Results-oriented.
 Customer focus.
 Negotiating skills (both within a team and with customers).
 Ability to make decisions and justify them.
 Open-minded.
 Open to change.
 Strong problem-solving skills.
 Ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team, environment.
 Effective verbal and written communication skills; excellent interpersonal skills.

 You are ready to join the Yellow Pages adventure as a Business Intelligence Developer? Send us your resume right now.
 About Yellow Pages
 We’ve been in the game since 1908 and we continue to transform to offer our 125 000 clients the best possible products and services. We foster business relationships between Canadian small-to-medium businesses and their prospective customers. We do this by providing tailored, locally-relevant digital media and marketing solutions designed with both in mind. Over 76% of our revenue is generated by digital solutions.
